Luzviminda is just starting this business.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena, tiene 34 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos (Luisa de 10 años y Yoshiro de 4 años), ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la distribución de productos como por ejemplo papa, maíz, habas, ella distribuye sus productos tres veces a la semana al mercado central del Cusco llamado “San Pedro”. Sus actividades económicas complementarias son la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, chanchos, gallinas, patos y cuyes. Primero los cría, los alimenta y después los vende en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Ella también se dedica a la producción de queso 

Rosa Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar animales como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes y conejos. 

Rosa Elena se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.  

Rosa Elena pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa.  (En la fotografía Rosa esta acompañada de su hijo Yoshiro)
texts.en:
Rosa Elena is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children (Luisa aged 10 and Yoshiro aged 4 years). She lives in the Inquilpata area of the Anta district in the town of Cusco. Her main line of work is in the selling of produce, for example, potatoes, corn, beans, and she does this three times a week in Cusco’s main market, called ‘San Pedro’. Complementary lines of work in which she is involved include the purchasing, raising, and selling of small animals such as sheep, pigs, chickens, ducks and guinea pigs. Rosa Elena raises the animals and then sells them at Inquilpata-Anta’s Local Country Community Fair on Fridays. She is also involved in cheese production. Rosa Elena is a hard working entrepreneur who tries to make the most of things on a daily basis, and help her family. She requires a loan to purchase more animals such as sheep, guinea pigs and rabbits. Rosa Elena is thankful for the opportunity provided by this loan and is committed to the loan repayment terms. She belongs to the community bank ‘Virgen María de Inquilpata’ of the Arariwa Association. (Photograph shows Rosa accompanied by her son, Yoshiro)

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa Elena is requesting the loan in order to purchase animals such as sheep, guinea pigs, and rabbits.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells foodstuffs like yams, plantains, vegetables and fruits. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has been in this business for long. 

She needs the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell

loans.name: Kasanja Basooka Kwavula, Mubende Group

texts.en:
At the top left in the small photo is K. Isaaya, the group leader. He also appears in the group photo.

A determined and very hard working K. Isaaya, aged 47 years, is the married father of ten children and three helpless dependents. He has operated a retail shop business for sixteen years in Kibutamu, Mubende District, selling general merchandise. At the end of every week he is able to pocket profits to the tune of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from his shop and 150,000 shillings from farming.

Isaaya’s main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in his business that cannot match the consumption rate of his customers. He is therefore seeking a loan that he figures will help him stock more goods to satisfy his customers’ high demand and also transform his enterprise into a wholesale business in future.

Being very committed to his business, with good customer care, Isaaya hopes to increase his sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in his business and enable him to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for his family’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kimsreng Tuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of twelve people who live in Krapeu Ha-I village in Kandal province. E. member will use his or her portion of the loan for different business improvement purposes. 

Mrs. Kimsreng T., age 49, is the village bank president selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Theng, offer tailoring services out of their hoM.. This allows thE. to earn money to support their family. Since their business is going well, they want to expand their services. 

In order to improve their business, Mrs. Kimsreng T. is seeking a loan to buy fabric to make clothes for their customers. They have two children, one of whom is a beautician. The other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes for their customers

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.en: Muqaddas S. is a 47 year old man who has been selling different kinds of food in his own shop since 2007. He is married and has three children. Muqaddas`s monthly income is 300 AZN and he would like to increase it to 500 AZN. For this purpose, he applied for 600 AZN and will use this loan to buy more merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to increase his income.

loans.name: Jesus Cristobal

texts.es:
Jesús de 46 años, es mecánico y vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), tiene tres hijos y su esposa es profesora de una escuela. 

Para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar desde joven como mecánico, con esfuerzo a podido construir su casa y mantener a su familia, ahora también esta trabajando como conserje en sus ratos libes para tener mas ingresos. 

Para construir mejor su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y arena. En el futuro el quiere aumentar su casa con un segundo piso y así darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jesús is 46 years old and works as a mechanic. He lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area outside of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem). Jesús has three children and his wife works as a schoolteacher.

Due to the lack of opportunities he faced as a young man, he had to work as a mechanic in order to support his family. With effort he was able to build a house and provide what his family needed. Now he also works as a janitor in his spare time to earn additional income.

To build the best home he can, Jesús wants to buy cement and sand. In the future, he wants to expand his house by adding a second floor and hopes to provide a better life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & sand for building his house

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan M. is a 54-year-old married man blessed with twelve children who are all above eighteen years of age.

Nathan is currently a water vendor operating from a kiosk. He has been in this business for the past six years now and this marks his third borrowing from KADET. He wishes to expand the business by building another water kiosk and later use the anticipated profits to renovate the old one. By doing this, Nathan hopes to increase the number of his customers who are mainly residents of Jomvu, Mombasa.

loans.use: To expand his business by building another water kiosk

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, D. 59 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive sola en su casa propia, puesto que hace 7 años falleció su esposo, su única alegría son sus 4 menores hijos con quienes vive y a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. El trabajo al que Rita se dedica, es el cultivo D. papa, arveja, zanahoria y maíz. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga D. la venta D. su cosecha, dependerá mucho D. la calidad D. sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses D. trabajo han tenido sus frutos, por tal motivo desea sembrar en toda el área D. terreno que posee para así obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso D. su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará insumos que le ayuD. a combatir D. los insectos.
texts.en:
Rita, 59, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. She lives alone in her own house because her husband passed away 7 years ago. Her only joy is her four youngest children that live with her and for whom she wants to proviD. a better future. Rita is a potato, pea, corn and carrot farmer. She goes out to work her fields every day very early in the morning because she knows that the money she’ll get from the sale of her crops will very much depend upon the quality of her products. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the fruit of long months of labor. For this reason, she’d like to plant on the entire field she has in order to increase income. This is her second loan with MFP and she states that this contribution will be of much help to her work’s progress. She is well-liked by the other members of her communal group because she is very supportive of them. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy supplies that will help her combat the insects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to combat insects.

loans.name: Cecilia Milagritos

texts.es:
Cecilia es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona pesquera ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la provincia de La Libertad y ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de dulces, ella prepara diversos dulces en su vivienda y los ofrece en un kiosko ambulante que ubica en diversas zonas estratégicas, como por ejemplo los parques y plazas, también aprovecha diversas festividades y celebraciones de las localidades aledañas como Chepén y San Pedro de Lloc para ofrecer su producto. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre seesmerapor mantener su negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Cecilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de nas insumos para seguir elaborando dulces, de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Cecilia es una mujer trabajadora y bastante responsable. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
36-year old Cecilia lives with her husband and children in Pacasmayo district, a fishing area located in the province of the same name. It belongs to La Libertad department, about an hour and a half from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Cecilia earns her living selling candies and other sweet items. She makes various types in her home and then sells them in different locations like parks and plazas from her barrow. Also when there are festivities and celebrations in distant places like Chepén and San Pedro de Lloc, she travels there to sell her products. Her job provides important income to the family so she goes to a lot of trouble to run the business as well as possible. She wishes to expand the business by buying more ingredients so she can continue making the candies. In order to do this she is seeking a loan of 800 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. Cecilia is a hardworking woman and extremely responsible. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has always been punctual and responsible with the loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products of basic necessity, and to expand the store she installed in her home.

loans.name: Denis Alberto

texts.es:
Denis de 39 años de edad, su familia la conforma su esposa Blanca Rosa Espinoza Blandon que es ama de casa y la misma se encarga de cuidar a los niños. 

Don Denis es agricultor, recibe ingreso de venta de leche y de la comericalizacion del ganado, de igual forma posee su área de raices y tuberculos y de esta manera garantiza la alimentacion familiar.  Solicita el segundo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC mediante kiva, para ser invertido en siembra de pasto, su garantía, titulo de propiedad de una parcela de 12  mzs, localizada en la comarca Guinea Vieja, con excelentes condiciones  técnicas para desarrollar las actividaded agricola, y con la mejora del Pasto se prepara para que en tiempo de verano el Ganado cuente con la alimentación necesaria, de esta forma mantener su hato ganadero en buen desarrollo y mejores rendimiento en carne y producción de leche.

Su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario y llegar a ser un alto Ganadero para garantizar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Denis is 39 years old.  His wife, Blanca Rosa Espinoza, is a housewife, and she takes care of the children.

Denis is a farmer.  He receives income from the sale of milk and from selling livestock.  He also has an area where he grows roots and tubers, which guarantees food for the family.

He is requesting his second loan with the AFODENIC institution through Kiva.  He will use the loan to plant fodder.  His guarantee is the title of a 12 “manzanas” (a manzana is a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters or 1.728 acres) piece of property located in the Guinea Vieja region.  This property is in excellent condition for farming.  

With the improvement of growing fodder he is preparing for the summertime so that the livestock can have the feed they need.  This way his livestock herd will have good growth and render improved meat and better milk production.

His biggest dream is to increase his inventory and to become a rancher of high stature in order to guarantee better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: siembra de pastos

loans.name: Patricia Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Patricia Días es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el sector de Totoracoha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos los que se encuentran a poca distancia de la ciudad, tiene mucha variedad en su gastronomía. Cuenca es especial por su gente la que lleva su cultura y tradición.

Doña Patricia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y su esposo es mecánico industrial, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando.
 
La Señora. Patricia tiene una tienda en su casa la cual la tiene hace 7 años, atiende todos los días sin descansar uno solo y sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 8 años y está muy contenta por reunirse con sus amigas cada quince días.Este credito lo va ha invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como: arroz, azucar, aceite, golosinas etc.

Su sueño es ver  que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ms. Patricia Días is a member of the María Reina de la Paz ["Queen Mary of Peace"] Communal Bank.  She lives in the Totoracoha area of Cuenca, a city known for the beauty of its historic center.  Cuenca has several tourist attractions that can be found a short distance from the city, as well as a great variety of gastronomy.  Cuenca is special because of its people, who carry on its culture and tradition.

Ms. Patricia is 42 years old, married, and her husband is an industrial engineer.  They have had three children together, who are currently in school.  Ms. Patricia has a store in her house, which she has run for seven years.  She tends her store every day, without resting for even one day.  She does not have a fixed schedule.  She has been a member of the communal bank for eight years and is very happy with it because it means that she meets with her friends every 15 days.  She will use this loan to purchase products for her store, such as: rice, sugar, oil, candy, etc.  Her dream is to see her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, candy, etc.

loans.name: Ciriaca Paulina

texts.es:
Ciriaca es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos, realizó estudios de educación  primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes y tejidos.

Ciriaca solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mercaderías para su negocio de venta de abarrotes y tejidos.
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener un carro y ser vendedora de carros.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Ciriaca is a member of the "Las Mensajeras" Banco Comunal, which is located in the Juliaca district in San Ramón province in the department of Puno in Peru. She is 43 years old, married and has four children. She has an elementary school education.

Ciriaca has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. She tells us that her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (300 Peruvian soles) and she used that money to increase the capital of her business selling groceries and fabrics.

Ciriaca is requesting a new loan of S /. 1000.00 nuevos soles, money that she will use to buy merchandise for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have a car and to sell cars.

What she likes most about her Banco Comunal is the reliability.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business, which sells groceries and fabrics.

loans.name: Grisel

texts.es:
Grisel es de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, tiene 22 años, es madre soltera, actualmente se encuentra trabajando en un estudio contable como auxiliar, vive con su hija de 3 años en una casa alquilada, con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue luchando por salir adelante y está estudiando en el Instituto Privado Jesús de Nazaret la carrera de Administración Bancaria, a pesar de todos los obstáculos que debió superar es alumna regular, dedicada y muy estudiosa.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de los gastos de la facultad.
Grisel agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Grisel is from the city of San Ignacio Misiones, she is 22 years old and a single mother.  She is currently working at an accounting firm as an assistant, and she lives with her 3 year old daughter in a rented house.  With effort and dedication she is struggling to get ahead and is studying at the Private Institute of Jesus of Nazareth for a career in Banking Administration.  In spite of all the obstacles she has overcome, she is a regular student, dedicated and very studious.

She is requesting a loan to pay her school costs.  Grisel is grateful for this loan because it will help in her studies and at the same time will build her credit record which will be very important in the future for achieving her projects.

loans.use: Payment of monthly tuition fees and other study materials.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Zaina has a business selling banana leaves. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Zaina sells her products at the market, wholesale and retail. Zaina has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of banana leaves.  She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Zaina include seasonality and thieves. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build her own house. Zaina lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bundles  of banana leaves

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida L. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Adelaida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 14485 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adelaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Solidario Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO GUADALUPE

El grupo está conformado por  tres señoras doña Tiburcia T.  inicio con su negocio hace 15 años vendiendo frutas  en la zona 12 de la capital  luego falleció su papa  y le dejo el negocio de frutas dejándole un capital grande  hace  como  tres años ella  se enfermo y decidió ya no vender  más en la ciudad ahora vende fuera de su casa  los días miércoles a domingo ya que su ventaja es tener su venta cerca del campo de futbol  y los días lunes y martes se dedica a la venta de helado  en su propia casa, tiene 4 hijos solteros  quienes estudian por  la tarde, el esposo la apoya saliendo a vender los helados en la aldea donde ella vive, su sueño es que sus hijos tengan un trabajo para que así puedan sostenerse por si mismo. La señora Jesus C.  se dedica a la venta de frutas   desde  15 años en la  zona 12 de la Petapa Ciudad Capital tiene  8  hijos  4 menores de edad y los otros cuatro son casados, el sueño de la señora es tener un local propio. La señora Elsa T. se dedica a la venta de frutas y golosinas  en Galerías del Sur  zona 12 inicio desde  hace 5 años es viuda tiene hijos el sueño de ella es poder tener un local para poder surtir mas y así mismo ofrecer  variedad de golosinas y frutas.
Las tres señoras solicitan el credito para la compra de frutas
texts.en:
Guadalupe Community Bank

This community bank has three female members.

Tiburcia T. set up her business 15 years ago, selling fruit in zone 12 of the capital city.  Then her father died and left her the fruit business and a large amount of capital.  Three years ago, Tiburcia became ill and decided that she would no longer sell her fruit in the city.  She now makes her sales outside her home from Wednesday to Sunday.  Her advantage is that her house is located near a soccer field.  On Mondays and Tuesdays, she sells ice cream from her home.  Tiburcia has four children who are single and study in the afternoons.  Her husband supports her, going out to sell the ice cream in their village.  Tiburcia's dream is for her children to find jobs so that they can support themselves.

Jesus C. has been selling fruit for 15 years in zone 12, Petapa, in the capital city of Guatemala.  She has 8 children.  4 of her children are minors and the other 4 are already married.  Her dream is to own her own sales premises.

Elsa T. sells fruit and candies in 'Galerías del Sur' shopping mall in zone 12.  She set up her business 5 years ago.  Elsa is a widow and has children.  Her dream is to own her own premises so that she can better stock her business and offer a wider variety of candies and fruit.

The three ladies are requesting this loan to buy fruit.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is a married man with a 2-year-old son.  He owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising rice crops.  He says the farm has been very helpful to his family and he hopes for it to grow more.  His wife maintains a small piggery in their backyard.  He works hard for the future of his son.

Bernie is in need of additional piglets, feeds and farm inputs.  He has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI.  He is hopeful that this loan will help improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, 33, is married, with 5 children whose ages range between 1 and 11 years. Three of the children are currently attending school. He has been in the farming business for four years now and sells his beans, maize and tea to the local market. He is also employed in a local school and earns about 4000Kes monthly. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. In future, he would like to save some money to enable him to start a hotel business. Price fluctuations and lack of enough market for his products have been his major setbacks.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuon P. was born in 1970 and is married to Mr. Deal Kos. They live in Svay Sar village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family. Her husband is a duck breeder who is able to earn some money by selling duck eggs. Since her husband’s business is getting on well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Tuon P. is, therefore, seeking a loan to buy duck food. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy net to build a duck house. 

She is the mother of six children, four of whom are students, one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a barber. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy duck food

loans.name: Janixia Los Santos

texts.es: Yanixia De Los Santos tiene 34 años, su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de transporte. Ella tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella lo alquila y le entregan cierta cantidad de dinero al finalizar el día. Ella busca la forma de obtener ingresos para su hijo que es lo más importante. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que entregar el vehículo para que se lo entreguen por la noche. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de llantas, combustible y ciertos arreglos de su carro.
texts.en: Yanixia De Los Santos is 34 years old and her business activity is to provide transport services. She has more than 6 years in the business. She rents her vehicle and they pay her a certain amount of money at the end of the day. She is looking for a way to obtain an income for her son, which is the most important thing.  She gets up very early in the morning to surrender her vehicle so that they will return it to her in the evening. The loan she requests is to purchase tires and fuel, and to carry out certain repairs to her vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase tires and fuel, and to carry out maintenance repairs to her vehicle.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred B., 35, is a married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 10 years old. Both of her children go to school. Mildred does her best to sustain their education.

Mildred is a farmer and has been growing rice for more than four years now. She earns by selling her harvest to the market. 

She currently needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. Mildred requested a loan that she can use to fund her farm. Mildred hopes to have an increased harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface, 27, has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years to earn a living.  A hardworking man who aspires to own apartments, Boniface has learned how to manage both his business and his finances through Faulu Kenya.   He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes for his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia P., 34 years old, is currently in the business of selling food. She will use her loan to stock more food. She is a widow with five children, but only two aren't going to school. Her goal is to take good care of her children's future.

loans.use: to stock more food for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
The man on the motorbike is called Peter.  To earn a living, he repairs motorbikes.  His business is named Mercy Motorcycle Repairs.  It is eight months since he started the business.  Besides, he does dairy farming for extra income.  He previously operated a retail shop to earn a living.

He says that he has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has grown his business. He hopes to be a successful business man in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy a chaff cutter for use in his farm .

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Humberto  es  una persona  muy  responsable, en  esta  ocasión  acudió  a  la   institución  porque  su  sueño  es  acondicionar   su   hogar,  ya  que   en los  próximos  meses   recibirá  la llegada  de   su  primer   hijo,  es  por  ello  que   requiere   realizar  mantenimiento a  la  losa de  su domicilio   ya que  desde tiempo  atrás   se  le  a estado  filtrando  el   agua   en  el techo, agradece  enormemente   el  apoyo  brindado   ya  que   al  realizar  su proyecto  podrá   ofrecer   una mejor   calidad  de   vida  a su  familia  la  cual  representa  lo mas importante  en su vida.
texts.en: Humberto  is a very responsible person. On this occasion, he has come to the institution because his dream is to fix up his home. In the coming months, his first child will be born, and that is why he needs to do some maintenance on the floor in his house. For some time, water has been filtering through the roof, He is enormously grateful for the support offered, since doing this project will allow him to offer a better quality of life to his family, which is the most important thing in his life.

loans.use: to repair the floor in his house.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhan is a local farmer in Kompong Cham province. She has been working in agriculture since she was young and single. She is good at planting crops on her own fertile land and earns around $1.50 a profit a day to use for daily expenses. 

Mrs. Chhan is married to Mr. Soung, 67, who also works with her in the farm field.  They have seven children -- two are single and are working in a garment factory, while the other five are already married and live in their own houses.  

Mrs. Chhan would like to borrow some funds from Kiva in order to buy a motorcycle for her sons to ride to work.   She will use the rest of the loan to plant corn, sesame and sugar cane.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for sons to ride to work

loans.name: Taleh

texts.ru:
Taleh ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Etot molodoy chelovek yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Djabrail regiona, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Taleh 24 qoda.
Uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsya prodajey diskov kaset i t.d. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye svoyego magazina dlya razmesheniya bolshe tovara.
texts.en:
Taleh is single and has no children.  This young man is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Djabrail region who now lives in the Absheron region with his parents.  Taleh is 24 years old.

For three years, he has sold disks, cassettes, etc.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to expand his shop in order to hold more of his wares.

loans.use: to expand his shop.

loans.name: Jumakhon

texts.ru: Чумахон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Уже четыре года как он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых продуктов.
texts.en: Jumakhon lives in Hamadoni. He is 52 years old, married, and has four children. He has a secondary education. He has been working in trade for four years.  He has a grocery shop. He is taking out a loan to buy necessary products.

loans.use: to buy necessary products.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a Rwandan entrepreneur. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 9 years old. Her husband is a driver and all of her children are in school.

Jeanette runs a business selling breads, and her business has grown since she first started it. She also makes her own packaging materials. She uses the profits from her business to provide for her family.

She will used this loan to purchase more bread, cakes, and packaging materials that she will sell to meet the growing demands of her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, cakes and some packaging materials.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria comenzó a trabajar en la calle vendiendo todo tipo de mercancía, luego de estar en cualquier esquina decide pedir el permiso para establecerse en un solo lugar y luego de tener el permiso comienza vender solo ropa  para deporte.

Con su negocio ella tiene el sustento diario además de poder tener una buena calidad de vida, ella se sueña con un local donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, pero para esto necesita comprar mas variedad de mercancía y así podrá ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes y de esta forma se acerca cada vez realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
Gloria began working as a street vendor selling all kinds of merchandise.  After working on nearly every corner she decided to get a license to open a shop and sell sports clothing.

Her daily income from her business gives her a better quality of life.  She would like to have a larger shop to attend to customers better, but this would mean having to stock a broader variety of merchandise.  But this is her dream and it is getting closer and closer.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Uganda. She is single and has seven children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother's children).  Florence has a business selling cereals. She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products in a shop at retail and at wholesale. Florence has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of beans, groundnuts and maize. She generates additional income through her retail shop. The main business challenge(s) for Florence include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to sell at wholesale only. Florence lives in a home that she own. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans, groundnuts and maize

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 40, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Roberto, a driver, and they have four children. Her eldest child is in college and the youngest is not yet studying. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a laundry soap retailing business. What she basically does is buy laundry products from wholesalers, sell them per item with a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Liza dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products needed in her business.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru:
Азамат очень хороший и порядочный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 11 лет и у него очень богатый опыт по данному бизнесу. В основном он выращивает арбуз и дыню, а потом продает на выгодную цену. Его жена и дети помогает ему на переработки земли и посева семена. Азамат хотел бы получить займ в размере 8000 Сомони для покупки семена, минеральных удобрений, горюче смазочные материалы, оплата труда тракториста и рабочей силы. Он заранее хочет благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поощрения.  


 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Azamat is a very good and decent man. He is married and the loving father of 3 children. He has cultivated crops for more than 11 years and has extensive experience in this line of work. He mainly grows watermelon and melon and then sells them for a profit. His wife and children help him prepare the land and plant seeds. Azamat is requesting a loan of 8000 somoni to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants, and to pay for tractor drivers work and other manpower. He wishes to thank you in advance for your help and encouragement.

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants and pay for the labor of tractor operators and other manpower.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: El señor Patricio es chofer y tiene dos taxis, pero el está a cargo de uno y para el otro contrata un chofer auxiliar. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de las movilidades y comprar una batería para el vehiculo que maneja el chofer contratado. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto; Patricio  es casado y tiene tres hijos. Patricio ya solicitó dos créditos anteriores a través de Kiva y está será la tercera vez.
texts.en:
Sr. Patricio is a taxi driver and owns two vehicles. He drives one taxi while the other one is driven by a hired assistant. The loan he is requesting will be used for the maintenance of both vehicles and the purchase of a battery for his assistant’s taxi. Patricio lives in his own home in the District of Villa Ingenio in the city of El Alto. He is married and has three children.

Patricio has already requested two previous loans through Kiva and this will be his third one.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of two taxis and to buy a battery for one of them.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gaspard est un jeune sénégalais de 33 ans,  responsable de 2 enfants qui ont respectivement un et 2 ans. C’est un célibataire qui évolue dans le domaine de l’encadrement d’élèves  qui étudient  au lycée  ou au collège. Il a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine. 
Ce qui l’a poussé  a faire son choix c’est la forte sollicitation des certains élèves de son quartier qui comptaient sur son savoir dans certaines matières telles que les maths  et la  physique-chimie pour se faire assister. C’est ainsi que grâce  a ses prestations de services il  parvient  à se procurer des revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire les besoins quotidiens de la famille. L’avantage qu’il en tire concerne la meilleure connaissance et la maitrise du programme scolaire. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2008. Il sollicite un crédit de 360 000 frs prévu pour la construction d’une salle d’étude dans laquelle il pourra installer les élèves qu’il encadre. Ce financement lui permettra certes d’améliorer le cadre et le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Gaspard is a young Senegalese, 33 years old, who has two children, aged 1 and 2, in his care. He is unmarried and works in the domain of training students at the high school or the middle school. He has ten years of experience in this domain. What drove him to choose this were the strong requests from certain students in his district who were counting on his knowledge for help in certain subjects, such as math and physical chemistry. Thanks to his abilities, he manages to acquire an income allowing him to meet the everyday needs of his family. His advantage is a better understanding and mastery of the school curriculum. 

Mr. Gaspard has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch since March 2008. He is requesting a loan of 360,000 francs for building a private study hall where the students he trains can be situated. This financing will surely enable him to improve his family's living standard and conditions.

loans.use: to build a private study hall

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and three siblings. In 1998, he started to work as a taxi driver, transporting customers to their desired location. After realizing that his revenue was barely sufficient to satisfy the family's needs, he decided to also open a vegetable shop in order to earn higher income. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs so as to be able to handle the high costs of living. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his taxi to make it more secure. 

In the future, he plans to purchase a new car so that he can continue his business expansion.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna is a 44-year-old widow with three children. The oldest child is 22 years old.

Jinna makes peanut rolls that she sells to sari-sari (variety) store owners in her town. She has been in this business for four years. Each month, Jinna earns 7000 PHP with her business. She requested a loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, wrappers, sugar and oil. Jinna hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as peanuts, wrappers, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Amd 28 Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Fatmawati is 49 years old and married with three children.  She is pictured above standing in the middle of the group.  One of her children is studying at university while the other two are in high school and junior high school.  She has been selling clothing and electronic equipment on credit for 26 years around her neighborhood.  The business allows her to help her husband by supplementing his income as a caterer and also helps pay school fees for the children.  She hopes that all of her children can succeed in school and attend through university.  She is now requesting her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy more clothing to resell to customers and help pay school fees for her children.

She enjoys having this business because she does not have to sit at home all day and can be out meeting people and sharing stories with them.  Main challenges she faces with her business are when people cannot pay her and the increased competition.  If she ever has enough savings, she'd like to open her own store someday to sell the clothing and electronics from.

The other group members will use their loans to help their businesses which include selling cakes, selling ice, and selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to resell to customers and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Hadija takes care of eight children at home. In the recent 2011 season, Hadija had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hadija was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. She joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. With income from maize sales, Hadija will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Hadija is the facilitator of the Tumaini Group. In the photograph above, Hadija is pictured with her group members. Hadija and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Tumaini Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hadija and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nueva Unión (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Nueva Unión se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín (Portoviejo), este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de 10 socias y 2 socios  que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen o empezar en el mundo del comercio. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí vive la Johanna, tiene  27 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 5 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en Quito.
 
Ella es una joven madre muy responsable y trabajadora que quiere lo mejor para el futuro de sus hijos, con este crédito ella va a empezar un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, se va a trasladar hacia quito donde trabaja su esposo y traer mercadería para aprovechar la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo que es cuando más ropa compra la gente, quiere traer sobretodo ropa para niños ya que es lo que más se vende en estos días.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y bisutería. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son que su negocio prospere y  darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

En la fotografía podemos apreciar una foto pequeña adjunta que pertenece a un socio que por motivos laborales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto grupal. Tambien en la parte izquierda de la foto está una Señora sentada en una banca con camiseta roja, esta Señora no pertenece al grupo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Unión Community Bank meets every 15 days in Junín (Portoviejo). This place is known for its friendly and hard-working people and because in this place the best brandy of the province and of Ecuador is distilled here.

This is a group of ten female members and two male members who decided to unite and form this community bank that has served them a lot since with the loans, they have been able to improve their small business or make a start in the world of commerce. They are dedicated to different work such as commerce, service, selling food, among other activities.

Johanna lives here. She is 27 years old and maintains a relationship from which she has three children who are 8,5, and two years old. The two eldest study at school. Her spouse works in Quito.

She is a very responsible and hard-working young mother who wants the best for the future of her children. With this loan she is going to start a business selling all types of clothing. She is going to move near Quito where her husband works and to bring merchandise in order to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year holiday which is when people buy more clothing. She wants to bring, above all, children's clothing since it is what she sells most on those days.

This loan is going to be used to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, children's clothing and jewelry. This is her first cycle with the community bank and she likes it for its speed to acquire a loan.
 
Her dreams are that her business prospers and to give her children the best.

In the photograph, we can see a small photo that belongs to a member who, due to job reasons, was not able to be present when they took the group photo. Also, in the left part of the photo is a woman who is seated on a bank with a red shirt. This woman does not belong to the group.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, children's clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Weyongonga Group

texts.en:
Jonathan is the facilitator of the Weyongonga group. Jonathan and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jonathan takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jonathan had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jonathan was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jonathan and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jonathan will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Weyongonga group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro tiene 52 años de edad, su negocio a la que se dedica es a brindar los servicio de video juego que mas todo un entretenimiento para muchos jóvenes que la visitan, este  lo inicio con el objetivo de generar ingresos para la familia y además tiene la venta de refrescos en el mismo local. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar equipos de videos juegos para brindarle a sus clientes variedad de juegos y estén satisfechos.
texts.en: María del Socorro, 52, has a business providing video game services which more than anything is an entertainment for the many youngsters who visit her.  She started it with the goal of generating family income; she also sells refreshments in the same place.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy video game kits to provide a variety of games for her customers so that they will be satisfied.

loans.use: to buy video game equipment.

loans.name: Bessy Maribel

texts.en:
My name is Bessy Z., I sell women's underwear, shoes, blouses, T-shirts, combs, wallets, cosmetics, and dresses for girls. I have had my business for 6 years and it is located in the city of Danli. I have the help of my husband to tend to the business. I have a various loyal customers, who are in search of the quality of my products. My business supports my family and also the studies of my children. My goal is to be able to increase sales and to have more of an assortment of products. With the profits I would be able to support my family and fincance the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase women's underwear, shoes, blouses, T-shirts, combs, wallets, cosmetics, girl's dresses, hairpins and pocketbooks.

Mi nombre es Bessy Z., mi negocio se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para dama, zapatos, camisas, camisetas, blusas, peines, carteras, cosmeticos, vestidos para niña, tengo mi negocio desde hace 6 años y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para atender el negocio. tengo varios clientes fijos, ya que los clientes buscan calidad en los productos. mi negocio me genera el sustento de familia y tambien con los estudios de mis hijos. mi meta es incrementar el inventario y poder vender mas productos surtidos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia y un mejor estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de interior de dama, zapatos, camisas, camisetas, blusas, peines, carteras, cosmeticos, vestidos de niña, ganchos y bolsas

loans.name: Lauina

texts.en: “ I will never forget the help that I get from the SPBD! “ Lauina always says that to her friends and family. She also adds that without the microcredit program she wouldn't have money to send her five children to school. She joined the program in 2004 while she was still starting up her sewing business. She faced many difficulties because of not enough money to support her business and the family. But now she is starting to expand her number of customers and with an additional sewing machine and more material she is sure to earn from her thriving sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine, 20 rolls of fabric, and thread

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en: Gulustan H. raises cattle in the small village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. Gulustan and her family want to increase the quantity of their livestock in order to increase their income. Gulstan is looking for funding so that she can invest in purchasing a few more calves for her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nol

texts.en: Mr. Nol C. is 51 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with his wife and their 5 children.  He works growing, harvesting, and selling crops--mostly rice.  He earns about $3/day in profit doing this business, and his 2 sons work as drivers, helping to support the family as well.  Mr. Nol C. currently sells his rice only at the nearby market in Kampong Cham, but he would like to expand his selling area.  This loan will be used to buy a motorbike so that he can take his harvest to new markets.  With any leftover money, he will buy more seeds so he can harvest more crops next year.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport his crops to the market, and also to buy seeds for farming

loans.name: Sam-Oeurn

texts.en:
Sam-oeurn married in 1990 and has two daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor when she was 20 years old. She started her silk production in 1985. Besides producing silk Sam-oeurn also sells grocery items from her home. She and her husband finished primary school in the local schools. After they come home from school, her daughters help to weave silk as well.

Sam-oeurn has already taken out and repaid four loans from MAXIMA. She is now asking for a loan of US$ 400 to use to buy more grocery items, silk material and sewing thread, and to pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom. We feel certain that Sam-oeurn will be able to repay the principal and interest for this loan on time, given her excellent track record as a client of MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items, silk material and sewing thread, and paying for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

loans.name: Zamile

texts.en: Zamile A. is a 45-year-old woman who owns her small business in a small village near the Imishli region which situated in southern part of Azerbaijan. Zamile is married and has four children. She and her husband are unemployed, and Zamile turned her family life in positive way when she started raising fruits and selling them to the local bazaar traders. Bringing up four children is very difficult, especially in villages, but Zamile did not give up and trained her children to help her in gathering crops. Sometimes they go to the bazaar and sell fruits themselves.  As children grow up covering family needs become harder and harder every year. This year was very hard, since prices for products increased  three times, however  Zamile  has found out a new way to improve the situation again. She has applied for 1200 USD. With this loan she is going to expand her business and start raising new kinds of fruits like apples and pears. To start raise them she needs sprouts and fertilizer.

loans.use: Going to expand her business and start raising apples and pears

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun C., age 34, runs a small booth selling duck eggs, earning around $5 each day of profit. Her husband is a fisherman, making less than $1 per day. They have two children, one who is a student and one who is unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase more ducks to breed for eggs to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to produce more eggs to sell in the market.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Centro Naturista Eben-Ezer (Naturalist Center Eben-Ezer) is a small business founded by Mr. Francisco E. (don chico) who sells naturalist medicines of different types. In addition to selling natural products, he sells fruit and occasionally books, but in smaller quantities.

He started his business 8 years ago with his own capital of C$500, which he invested in buying natural medicine, and as time went by, fruit to sell.

The quick development of Mr. Francisco's business is due in part to the decision he made to work with Ceprodel, having obtained 18 loans to date. Mr. Francisco has wisely invested these loans in his business, and on increasing advertisement for his business in the department of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Centro Naturista Eben-Ezer es un pequeño negocio fundado por el señor Francisco E. (don chico) que se encarga de vender medicamentos naturales de diferentes tipos. Además de vender productos naturistas se dedica a la venta de frutas y en ocasiones artículos de librería pero en menores cantidades.

Inicia su negocio hace 8 años con un capital propio de C$ 500 que los invirtió en la compra de medicina naturista y posteriormente a medida que pasaron los meses incorporó la venta de frutas para su respectiva venta.

El rápido avance y desarrollo del negocio del señor Francisco (don chico) se debe en gran parte a la decisión que tomo de afiliarse con Ceprodel obteniendo hasta el momento 18 créditos que muy sabiamente los ha invertido en su negocio y además le ha servido para aumentar su publicidad en el departamento de Chinandega.

loans.use: Buying medicine and some fruits (Compra de medicinas y algunas frutas)

loans.name: Holmahmad

texts.ru:
Holmahmad R. is 36 years old, has a college education, work as an instructor at the Tajik National Teaching University, is married and has 1 child. Holmahmad has a small plot of land next to his house. He would like to get a loan to purchase wheat seeds because their price is much lower now than it will be in one month. He has been planting wheat for 10 years.

This loan will allow Holmahmad to purchase wheat for planting, plant his land, collect a harvest and use the wheat to make flour and bread for personal use. A bag of flour costs much more at a store and Holmahmad’s teaching salary is often not enough to pay for it. He will pay back the loan by using part of his salary. Holmahmad plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимов Холмахмад, возраст – 36 лет, образование – высшее, работает в Таджикском Государственном Педагогическом Университете преподавателем, женат, имеет 1 – го ребёнка. Холмахмад имеет небольшой приусадебный участок возле своего дома. Так как наступает посевной сезон, она хочет получить кредит и приобрести семена пшеницы, так как в настоящее время цена на них намного ниже, чем будет через месяц. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Данный кредит даст ему возможность приобрести семена пшеницы, засеять участок земли, собрать урожай и использовать пшеницу для производства муки и выпечки хлеба для личног потребления. Так как мешок муки в магазине стоит намного больше и не всегда хватает на это зарплаты преподователя. Кредит клиент планирует погашать свой кредит за счёт получаемой заработной платы. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase wheat for planting

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
My name is Nazia S.. I am married and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. I live with my family in the mid-sized industrial city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. I stitch clothes for women of my neighborhood and my husband runs a grocery store. My husband needs a loan to improve his business. The higher profits that we hope to receive will be saved for our children's future. I would like to borrow in a group: Shalika Shrafat needs this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for their fields, Parween A. plans to start a grocery store and Shahnaz A. will invest her share of the loan in her husband’s auto lubricants store. All of these women are hardworking entrepreneurs and dream of a prosperous life for their families.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Improve a grocery store

loans.name: Preng

texts.en: Mrs. Preng V., 29, and her husband Chap Samoeun are goldsmiths from Takoy Village in Battambang Province. V. earns $5 per day and Samoeun earns about $10 per day. They have two children, both of whom are students. V. seeks a $1,100 loan to purchase gold to create jewelry. With this loan she hopes to both expand her business and continue to provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase gold to create jewelry and to sell to customers more efficiently

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Raqia lives with her own family in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She was married and is the mother of 3 children but she is a widow now since her husband died during the war in Kabul. She is a tailor, and she has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. She supports her family.

Raqia has requested an individual loan to complete materials necessary for her business so that she can make a good monthly income and help her family. She is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete materials needed for her business

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women the energy and motivation to reach success.

In a remote neighborhood located in Carepegua, a group of 15 women heard about the the Committee of Entrepreneuring Women and its profitable results. They decided to set up a meeting to know more about the program and, without hesitation, they formed a committee. They wanted to lift themselves out of poverty and to bring benefits to their own families.

Some of these women are craftswomen, others are salespeople, and the rest are weavers. They need the money to invest in the purchase of threads, fabrics, and sheets, among others.

loans.use: Purchase threads, fabrics, and sheets, among others.

loans.name: Thi Thuynh's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. T. Thi Thuynh (ID number: 11030001), 51 years old, wants to borrow 175USD to buy pig mash to breed pigs. Before, she borrowed 125 USD to continue making her family traditional cake, improving her family economy.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Chien (ID number: 11030006), wants to borrow 125 USD to buy pig mash.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thao (ID number: 11030005), wants to borrow 150USD to improve her family carpentry.
  • Mrs. T. Thi Vien (ID number: 11030004), wants to borrow 150 USD to buy chicken feed.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hanh (ID number: 11030003), wants to borrow 150 USD to buy more chinawares for rent.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Duc (ID number: 11030002), wants to borrow 150 USD to sell fruits in the market.

  • Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Trần Thị Thuynh (MS: 11030001), năm nay 51 tuổi. Nhóm cô đã tham gia một kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Ở kỳ vay trước cô làm trưởng nhóm và đã hoàn thành rất tốt vai trò của mình. Với khoản vốn vay là 2.006.000 VND của kỳ trước cô đã mở rộng được nghề làm bánh truyền thống của gia đình nhờ đó kinh tế gia đình cô khá phát triển. Kỳ này cô vay 2.714.000 VND để thêm vốn mua cám lợn phát triển chăn nuôi. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm gồm có: Chị Nghiêm Thị Chiến (MS: 11030006), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo (MS: 11030005), vay 2.478.000 VND để gia đình phát triển nghề mộc. Chị Trần Thị Viễn (MS:11030004), vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám nuôi gà đẻ trứng. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh (MS: 11030003), vay 2.478.000 VND để thêm vốn mua mâm bát cho thuê. Chị Nguyễn Thị Đức (MS: 11030002), vay 2.478.000 VND để đi chợ mua bán hoa quả.

loans.use: buy pig mash, chicken feed, sell fruits, buy chinawares

loans.name: Alma Angelica

texts.es:
Alma started the business to support her children and husband, who was in poor health because of an accident he suffered at work. Faced with this situation she needed to have an income to be able to eat and buy medicines for her husband, because he did not have medical insurance. She started her own business in her house four years ago, buying fish from the co-workers of her husband, who sold it to her at a reduced price. In this way she was able to earn money for family expenses and to buy medicines for her husband, and so tend to and care for her sick husband and their 3 children.

She needs a loan of $500, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy a freezer in order to keep her products well refrigerated without fear of losing them to the high temperatures that they have in that city.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma inició el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos y esposo que se encontraba mal de salud debido a que sufrió un accidente en el trabajo, ante esta situación ella necesitaba tener un ingreso para poder comer y comprar medicinas para su esposo, debido a que no tenia seguro medico, inicio su propio negocio en casa, hace 4 años comprando pescado, con los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo, ya que se lo vendían a bajo precio. Fue así que pudo tener dinero para el gasto familiar y poder comprar medicinas para su esposo y así atender y cuidar a su esposo enfermo y a sus 3 hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para en comprar un congelador, y así poder tener sus productos bien refrigerados sin temor de que se le echen a perder, por las altas temperaturas que se presentan en esta ciudad.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to protect her fish products from the heat.

loans.name: Nery Zulema

texts.es:
Nery is married and has two children, who are 12 and 14 years old. Her husband works as a salesman. Nery previously ran a cafeteria at a school, but when the school hired a new principal Nery and her husband found themselves unemployed. This was three years ago, and they decided to start another business to earn income. They started with what was left of the cafeteria and began to collect more merchandise, until they had enough for a grocery store. Nery and her husband have now installed the grocery store in their garage.

Nery needs a loan of $1100, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the money to supply the store with new products to boost sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Nery es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 14 años, su esposo trabaja como vendedor. Ella inició el negocio porque tenía una cafetería en una escuela, y hubo cambio de director y se las pidieron, por lo cual se quedaron sin trabajo su esposo y ella al mismo tiempo, y tuvieron que poner otro negocio para obtener ingresos. Hace aproximadamente poco mas de 3 años, empezaron con lo que les quedo de la cafetería, poco a poco fueron teniendo mas mercancía, hasta llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes que hoy por hoy tienen, mismo que instalaron en lo que era la cochera de su casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1100 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir el negocio con productos que aun no tienen en existencia, y poder vender mas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Oykhol

texts.en:
Oykhol K. is 43 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. She started her own business 13 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses.

Oykhol is a market entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She runs a stall selling candies and sweets. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and she offers a wide selection. Oykhol is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy her goods again.

Oykhol is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 3500 Somoni (1025 USD) for a term of 6 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a new vending facility. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Oykhol reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Enlarging her range of goods and purchasing of an individual store

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra F. est femme mariée vendeuse de poissons depuis plus trois ans. C'est une activité qui lui permet d'entretenir sa famille grâce à ses recettes de 15000 fcfa en moyenne par jour. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités et augmenter sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Diarra F. is a married women and has been a retailer of fish for over three years. This is a business that enables her to support her family, thanks to her receipts of 15,000 francs CFA per day on average. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and to increase her customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in fish

loans.name: Ljubinka

texts.en:
Ljubinka was born in 1978 and she lives in a suburb of Doboj, Bosnia. She is married and has 3 children: 2 boys and 1 girl.  Her husband is self-employed and re-sells used cars. To help support her family, Ljubinka raises chickens and sells their meat to local factories. 

Ljubinka is requesting a loan of 1,200KM ($800 USD) from Women for Women International, with which she will buy baby chickens and chicken food. By expanding her poultry business, Ljubinka hopes to earn additional income and to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken food

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús R. prácticamente tiene una familia grande, está formada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, actualmente su casa solo cuenta con dos habitaciones por lo que él y su esposa ocupan una y sus tres hijos la otra.
Necesitan urgentemente construir una tercera habitación pues su hija ya necesita más privacidad.
Sus servicios laborales los presta a una empresa como contador, con el ingreso que tiene le es imposible construir el cuarto pues son costos que solo mediante un préstamo se pueden lograr.
texts.en:
Jesús R. has a large family. He lives with his wife and his three children. His house currently has only two bedrooms. He and his wife share one and his three children share the other. They urgently need to build a third bedroom, as his daughter needs more privacy. He works as an accountant. His income is not enough for him to afford construction costs, so only with the help of this loan will he be able to achieve his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an addition to the ground floor

loans.name: Agueda De Jesus

texts.es:
La Microempresaria de Nombre Águeda de Jesús Pérez P. tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Águeda no tiene hijos, sus propósitos son de mantener activo su negocio ya que es una mujer muy luchadora por lo que de alguna forma a logrado superar los obstáculos mas difíciles de su vida para salir adelante sus deseos son de mantener su negocio activo y que sus productos sena de calidad para que los clientes siempre lleguen en busca de sus productos ya que por su cuadra tiene mucha competencia y no quiere perder la costumbre de vender el tiste ya que es uno de los productos que tradicionalmente se venden en algunos en algunos barrios por lo que también no quiere que esta costumbre se pierda sus sueños son de tener una casa nueva para que su Mama y Ella puedan vivir cómodamente con las condiciones adecuadas para su bienestar por lo que a su edad tiene que pensar en su futuro.
