texts.en: Rita is single and has six children. She cooks “piwa”, a local dish made from corn which is boiled like rice (the dried maize or corn is broken into pieces which look like grains of rice). She sells the dish at Elmina, which she has done for eight years. Rita will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to store and then use to prepare the dish to sell, as the price of maize keeps increasing. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to store and later use to prepare a dish for sale, as the price of maize keeps increasing.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 37  años de edad, el es casado, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo, su vivienda esta ubicada en el Caserío Finca Cassinelli, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Mochumi, en el departamento de Lambayeque.

Ángel se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de pescado, el cual distribuye recorriendo en un burro. Angel tiene bastante tiempo dedicándose a este negocio, experiencia que le ha permitido obtener clientela fija para sus negocio, el vende al contado y al crédito según sea el caso y adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.

Ángel esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de pescado en mayores cantidades y alimento balanceado para sus animales para que estos puedan tener un mejor desarrollo y pueda venderlos aun mejor precio.,

Ángel ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual, se caracteriza por tener buenos ánimos y muchas ganas de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángel is 37 years old, married, and owns a home where he lives with his three dependent children. He resides in Caserío Finca Cassinelli, which is 25 minutes away from the city of Mochumi in the Department of Lambayeque.

Ángel sells fish as a traveling vendor. He distributes his product by riding around on a donkey. Ángel has plenty of time to devote to this business and has the experience necessary to build an established customer base. He sells for cash and on credit according to each customer. In addition, he engages in farming and raising animals.

Ángel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN to invest in his business. He will use the money to buy fish in large quantities and balanced feed for his animals so that they will develop properly and be sold at a good price.

Ángel has demonstrated that he is responsible and punctual. He is known for having a good attitude and the desire to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk and balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix es empleado en la empresa Ema Verde en el cargo de  mecánico. El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de galpón en su casa, donde pueda atender clientes particulares que tienen problemas con sus vehículos. Así tendrá la posibilidad de comenzar un negocio propio y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona 8 de Diciembre en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado  y tiene cinco hijos. Es la segunda vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Félix is employed at Ema Verde as a Mechanic.  The loan he’s requesting is to build a shed at home where he can take care of private customers with car problems.  This way he’ll have the possibility of starting a business of his own to improve his income.  He lives in his own house located in La Paz’s 8 de Diciembre zone.  He’s married and has five children.  This is his second IMPRO loan and also the second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to build a shed at home to tend to private customers with car problems.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man living with one parent and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. In 2006, he was able to open an aluminum factory in his town. Even at his young age, Mohamad showed high competency at his work. And today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools and supplies needed to reinforce his business. In the future, he is hoping to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn good income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and supplies needed.

loans.name: Ayi Koffi

texts.fr:
Ayi  est  un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est célibataire. Il  n’a pas encore d’enfants.  
Ayi  est proprietaire d’un cafétariat  depuis 2001. Il vend à toutes personnes dans son kiosque. Il travaille avec une personne de sa famille.
Ayi  a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration. Il veut aussi monter une activité parallèle à son cafétariat. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayi  voudrait agrandir son cafétariat. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de se marier et avoir un foyer.
texts.en: Ayi is a 36-year-old man. He is single. He doesn't have any children yet. Ayi has been the owner of a cafeteria since 2001. He sells to the public in his booth. He works with a person from his family. Ayi has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy the necessary products for his restaurant business. He also wants to set up a parallel business to his cafeteria. In the coming years, Ayi would like to grow his cafeteria. He says, with the profits, he plans to marry and to have a home.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products

loans.name: Abajyamugambi Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
J. fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi Zone 2 et le chef du groupe c'est celui qui a de l'argent. Le nom du groupe signifie « les initiateurs ». Il a 25 ans et il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

J. est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est la semence du riz sélectionné. Dans les prochaines années, J. voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’aider ses parents.
texts.en:
J. is a member of the group Abajyamugambi Zone 2. He is also the group leader, as seen in the photo. The group's name means "the initiators". J. is 25 years old and single. He attended six years of primary school.

J. is rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use the funding to buy fertilizer for his rice growing activity.

His business growth strategy revolves around the selected rice seed. In the coming years, J. hopes to produce a large crop of rice and use the profits to help his parents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un enseignant, marié et père de 2 anfants.En plus de sa petite famille, il a en charge 4 jeunes élèves qui lui viennent du village ainsi que trois frères de son épouses. Pour améliorer ses revenus et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins des personnes qui sont à sa charge,il pratique en meme temps l'agriculture et l'embouche ovine.A l'approche de la fete de Tabaski (fete du mouton), il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 20 moutons qu'il revendra sur le marché local.Son ambition est de réaliser une ferme agropastorale dans son village d'origine.
texts.en:
Mbaye is a teacher, married, and the father of two children. In addition to his little family, he has to support 4 pupils from the village, as well as three brothers of his spouse's.

In order to increase his income and be able to provide for the people he has to support, he both farms and raises sheep. Since Tabski (Eid al-Adha) is approaching, he's seeking a loan of XOF 500'000 in order to buy 20 sheep to resell at the local market. 

His ambition is to establish an agropastoral farm in his home village.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 39-year-old man who lives in Old Sana'a, Yemen. He is the father of three young children. He received higher education long ago but could not continue his studies as he was busy helping his father in his trade of traditional jambia (a short dagger worn on a belt).

Mohammed learned the trade from his father, who inherited it from his ancestors. Like his ancestors, Mohammed is totally dependent on the income from this business to feed his family and to cover their living expenses. 

Mohammed took a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase some materials related to his business as well as some ready-made traditional belts. This loan will help Mohammed to meet the demand of his clientele in providing the types of traditional belts they require.

In the future, Mohammed plans to rebuild his old house and enroll his youngest son in a private school. Unlike his father, Mohammed doesn't like his sons to learn his trade because he wants them to complete their higher education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new traditional belts

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old, married with three children, resides at Bagakay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gemma owns a sari-sari store and sells goods in order to earn money for their daily needs. Every month, Gemma earns 5,000 PHP and she's been in this business for three years. Gemma requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase goods for her sari-sari store. She's been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.

Gemma's future plan is to widen her sari-sari store's inventory and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth is divorced and has two children. She is thirty years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

She requested a loan of 20,000 for her additional finances to go abroad.  

In the future, Lilybeth hopes that she can provide for the financial needs of her two children.

loans.use: finance for abroad

loans.name: Tatua Shida Shg Group

texts.en:
Fred is the facilitator of the Tatua Shida SHG group. Fred and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Fred takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to get One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had an excellent maize yield harvesting six bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Fred was only able to harvest one bag of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Fred will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Tatua Shida SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Sarah. She is married and has three children, aged 2, 6 and 10 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to assist her with the business.  

In 2005, Sarah established her cooking condiment business. Before establishing her own she was selling for her elder sister and in the process gained a lot of business experience and skills. This business is special to Sarah as it is an additional source of income which is used to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. 

Sarah’s customers are mainly women who daily buy cooking condiments. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Sarah has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more rice, onion, vegetable oil, salt and maggi for her business. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Sarah plans to improve the business to a store. She hopes to see her business grow to a level of making more profit, to take care of her children's education. It serves the general public. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking condiments such as rice, onion, vegetable oil, salt and maggi for her business.

loans.name: Ukulima Mbele Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Ukulima Mbele Group in Western Kenya! Joseph is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Joseph takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Ukulima Mbele group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kozhon

texts.ru: Кожону 44 года, женат, имеет четверых детей. В 2005 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Кожон начал свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Кожона, начатое с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, на сегодняшний день приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов и насчитывает одну корову с теленком, девять голов коз, одну нетель и десять голов овец. Благодаря доходам от бизнес – деятельности средний сын Кожона учится в спортивной школе. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Кожон обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. В планах - вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем – достроить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Kozhon is 44 years old, married and has four children. In the search of income for his family, Kozhon started his business of animal husbandry in 2005. Thanks to Kozhon's persistence and perseverance, the farm, which was started with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS), currently brings in around 6,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. It numbers a cow and a calf, ten goats, a heifer and ten sheep. Thanks to the income from the business activity, Kozhon's middle son studies at a sports school. 

In order to further increase the number of livestock, Kozhon turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep. The plan is to invest the income in further increasing the number of domestic animals, and in the future finish the house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Eulogia Agripina

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eulogia, tiene 78 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 9 hijos todos mayores  de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual además de vender productos de primera necesidad también venden legumbres, carne, pescado por libras, además de ciertos artículos de bazar, útiles escolares, helados entre otras cosas, trabajan todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es una de las primeras que hay en ese lugar y que gracias a Dios se ha mantenido hasta el momento y con ella pudieron sacar adelante a sus hijos. Lleva en su tienda más de 20 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, útiles escolares, entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Su sueño es tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In La Pila, in Montecristi canton, the "Para el Futuro De la Mujer " communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  Here you can find a great variety of crafts made by the inhabitants, following traditional customs. 

Here we met Eulogia. She is 78, married, and has nine children, all adults and on their own. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

She and her husband have a grocery store in their home, where in addition to selling basic household necessities, they sell vegetables, meat, fish by the pound, and also certain stationery items, school supplies, ice cream, and other things. 

They work every day from 6:30am to 8:00pm. She tells us that their store was one of the first that existed here, and that fortunately, it has kept going until now. With it, they were able to raise their children. 

She has had her store for more than 20 years, and it has gone very well.  She is going to use this loan to further stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, school supplies, and other things. 

She has been in the communal bank since the beginning, and likes it because the loans have helped her a lot. Her dream is to be healthy enough to keep  moving forward.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old. He is married with five children aged 5 and 21 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 25 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a repeat client with UGAFODE Microfinance, who previously applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman who owns a restaurant and she is a hardworking lady. In a bid to increase her working capital she has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

Pictured is Juliet (left) and the UGAFODE staff at her business.

loans.use: to boost business

loans.name: Nancy Yamileth

texts.en: Mi nombre es Nancy G., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio desde hace 5 años, mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa de habitacion, y mi clientela son mis vecinos y gente que me encarga mas de 100 tortillas para alguna fiesta o celebracion de cumpleaños, mi negocio me genera ingresos para la alimentacion de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de harina de maiz para poder producir mayores cantidades de tortillas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa (negocio), mantener a mi familia y lo mas importante el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, agua, leña, fosforos, carbon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, salt, soaps, and dairy meal

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S. is 26 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 young children.  She sells a type of Cambodian meatballs and can earn $8/day, while her husband is a mototaxi driver.  She will use this loan to repair their home in preparation for the rainy season.  She would like to continue with her current business so that she may send her children to school.

loans.use: To repair home to prevent flooding during rainy season

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is widow, and she lives with her children. Her husband died from cancer in Pakistan 4 years ago. She is supporting her family. She is a tailor. She wants to expand her business, so she wants to take a group loan to buy tailoring machines to make a good income and help more with her family. She is happy. She would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean married in 1964 and has 7 children, 3 sons and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her sister-in-law in 1964 and started producing silk at that time. Two of her daughters who are still living under her roof also weave silk. Her husband farms and raises cows and buffalos.

Yean has already borrowed and repaid two loans from MAXIMA. The current loan amount she is requesting is US$ 1,000. Yean plans to use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and to pay for selecting and preparing thread on the looms for herself and for her daughters’ looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material, sewing thread, and pay for selecting and preparing thread on the family looms

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in Bekaa. Ali supports his family by running a business of installing sanitary equipment. He needs to upgrade his tools to sustain his business to continue providing for his family. Ali is a very conscientious worker trying to persevere in his installation business. This is the 6th time Ali has requested a loan from Majmoua and he has an excellent history of repayment.

loans.use: Buy new tools for sanitary installations work

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.en:
Huriniso has been selling rice in the Spitamen food market in the district of Khujand, Tadjikistan, for over 10 years. She has many customers, and quickly sells the rice, especially now during the harvest season. She buys rice from peasants in large quantities for a low price, and sells it all in two or three days.

Huriniso is an active client of Microinvest. She is requesting a loan now to purchase more rice. Many of her customers placed ordered several months ahead of time, because the rice she sells is the best quality.

loans.use: Purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a happy mother of a four month old baby. Her husband works as a mechanic in a shop in Juliaca City, and five years ago they decided to air condition and remodel their home which Teresa’s mother left them upon her death, and they decided to put a small grocery store in the home.

This small but well stocked store is enabling them to provide their family’s daily food and cover their home’s basic needs

Now she needs a loan in order to purchase more merchandise such as noodles, sugar, milk, drinks, etc. as the Christmas and New Year holidays are when there is the greatest demand for these products.

“Teresa and her dear family need your help.”

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa, es una alegre madre de un bebé de cuatro meses; hace cinco años junto a su querido esposo, quien trabaja como mecánico en un taller de la ciudad de Juliaca,decidió acondicionar y refaccionar su casita,que por herencia le dejó su madre, y dispuso poner su tiendita de abarrotes.

Ésta pequeña pero surtida bodeguita le está permitiendo brindar sus alimentos diarios a su familia y también cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para comprar más mercadería como fideos, azúcar, leche, bebidas, etc. ya que se aproxima la fiesta de navidad y fin año y es donde hay mayor demanda de estos productos.

“Teresa y su querida familia necesitan de tu ayuda”.

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity and variety of products for her small store.

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.ru:
Fayzali N. is 23 years old, has finished high school, is married and has no children. Fayzali has 5 years experience in agriculture. He is planning to use the loan to purchase wheat seeds. The loan will help him buy the seeds of wheat, plant his plot and harvest the wheat which he will mill into flour and bake bread for his own use. Fayzali is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Нуриддинов Файзали, возраст – 23 года, образование – среднее, женат, детей не имеет. Файзали имеет 5 летний опыт в сельском хозяйстве. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение семян пшеницы. Кредит поможет ему закупить семена пшеницы, засеять участок и получить урожай пшеницы, который он использует для переработки в муку и выпечку хлеба для личного потребления. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of wheat seeds

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An L., 23, is a mother of one child. She works together with her husband as a potato seller and makes on average $20 of income.

This couple hopes to grow their business by purchasing more potatoes and reselling them along the Vietnamese border. It is the right time to grow the business to create good living conditions for the family.

They are now requesting a loan from Kiva of $700 to buy potatoes.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase more potatoes and resell the at the Vietnam border

loans.name: Mamadalieva

texts.ru:
F. Mamadalieva who is 37 years old, is married and has two children. She has secondary education and sews and sells national Tajik dresses. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to find work so she now has the responsibility of the only caretaker in her family. She has a very big experience in this field because she has loved sewing since she was very young and it has been the main source of income for her family. F. started taking out loans at MicroInvest in 2005 and step by step began to purchase materials wholesale and make European clothing. In the future she plans to open a sewing shop and hire more employees.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мамадалиева Фируза- 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей . Образование среднее. Занимается шитьем и продажей национальных платьев. Муж находится в РФ на заработки, поэтому все заботы о семье лежат на ее плечах. Имеет большой опыт в этой сфере, поскольку с детства любила шитье, и это являлась основным источником дохода семьи. Стала кредитором МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2005-ом году и постепенно после шагового кредитования начала закупать оптом материалы и шить европейскую одежду. В будущем планирует открыть цех и увеличить количество сотрудников.

loans.use: Open a sewing shop and hire employees

loans.name: Zaharia

texts.en:
Zaharia is 20 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. Zaharia owns a small clothes shop. Every day, she works from 9am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her shop

loans.name: María Cristina's Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee is now very proud to be in their fourth loan cycle with 17 members. They all get along very well, pay punctually and receive the required assistance in their meetings.

Among the businesses these ladies run are: grocery stores, production of cleaning products, sales of clothing, food, drinks, bijouterie (trinkets and ornaments) and lingerie. For instance, Lizza and Carolina P. make products such as deodorants and detergents and then sell them to residents of the neighborhood.

The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase lingerie, drinks, food and raw materials to make cleaning products and clothing among others.

loans.use: The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase lingerie, drinks, food and raw materials to make cleaning products and clothing among others.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng S. is a 29 year old widow living in the Siem Reap province with her elderly mother and two children. Leng provides care and support for her 72 year old elderly mother, Oung Phliv. She sells roast beef in the local market, making US$3 per day. She is also supported by her children who help her sell roast beef, as well as work in construction. She has asked for a loan of US$200 to invest in her roast beef business. With some capital, she believe she can increase her customer base, raise her daily income and eventually purchase a larger stall. She thinks that there is great potential for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: Invest in roast beef business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is married and has eight children. Emmanuel has recently been greatly impacted by thieves that harassed him and stole his belongings and the small capital he had accrued. His family has also been seriously affected by illness, which has made life very difficult. He does not like to dwell on these issues in his life.

Faced with these numerous difficulties, Emmanuel discovered that GHAPE could be a way out and joined the organization in 1999. Since then he has been able to manage and repay six different loans with no repayment difficulties. Emmanuel is requesting a loan of $400 to improve his provision store. He believes he will succeed because he will personally carry out his activities and there will be no other provisions stores in his neighborhood. His business will help the community by providing them with basic commodities and other goods.

Emmanuel will use his profit to provide for his family, pay his children’s school fees and reinvest in his business for future expansion. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the three-month investment period, low interest rate and the fact that GHAPE inspires him to be a more active businessman.

loans.use: Provisions store

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame   Rokia Cissé   est âgée de 48 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec ses 5 enfants et son époux dans le quartier Hamdallaye B de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région économique de la république du Mali)
Dès son jeune âge elle s’interessa aux activités génératrices de revenus ,mais finit par se spécialiser dans le commerce de  pagnes: wax, fancy, des bazins ( tissus très prisés en afrique de l’ouest)), des tissus brodés et divers articles pour femmes depuis maintenant 5 ans.  
Madame Rokia Cissé est en relation avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans. Elle est à son troisième prêt individuel et les précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de pagnes Fancy, 15 pièces de pagnes Wax, 5 pièces de Bazin  exclusivement sur place au marché de Ségou (quatrième région économique du Mali.) auprès des grossistes de la lingerie.
Elle vend ses marchandises au marché Château de Ségou, chez elle à domicile et de façon ambulante au niveau des entreprises de Ségou  à une clientèle de femmes et d’hommes à crédit (payable mensuellement) ou au comptant.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA par mois. Madame Rokia Cissé  compte ouvrir une boutique pour la vente de pagnes et divers articles
texts.en:
Ms. Rokia Cissé is 48 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her five children and her husband in the Hamdallaye B district of the city of Ségou (fourth economic region of the Republic of Mali). At a young age, she got interested in income-generating work but ended up specializing in commerce in pagnes (colorful Africa cloth): wax, fancy, and in damask (a highly valued fabric in West Africa), embroidered fabrics, and various articles for women. She has been trading in cloth for five years. Ms. Rokia Cissé has been associated with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years now. She is on her third individual loan, and the previous ones have all been correctly repaid. She intends to use this loan to buy: 5 lengths of Fancy pagnes, 15 lengths of Wax pagnes, and 5 lengths of damask, locally and exclusively at the Ségou marketplace from wholesalers of lingerie. She sells merchandise at the Château marketplace of Ségou, out of her home, and door-to-door at enterprises in Ségou. Her customers are women and men who pay on credit (payable monthly) or in cash. She intends to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA each month and to open a boutique to sell pagnes and various articles.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Nantri

texts.id: Ni Ketut Nantri sudah menjadi peternak babi sejak ia menikah sekitar 30 tahun yang lalu, usaha ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya membiayai kehidupan keluarganya termasuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Nantri tinggal berdua dengan suaminya karena anak-anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing-masing. Ni Ketut Nantri selama ini sangat berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya, namun ia mengaku sering mengalami kesulitan karena modal usaha yang sedikit. Melalui program DINARI Ni Ketut Nantri mendapat pinjaman modal sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan setelah akhir periode. Ni Ketut Nantri mempergunakan modal tersebut  untuk membeli 3 ekor bibit babi penggemukan. Dalam satu periode pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan Ni Ketut Nantri bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 250.000,- s/d Rp. 300.000,- per ekornya. Ibu  Ketut Nantri saat ini sangat bersemangat dalam mengembangkan usahanya dan berharap usahanya bisa lebih berkembang sehingga dapat meningkatkan pendapatan keluarganya .
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Nantri is already a pig farmer, since she married 30 years ago, she is in this business to help her husband pay for family expenses, including children's schooling. Today Ni Ketut Nantri lives only with her husband, since their children are married, and live with their own families. Ni Ketut Nantri likes to expand her businses, since she admits that she often faces difficulties, due to limited little. Through DINARI program Ni Ketut Nantri obtain a 6 month loan for Rp. 5,000,000,- with end of period payment (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-10,000.00). Ni Ketut Nantri used that capital to buy 3 fattening piglets. In a 5 month period Ni Ketut Nantri could obtain profit of Rp. 250,000 - Rp. 300,000/piglet. Mrs Ketut Nantri is enthusiastic now to expand her business, and hopes it could flourish and increase family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli anak babi)

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Marielena es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva. Marielena es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Marielena junto a su esposo tienen una botica ubicado en un local alquilado que se encuentra en una calle cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Además Marielena en los últimos meses implemento cabinas de internet en otro local cercano que también es alquilado.

Marielena necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos. Marielena sueña con tener una casa propia, ampliar su negocio con sucursales, buena educación a sus hijos y casarse.
texts.en:
Marielena is a partner in the "Agua Viva" Communal Bank. Marielena is 32 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Marielena and her partner have a pharmacy in a rented store near the central market in Ayacucho. Marielena has been installing internet connections in another store nearby. Marielena needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in medicines. She dreams of having her own home, expanding her business with more branches, and providing her children with a better education, and getting married.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marielena needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she'll use to buy medicines.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory O. built a small room, added chairs and installed DSTV for football (soccer) fans without access to TV. She named her place Sport Plaza, an indoor space for football enthusiasts to watch matches on TV. She charges a small fee (approx 43 cents) per game. She also has a store at the Sport Plaza entrance selling drinks to customers. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($425) to purchase more drinks and increase the number of plastic chairs. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and plastic chairs

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 46 años de edad, habitante de barrio Laureles Norte de la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 19 años de edad, casado su esposa es la que atiende la pulpería. Los planes que tiene para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y que sus hijos se preparen con una profesión .Don Luís posee una pulpería desde hace cuatro años de edad, el inicio con recursos propios generado por el trabajo que poseía. En el ámbito económico es aumentar las ventas con nuevos productos que nuestros clientes van a preferir. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic cumplirá los planes económicos en la compra de productos como: granos básicos, verduras, frutas, cosméticos y variedades aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Luís is 46 years old, a resident of the neighborhood Laureles Norte of the capital of Managua. He has two sons, of 12 and 19 years of age. He is married to his wife, who is the one who works in the shop. The plans that he has for his family are to improve the living conditions and to prepare his children for a profession. Don Luís has had the shop for four years and started it with his own resources by his work. In the economic field, he wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients. Thanks to the loans from Afrodenic, he will meet the economic plans in the purchase of products such as grains, vegetables, fruits, cosmetics, and varieties to grow his revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Kren

texts.en: Mrs. Kren T. was born in 1961 and she now lives in Trapaing Ktom village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Moeurn Chey, is a taxi driver. In this business, he now faces a problem because his car’s engine needs to be changed; unfortunately, he does not have enough money to buy an engine for his car. Thus, Mrs. Kren T. decided to ask for a loan to buy it for her husband. Mrs. Kren T. has three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for a taxi.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. is thirty-five years old. She is a wife and mother of three children, all in primary school. She lives at Bawalashie community, a suburb of Accra, Ghana. She is a trader and sells groceries like toiletries, soaps, candies, biscuits, and soft drinks. She has been in this business for the past three years.

As a mother, Victoria works hard to support her husband in taking care of their children. Her husband is a taxi driver and they both work hard to sustain the family. She buys the groceries from Accra central market. She also orders the drinks directly from the manufacturers in Accra at wholesale prices. She operates her business in a kiosk in front of her rented apartment.

With this loan, she wants to purchase groceries and drinks in bulk to avoid the price hikes that constantly reduce her profit. She believes the loan funds would enable her to improve her income and save more to support her family, especially her kids’ education.

loans.use: To buy groceries and drinks in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El señor Porfirio M. tiene ya más de 2 años dedicándose a su negocio de venta de abarrotes, este es el ingreso de su familia.
    Al negocio les esta haciendo más variedad de mercancía como es venta de verduras, lácteos, papelería y uniformes escolares. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio y está solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar a cabo está inversión. Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera el negocio ya que es la única tienda de la colonia y tiene muy buenas ventas.
texts.en:
Mr Porfirio M. has been selling groceries for more than 2 years. This is the family's income. His business needs a bigger variety of goods such as vegetables, milk, stationery and school uniforms. But at this moment, he doesn't have the necessary money to invest in the business, therefore he is requesting a loan to be able to do it. He plans to repay the loan with the income generated from the sales since his grocery shop is the only one in the neighborhood and he has very good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen C. is 31 years old and married with a child. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is a hair stylist and sells hair cream and hair extensions. She hopes for a loan of $675 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. Helen says "Thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Afi Maimounatou

texts.fr: Cette dame est une infirmière et réside dans le quartier d’attiégou un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, disposant d’un cabinet médical depuis 2006,elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter du matériel médical, des lits et d’autres médicaments de première urgence afin de satisfaire plus convenablement ses patients. Maimounatou afi est mariée et a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is a nurse. She resides in Attiégou, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. With a medical office since 2006, she's requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy medical equipment, beds, and more first aid medicines in order to satisfy her patients more appropriately. Maimounatou Afi is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medical equipment and essential medecines

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Arame S. née en 1972 est mariée avec 07 enfants et 01 autre personne à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Nguèye -Nguèye depuis 4 ans. Arame veut renforcer son activité d’embouche bovine. Elle compte acheter des sujets, le vaccin et le complément nutritionnel pour les engraisser avant de les revendre. Son objectif est d’augmenter les revenus de la famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Arame S. was born in 1972; she is married and has seven children of her own and one additional dependent. She has been a member of the Nguèye -Nguèye village bank for four years. Arame wants to bolster her cattle-raising business. She plans to buy more cattle, vaccines and feed to fatten her livestock before reselling them. Her goal is to increase her family income. This loan will be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle, vaccines and feed for her livestock business

loans.name: Isabel Amélia

texts.pt:
Isabel Amélia M. é natural de Maputo no distrito de Boane, tem 26 anos de idade, mãe de um filho com 4 anos de idade, alem do seu filho sustenta uma empregada que vive com ela.
  
Isabel estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida, Isabel desde a sua infância sempre está morar no mesmo distrito, desde 2003 vive de negocio que consiste na compra e venda de produtos diversos, tem um estabelecimento sita no quilometro 16, abre o mesmo das 7 as 21h da segunda a sexta e fim de semana abra as 9 e fecha as 00h, deste negocio tem uma receita mensal de 5000,00mt do qual consegue poupar 1500,00mt periodicamente.

Isabel solicita empréstimo pela 3ª vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Futuramente Isabel continuara no aumento de mercadoria e conta com empréstimo na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Isabel Amelia M. is from Maputo in the district of Boane, she is 26 years old, and has 4 year old son, besides her son she supports an employee who lives with her. Isabel was still in high school when she got pregnant, she has been living in the same district since she was a child. Since 2003, her business has been to buy and sell diverse products, she has a store at the 16 kilometer which opens from 7am to 9pm from Mondays to Saturdays and from 9am to 12noon during the weekends, this business has a monthly income of 500,00mt from which she is able to save 1500,00mt periodically. Isabel is requesting a loan for the third time with Hluvuku and first with Kiva, in order to increase her stock. In the future Isabel will continue to increase her merchandise and count with the loans from Hluvuku.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise to buy and sell diverse products

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 29 years old. She has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working and resourceful mother. She is a supplier and retailer of charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Felicia obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding village of Dukope in the northern region of Ghana and retails them to her customers.

Felicia wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called the “Thank you” trust group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Herebella

texts.en: Herebella A. is from the village of Danao. She is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Herebella owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Herebella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma tiene 48 años D. edad vive en el distrito D. Laredo, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria , tiene 3 hijos , pero ninguno dependen D. ella económicamente.
Actualemnte Irma  se dedica  a la venta D. ropa para niños, caballeros y damas.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro productos D. limpieza como: desinfectantes, aromáticos, lejía, ácido muriático. etc. para el negocio que antes tenía.
Con este crédito D. S/ 2,000soles, lo invertirá en su actual negocio, en la compra D. ropa para caballeros, damas y niños.
Irma tiene como sueño tener un stand D. ropa para todas las edades en un centro comercial D. Trujillo
texts.en:
Irma is 48 years old, lives in Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. The businesswoman has completed 5th year of secondary school, has 3 children, but none of them are economically dependent upon her. Today Irma sells clothing for children, men, and women. With her first loan for 300 soles she bought cleaning products such as disinfectants, air fresheners, bleach, and muriatic acid, etc. for the business that she used to have. With this loan for S./2000 soles, she will invest in her current business, buying clothing for men, women and children. Irma dreams of having a clothing for people of all ages in a stand in the Trujillo central market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for children, men, and women.

loans.name: Nonette

texts.en:
Nonette A. is from the village of Langcangan, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 27 years old. Nonette is single and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Nonette owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nonette has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from this activity.

On December 16, 2008, Nonette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nonette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nonette is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: God Thank You Group

texts.en: Finda is a mother of five children and has never been to school. She is involved in the sale of food staples (salt, rice, oil, etc.) in the Foya town community in Lofa County, north of Liberia. For the past 8 years, Finda attracts customers to her business by means of good presentation, conversation, and reasonable prices for the goods. Her goal is to generate more money to pay for her children’s educations and provide a good home for them.

loans.use: To buy food staples for resale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Gina is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gina has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,300 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Judi

texts.en:
Judi S. sells beans and green vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell. Judi is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. 


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en: Idalyn V. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Idalyn owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables, bananas and coconuts for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Idalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase land to raise additional crops. Idalyn is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin S., 24, is a low-income people and a local villager lives in the rural area of Battambang Province. Sin S. and her husband are local rice farmers. Beside their farm, they also weak up in early morning to buy fresh fish in bulk in which fishermen gathering and hurry bring those fishes to sell in retails at the market. This young couple has two kids who are dependent on their income. Sin S. hopes to generate additional income through operating a new suitable investment but she has not enough capital to begin. To help provide with capital, she has asked for a loan to build/decorate the size of business place and then to purchase disks to sell or rent out to her villager. With the remainder of the loan she will use to sustain her both businesses above.

loans.use: To build/decorate the size of business place and then to purchase disks to sell or rent out to her villager

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 39 years old.  She is engaged in selling snack foods like "banana cue" (fried bananas on barbecue sticks).  She sells in their village in Nagassican. She is selling them house to house to earn bigger income to meet the needs of her family.  She is married to Elpidio Sr., who is a government employee; and they have three loving children: Lovely-14 years old who is a high school student; Elpidio Jr.-11 years old, an elementary pupil and Daisy May -- an eight-year old elementary pupil.

Susana and Elpidio hope that they would be able to continue support the schooling of their three children. In this regard, they strive hard to meet the basic needs of the family. Susana says that time is gold and because of this she keeps herself busy vending her goods. She would like to apply a loan amounting PHP5,000. She hopes for the approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana cue vending business

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Fatia Namagembe Group

texts.en: Fatia N., 28, is married with two school age children.  She has been selling clothes for three years. She is using the loan to purchase more stock of used clothes for sale. She wishes to improve upon her business so that she can be selling a larger range of clothes to her customers.  Her future plan is to expand her business so that she will be able to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nyiva

texts.en: Nyiva is 31 years old and sells children's clothes to walk-ins and frequent customers at Gikomba market. This is an open-air market just outside the city center. She started this business in 2004 and has borrowed KES 20,000 and repaid successfully. Her business challenges are competition and insecurity in the market.  She is using the proceeds of the loan of KES50,000 to buy more children's clothes in preparation for the holiday season.  She wants to be a wholesaler.  Nyiva is single and describes herself as hardworking, jovial and social.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He is a 34-year-old, married with no children. He sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, candies, etc.

With the loan, Mohammed wants to buy more products to increase his stock of goods. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: Buy more products to increase his stock of goods

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca P. L.  en 1979 empezó a vender comida de manera independiente ya que desde muy niña aprendió este oficio con su madre quien tenia una cominería la cual le heredo. Actualmente esta señora de 51 años desea hacer reformas al negocio para poder brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
In 1979, Juana Francisca P. L. began to sell prepared food on her own, since from the time she was small girl she had learned this business from her mother, who owned the small eatery Juana later inherited. Currently this 51 year old businesswoman wishes to make improvements to the eatery in order to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Santa Amalia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Amalia está integrado por tres mujeres que se dedican a la compra y venta de frutas. Cruz V. P. inicio hace tres años con pocos productos pero luego con los préstamos invirtió en mayor cantidad y variedad lo que le permitió mejorar su negocio.

Damaris L. T. vende tomates, papaya, plátanos y melón entre otras frutas de acuerdo a la temporada y Grethel del Carmen P. también vende frutas en el mercado de Masaya de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The Santa Amalia Communal Bank is composed of three women that buy and sell fruits. Cruz V. P. began her business three years ago with few products but later, with the help of loans, she invested in a greater quantity and variety of fruits, which enabled her to improve her business. Damaris L. T. sells tomatoes, papaya, bananas and melons, among other fruits, depending on the season, and Grethel del Carmen P. also peddles fruits in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta B. is from the village of Cabol-Anonan, Tudela. She is 63 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Perfecta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling kitchen utensils such as lunch boxes, spoons, food covers, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Perfecta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,900 PHP from GDMPC. Perfecta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose owns a grocery store where she sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is a hard working woman who loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Rose loves her business and family so much that she is determined to lift them out of poverty. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She is 53 years old and married to a commercial driver. Her husband also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ania Lucrecia

texts.es: Ania es una joven, de 25 años de edad, vive en el barrio  las Ameritas, casada, su esposo es policía, tiene una pulpería que inicio hace un año en donde vende una variedad de productos, inicio este negocio con ahorros y liquidación de su trabajo el cual renuncio con el objetivo de poder crecer y administrar su propio negocio. Ella aun no tiene casa propia, pero si tiene un terreno que su mama dio, que espera pronto poder comenzar hacer su casa ya que es lo que mas anhela. Junto a su esposo alquilan la casa en donde viven, con este financiamiento desea invertir en compras como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, golosinas, cereales, gaseosas, productos enlatados, lácteos, huevos, pollo y carne para aumentar las ventas y cada día lograr un mejor capital que espera con las ganancias ahorrar para la construcción de su casa. El cual espera lograr con estos financiamientos que le permita gozar de mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Ania is a 25-year-old young woman who lives in the Ameritas neighborhood with her husband who is a policeman. She has a small general store in her house that she started a year ago. She started this business with savings and severance pay from a job she recently left, hoping to grow and manage her own business. She still doesn't have her own home, but does has some land her mother gave her that would to able to start building her house on -- this is what she most longs. She and her husband are renting a home. With this loan she would like to invest in the purchase of: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, sweets, cereals, soft drinks, canned goods, milk products, eggs, chicken, and meat to increase her sales achieving better capital each day. She hopes to save her earnings to build her house. What she would like to get from this loan is to be able to have better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cereals, sweets, soft drinks, milk products, and meat to increase sales.

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mercedes está integrado por  tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Milagro de Jesús Bermúdez Sosa  una señora humilde que sueña con tener un terreno para construir ahí su casa. Esta desde hace quince años se dedica a la compra y venta de leña. Ella según comento inicio con poco pero conforme a los créditos su negocio ha mejorado ya que con los préstamos adquiere mayor cantidad de leña.

Otra de las integrantes es Mauda Patricia M. Bermúdez quien tiene una pequeña pulpería.  Mientras Lucero Gaviota L. Garay una joven risueña y decidida para poder costear sus estudios universitarios empezó a comercializar productos de la Zermat. Ella actualmente  está en el último año de la carrera de Trabajo Social.

Ellas invertirán el crédito para ampliar sus respectivos negocios con la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
The Mercedes Group consists of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Milagro de Jesús Bermúdez Sosa. She is a modest woman who dreams of having her own land for building a house. For the past fifteen years, she has been buying and selling firewood. According to her, she started with little and the loans have helped to shape and improve her business. She wants to acquire more firewood.

One of the other members is Mauda Patricia M. Bermúdez, who has a small grocery store. Meanwhile, Lucero Gaviota L. Garay is a cheerful young woman who decided to earn money to pay for her university studies. She started selling products made by Zermat (a cosmetics line) and is in her last year before earning her degree in social work.

They will invest their loan to expand their respective businesses by purchasing large quantities of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Priyanthi

texts.en:
Priyanthi is a 36-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura area, Matara with two children and her husband. She works hard together with her husband to uplift their lives.  Priyanthi's husband has a carpentry business for which they are seeking a loan to expand their venture.  

She has asked for a loan of 25,000 LKR from BRAC in order to purchase some machinery to aid in the carpentry.  They have been in this business for ten years and they want to buy new machines for the carpentry through this loan.  She hopes to open a new carpentry shop in the near future.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy some machinery

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco Antonio L. A. de 25 años de edad, reside en la cabecera departamental de Santa Ana. Vive únicamente junto a su madre quien trabaja como empleada doméstica. Francisco se dedica a la venta de medicinas, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante, ofreciéndolas a los clientes, quienes deben hacer un pedido previo para poder obtenerlas. Sus ventas son  a crédito, pero él debe hacer las comprar de las medicinas al contado, por lo que desea contar con el dinero necesario para hacer varios pedidos y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas, ya que en la actualidad son pocas, ya que no puede hacer grandes pedidos. Es por esto que Francisco solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda mejorar su negocio, contando con mayor cantidad de productos y de esta manera mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Francisco Antonio L. A., age 25, lives in the capital of the department of Sana Ana. He lives with his mother, who works as a domestic employee. Francisco sells medicine as a street vendor. He sells to customers, who must place an order ahead of time in order to get the medicines. He sells on credit, but he needs to buy the medicine for cash. That is why he wants to have the money he needs to fill various orders and increase his sales. He currently has few sales because he cannot fill large orders. That is the reason that Francisco is requesting a loan from Integral. Using the loan he will be able to improve his business and have a greater quantity of products. This way he will improve his economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicines

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 and married with four children, all of whom have completed school. She is a farmer in Central Kenya in Muranga town. She has been farming for 15 years with only one employee. Her main products are milk and maize which she sells to the local market. Cecilia depends on the income from her business to take care of her family's needs.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.53,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce more milk and increase her income. Her biggest challenges are unpredictable weather conditions, unstable milk prices, and animal diseases. In future she intends to acquire three pure-bred dairy cows.

She says that "Juhudi is setting a good example that community development can use to improve society's economic situation." She says that, through this project, she will be able to develop economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es: Luisa Maria tiene 38 años, su actividad es la elaboración y venta de artesanía y venta de leña, a pesar de que Luisa es una mujer muy escasos recursos ha encontrado la forma de mejorar su condición de vida.  Sus hijos viven con ella pues todavía están a su cargo, es una persona muy emprendedora. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, con la ayuda de su esposo han logrado mejorar la situación de gastos de su familia. El financiamiento que se solicita es para la compra de materia prima y leña ya que sus artículos son muy importantes para mejorar su hogar. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y adquirir más activos.
texts.en:
Luisa María is 38 years old. Her activity is making and selling crafts and selling wood. In spite of being a women with few resources, Luisa has found a way to improve her standard of living. Her children live with her as they are still underage. She is a very enterprising person. For more thatn 3 years she has been working at this business and with the help of her husband has managed to improve the family´s financial situation. The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies and wood, which are important for improving her household. She hopes to expand her business and acquire more assets.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Bella S., from the town of Sto. Niño, is married and has four school-aged children. For the past five years Bella has been raising pigs for fattening and sale in order to make a living.

In 2005, Bella joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, Bella is requesting a new loan, her ninth, of 15000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve the living conditions of her family.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Chou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. T. C. is a 32 year old married woman and lives in in Trapeang, Thum village, Takeo province. She is the village bank president and was selected by its thirteen members. Each member of this village loan will usethe loan to support their different needs. 

Mrs. T. C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Borin Phoa, is a motorcycle taxi driver.This couple has three children, who all are attending in the local school.

With their two businesses they are able to earn sufficient income to support their family's living expenses.  Mrs. T. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy additional piglets for her new business. The will use the loan to increase their income and improve their family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her new business

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, actualmente solo vive con 1 hija que le ayuda en el negocio, Senobia tiene un puesto en el mercado Central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. venD. caldos típicos, que prepara por la noche, y venD. desD. las 7 D. la mañana hasta la 1 D. la tarD.. Además Senobia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general. 
Senobia pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y solicita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, sal, jabones.
Su sueño es tener un recreo en su casa y ya no salir al mercado.
texts.en:
Senobia is married and has 3 children, currently only 1 daughter lives with her and helps with her business. Senobia has a stand in the central market of Ayacucho where she sells traditional regional soups, which she prepares the night before. She sells from 7 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. In addition, Senobia has a general store in her home where she sells basic goods. Senobia belongs to the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "let´s grow" in Quechua. She is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles, which will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk, salt and soap. Her dream is to have small restaurant in her home so she does not have to go out to the market. .

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, sal, jabones.

loans.name: Mohan Maiya

texts.en:
This is 40 year old Mohan Maiya R.. She is married and has 2 children aged 14 and 7. In 2009, she established her grocery business. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods. In the future, Mohan Maiya plans to expand her shop.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Sandra Yanina

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven madre de familia, tiene 18 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y a su menor hijo en el centro poblado Santa Rosa del distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad,se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de bebidas en una bodega situada en su domicilio, ella ofrece todo tipo de bebidas a sus clientes y vecinos desde hace diez meses, este negocio cuenta con bastante acogida ya que el buen trato con el que brinda a sus clientes le han hecho conocida en la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad colabora con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su esposo se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima trabajando.

Sandra desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas bebidas, de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven bastante tranquila y optimista, su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para asegurarle a su familia la calidad de vida que ellos necesitan. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Sandra, 18, is a young mother. She lives with her mother and young son in Santa Rosa, Pueblo Nuevo district, an agricultural area that is part of Chepén province, La Libertad region. It is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has a store in her house where she sells all kinds of beverages to her customers and neighbors. She has been in business for 10 months. Her store is quite popular thanks to the good service she provides; she has become quite well known in the area. Earnings from this activity allow her to contribute to the family’s support. Her husband is currently working in Lima. Sandra wants to expand her business buying more beverages so that she can better meet customer demand.
