To reach this goal she has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for an 800 new sol loan. She is quite a levelheaded, optimistic young woman. Her dream is to continue to grow as a businesswoman to insure for her family the quality of life they need. In the area where she lives her neighbors consider her to be a responsible and hard working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages.

loans.name: Las Picaflores Group

texts.en:
The communal bank, “Las Picaflores”, consists of 16 entrepreneurs from the Padre Las Casas district. These individuals' livelihoods consist of sales: including pastries, chocolates, jewellery, cosmetics, perfumes, and sales of used and new clothing items. 

Marcela is the secretary of this group. Marcela can be found in the photo, seated in the first row and in the first seat from left to right. Marcela makes baked goods from her house based on orders placed. Marcela’s most requested item is her fruit tart with whip cream. With this loan, Marcela plans to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, decorating moulds, along with additional ingredients for tarts. Marcela’s dream is to have a pastry shop with industrial ovens located in the same sector where she lives. Marcela’s motivation stems from her daughter, a nine year old, and to pay for her future studies. Marcela is happy to work with Fondo Esperanza, due to the loans that she has received and the coexistence she shares with her fellow group members, those who share their experiences and crafts. 

Padre de Las Casas is a municipality to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the city of Temuco, Araucanía Region. Padre de Las Casas municipality was named in honour of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who defended the indigenous during the conquest of the America. There is still a large Mapuche population in this community. Its economy is based in agri-business and commercial services.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for tarts.

loans.name: Jovani

texts.en:
Jovani Y. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Jovani is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jovani raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sale. Jovani has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jovani joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovani is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed. This loan will be Jovani's first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and repay debts

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa R., 51 years old and mother of 3 children, just joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) – a partner microfinance institution of KIVA here in the Philippines this year. When she heard of ASHI she instantly topped the list of those who were interested to join the program. She is deeply encouraged by the principle of the institution and the financial assistance it provided to people with nothing to put up for collateral or a guarantee. After days of rigid seminars, she became a full-pledge member.

Now Marissa is applying for a loan of PPH 5,000 to fund her buying and selling of fish and vegetables project. She dreams of having a stable business in the future to help her husband and family. Her earnings from this venture will be use to expand her business and support her family in their needs. She is hoping and praying that ASHI and KIVA will help her achieve her dreams for her 2 youngest sons to pursue their choice of career.

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Juana Lesbia

texts.es:
Juana Lesbia C. de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y esforzada quien se dedica a la producción y comercio de ropa, gabachas, blusas, faldas etc. desde hace 9 años. Ella inicio está actividad porque es costurera y con unas piezas de ropa que hizo le fue muy bien, en la actualidad ella tiene dos colaboradoras quienes realizan la ropa mientras ella se encarga de venderlas.

C. sueña con tener un taller grande que preste las condiciones adecuadas para producir en grandes cantidades y tener una distribuidora de ropa. Ella con el préstamo invertirá en telas y aplicaciones especialmente para la realización de togas, birretes, estolas, uniformes por las promociones tanto de preescolar, de sexo grado y quinto año de secundaria.
texts.en:
Juana Lesbia C. is 42 years old and is a hard working entrepreneurial woman who’s been making and selling clothing, blouses, skirts, etc. for the past nine years.  She began doing this because she is a seamstress and things went well for her when she made a few articles of clothing.  Now she works with two other ladies who make the clothes and she is in charge of sales.  Ms. C. hopes to someday have a large workshop with adequate space for producing large quantities of clothing and also serve as a distribution point.

She will use the money from this loan to invest in fabric and accessories for making togas, school caps, stoles, preschool uniforms, and uniforms for sixth grades and junior high school students.

loans.use: Fabric and supplies

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh D. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic home tent) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His oldest daughter attends university while his younger two sons attend a local secondary school.
Batmunh owns his own iron/metal work business producing metal items such as stoves, stove pipes, smokestacks etc. according to his customer's order. He began his business in 1994 and has gained much experience as an ironsmith. After Batmunh produces the items, his wife sells them at the local market. He hopes to continue running this business as a stable operation. His earnings have enabled him not only to provide for his family but also pay his daughter's tuition fees. His business is the only source of family income.
Batmunh is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase raw materials for making metal household items.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making metal household items

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “L. UNION D. OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gregorio; el tiene 48 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio se dedica al negocio D. venta D. pop corn, el venD. en una carreta en una D. las calles D. Ollantaytambo y también trabaja en L. municipalidad D. Ollantaytambo y por las tardes sale a vender el pop corn, el socio quiere tener otra carreta mas para vender. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una carreta nueva.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “L. Union D. Ollantaytambo" (The Ollantaytambo Union).  The bank is located in Ollantaytambo District, which belongs to Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

The member is Sr. Gregorio. He is 48 years old, lives with his partner and has 3 children.  The member makes his living selling popcorn.  He sells the popcorn from a cart in the streets of Ollantaytambo.  He also works in the municipality of Ollantaytambo, and in the afternoons he goes out to sell his popcorn.  Sr. Gregorio wants to have another cart so can can increase his sales.  He is requesting the loan in order to purchase a new cart.

The member thanks all those who are a part of making his dream come true, and he promises to comply with his re-payment schedule in the established time frame.

loans.use: This member is requesting the loan to purchase a new sales cart.

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es:
Ana Elsa, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, ella vive donde una cuñada y tiene una hija que está estudiando en la universidad, su negocio es una tienda donde ofrece productos necesarios para el hogar,  el negocio lo administra desde hace 10 años y además de ofrecer productos de la canasta básica, como jabón, arroz, frijoles, también ofrece a los estudiantes útiles escolares. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y útiles escolares, con esta inversión ella quiere ofrecer a los clientes todo lo relacionado al hogar, además contar con un buen inventario capaz para atender la demanda, al mismo tiempo aprovecha que ya viene la época donde los padres de familia compran útiles para el siguiente año escolar.  
El sueño de Ana Elsa es tener un negocio fuerte, con buen número de clientes y mejorar los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Elsa lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her sister-in-law and has a daughter who is is a university student. Ana Elsa has run a store for the last ten years selling products for the home and basic supplies such as soap, rice, and beans. She also sells school supplies.

Ana Elsa is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise for the store and school supplies. She wishes to be able to offer her customers everything related to the home. With a well-stocked store she can fill any request. As well she wishes to take advantage of the upcoming school year when parents are buying supplies for their children.

Ana Elsa’s dream is to have a healthy business with lots of customers, and to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, beans, soap) and school supplies

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys B. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children whom are in school.  She also takes care of her father. Gladys has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Gladys sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Gladys has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing material.The main business challenges for Gladys are defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to own a tailoring school. Gladys in a home that she owns she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert G. is a married father of two children, aged seven and six years old, for whom he and his wife hope to provide a good education to the university level. His wife runs a grocery store, while Albert owns a motor bike and has been providing transport services to the local people of Mukuru Kwa Njenga for four years now. He says that this business is profitable, but his major challenge is competition from the many others offering similar transportation services. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy spare motor bike parts in preparation for a busy festive season. He also plans to stock their grocery store to increase their earnings during the Christmas season. Albert hopes to grow his business by purchasing more motor bikes and eventually vans for his business. He also sees himself building a nice house for his family. He describes himself as wise, aggressive and business-minded. Albert is served by the Kitengela branch.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and vegetables

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is an employee of Medical Relief in the city of Tulkarem. She organizes health workshops for women. Haneen's husband is a municipal employee. Haneen and her husband wanted to start a family business to increase their income and secure their three sons' futures, so they started a poultry farm. Haneen came to FATEN to get a loan to construct chicken coops on the farm.

loans.use: to develop the farm by purchasing chicken coops

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em M., 60, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. M. is a housewife while two of her children are employed, earning an income of USD 2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 55 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to dig a well and purchase wire to light the house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: dig a well and purchase wire to light the house

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 41 years old and married with 5 children.  Her husband is a businessman.  Jeannette owns a well-organized store in Nyabugogo.  She has had this store for 10 years and employs 2 people. Her business is open from 7:30am until 5pm every day.

Jeannette will use the requested loan to purchase more clothing to sell.  With any profits she makes from the sale of her new stock, she plans to save for the future of her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Pom B., 20, is married and lives with one young child in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$5 each day. Pom B. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Rosita Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosita es socia del banco comunal Juntas Hasta El Final, del Distrito de Manatay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos menores.
Recién lleva 5 ciclos perteneciendo a la familia de Manuela Ramos, cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa, gracias a ello puede atender al mismo tiempo a sus hijos.
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/.2,000.00 comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, ½ caja de leche, 2 cajas de galleta, 3 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 paquete de fideo, ½ caja de conservas, ½ caja de fruta al jugo, ½ caja de huevo, ½ caja vinagre, ½ caja de sillao.
Su negocio no deja mayores ganancias pero es una gran ayuda para su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte, maneja un motokar con el que presta servicio de taxi, los dos aportan dinero para su hogar, de esa manera están dando educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosita is a member of the Communal Bank “Juntas Hasta El Final” (Together Until The End) which is in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 39 years old, married, and has two young children. Rosita has participated in five loan cycles as part of the Manuela Ramos family. She has a small store in her home, which allows her to take care of her children at the same time.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy the following items: one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, ½ case of milk, two crates of chicken, three packets of toilet paper, one packet of noodles, ½ case of preserves, ½ case of fruit juice, ½ create of eggs, ½ case of vinegar, and ½ case of soy sauce.

Her business does not generate a lot of profit, but her husband is a great help since he works in transportation. He drives a motorcar used for providing taxi services. The two of them are able to maintain their household and provide their children with an education.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 25 years old, unmarried, and without children. 

Alice sells traditional African fabrics called kitenge. She has done this business for five years. The business has allowed Alice to develop herself. 

After buying more fabrics, Alice hopes to use the profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics

loans.name: Anita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Anita lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras, una de ellas es Anita Pavón de 60 años quien tiene una pulpería. El negocio lo inicio con la venta de chiverías hace 3 años.
Ella tiene tres hijos menores de 15, 12 y 8 años por los que trabaja arduamente y su meta es tener una miscelánea.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yahaira Raquel Abellán Pavón de 25 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años y Amparo Pavón Jarquín de 49 años propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace 6 año.
texts.en:
The Anita group is made up of three hard-working, determined and enterprising women.  One of them is 60 year-old Anita Pavón who owns a grocery store.  She started her business selling yoghurt products three years ago.

Anita has three children, aged 15, 12 and 8, for whom she works hard.  Her goal is to own a general store.

The other members of this group are 25 year-old Yahaira Raquel Abellán Pavón who has been selling clothes for 5 years and 49 year-old Amparo Pavón Jarquín who has owned a small grocery store for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, cheese, eggs, yoghurt, etc.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia K., 45 years old, is in the business of selling alcohol. She will use her loan to stock more alcohol. A widow with six children, two of whom attend school, Cicilia's long-term goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol.

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia S. a 39 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 4 enfants à Kaboila I Natien, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadia S. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée aux activités de restauration et cela depuis plus de quinze ans. Elle mène son activité devant le domicile conjugal en face de l’ancienne Direction Régionale des Affaires Sociales, tous les jours, où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quatre ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 11ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce onzième prêt, elle compte acheter,  5 sacs de pomme de terre, 5 paquets de cube maggi, 3 bidons de vinaigre, 40 sachets d’Attièkè,  35kg de viande de bœuf,  50kg de poissons frais, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire,  3 sacs de charbon de bois, des miches de pain, des bananes plantain (Aloko), etc. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement des jeunes (célibataires) surtout d'employers  de commerce puisque sa place n’est pas loin du marché où il se trouve des magasins de stock de céréales. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour les dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia S. is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in Kaboila I Natien, in the center of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). After having tried many business activities without success, over 15 years ago Mrs. Kadia S. decided to start cooking food for sale. She sells by their family home, in front of the former Regional Office for Social Affairs, every day.  Her business is very popular with customers because of the high quality of her products.

In order to meet the growing customer demand, over four years ago she decided to turn ot the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. After several solidarity loans (group loans) under the auspices of the local women’s association, she is now on her 11th individual loan. All her prior loans have been duly repaid.

With this 11th loan, she plans to buy five bags of potatoes, five packs of “Maggi” bouillon cubes, three jugs of vinegars, 40 packs of “attieke” (a traditional manioc-based dish), 35 kg of beef, 50 kg of fresh fish, five liters of vegetable oil, three bags of charcoal, bread loaves, plantains etc. She buys her wares locally and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed generally of young (unmarried) people, mostly vendors, as she is based near the area where cereal warehouses are located. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 300,000 West African Francs, which will be used mainly for covering family expenses and paying the interest on her loan, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-serving business

loans.name: New Hope Group

texts.es:
Para la formación D. presente comité, tuvo el inicio la Señora Norma D. km. 9 Acaray de Ciudad D. Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se denomina “Nueva Esperanza" están en el Quinto Ciclo con 15 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsables entre ellas, realizan actividades para el fondo D. grupo en caso de que alguna compañera esté con dificultades de pago.
En el caso de la Sra. Nancy, solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas nuevas y usadas para seguir creciendo en esta actividad, más ahora que se aproxima el frío D. invierno.
Ella se dedica netamente a esto pues es un ingreso seguro que posee debido a la cantidad de buenos clientes que fue adquiriendo a través D. tiempo.
Hoy día todas están con esperanzas de poder prosperar con la ayuda de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The group was formed by Norma of km. 9 Acaray of Ciudad D. Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in their community. The name of this group is "Neuva Esperanza", meaning "New Hope". The 15 members of the group are on their fifth loan cycle. It is a group well-known in their community for being very united, supportive, and responsible to each other. They carry out activities for the group fund in case a member ever has trouble with their payment.

IN the case of Nancy, she requests a loan to purchase new and used clothing to keep her business growing, most importantly now that the cold of winter approaches. She dedicates herself solely to this business because it is a secure source of income given the number of good clients whom she has acquired through time. 

Today they all hope to prosper with the help of Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase new and used clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetable to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for three years. Alejandra earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 31 years old with three children who are between 4-11 years old. Her husband is a driver .Jeanne sells fruits, vegetables (such as onions) and other items in her general store such as soap, biscuits and plastic products. She has done this business for the past four years. She has been able to send her children to school and meet their needs with the profits she gets from this business. She wishes to have a loan in order to reinvest in her business by buying more vegetables and fruits and make some profits. With the profits, she plans to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Akpedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKPEDJI est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne Rufine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne Rufine est âgée de 50 ans et est une veuve qui a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, il ne reste qu'un seul à la charge de Julienne Rufine. Julienne Rufine assure seule ses besoins. Pour y parvenir, Julienne Rufine mène comme activité, la vente de cartes de recharges téléphoniques et divers autres produits dans un marché du Bénin. Julienne Rufine s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Julienne Rufine exerce cette activité depuis une quinzaine d'année. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Julienne Rufine désire renforcer son activité par l'augmentation du stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Julienne Rufine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPEDJI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Akpedji is composed of three residents of the same district in Benin. The group's representative, named Julienne Rufine, is raising her hand on the picture. This is the first time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to increase their level of activity.
Julienne Rufine is 50 years old and a widow with four children, who all go to school. Among the children, only one still depends on her financially. She supports herself on her own. For this, Julienne Rufine is in the business of selling prepaid phone cards and various other products at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's largest markets. She has been in this business for about fifteen years.
To better satisfy her customers' demands, Julienne Rufine wishes to strengthen her activity by increasing her stock of products. To achieve this, Julienne Rufine and group Akpedji's other members are requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards and various products.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hard-working, 42 year-old business lady. She is single and a proud mother of two school-going children. She has been selling fruits for the last 11 years to make ends meet. In the next five years, she wants to become a major supplier of fruits in the region. Her dream is to see her business grow and expand. Joyce wants a loan of 50000 Kenya shillings to buy bananas and avocados. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bananas and avocados to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un padre D. familia D. 32 años D. edad,es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el cuenta con casa propia L. cual esta ubicada en L. zona urbano marginal del distrito D. Lambayeque, cuenta con servicios D.  luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado D. 100  familias.

Julio se e dedica  a L. agricultura desD. hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras D. cultivo donD.  siembra arroz; una vez que se da L. cosecha lo venD. en los mercados D. L. zona, es un producto muy rentable, al cual se dedica desD. varios años, adicionalmente en su tiempo libre ofrece el servicio D. transporte publico D. pasajeros en una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas) , esta actividad L. realiza desD. hace 6 meses, el mayormente realiza esta actividad cerca a L. zona por donD. vive,

Julio ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para L. compra D. fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras D. cultivo y asegurarse D. tener una muy buena producción D. arroz y para el pago D. mano D. obra para las personas que le ayudan y también necesita hacer los tramites para L.  renovación D. su licencia D. conducir.

Julio es una persona  responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Julio is a 32-year-old father, married, and has two children. He owns a home in a marginalized urban area in the District of Lambayeque. Julio receives electricity. This small community has approximately 100 families.

Julio has been farming for some time. He has his own land on which he grows rice. When his crop is ready to harvest, he sells it at the local markets. Rice is a very profitable crop and he has been farming for several years. In addition, Julio offers public transportation services in his free time. He transports passengers using a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin for carrying people). Julio started this business six months ago and most of his business takes place near the area where he lives.

Julio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers to apply on his farmland. This will assure him of good rice production. In addition, he will pay workers to assist him and renew his driver’s license.

Julio is a responsible and hardworking individual whose only wish is to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay his workers, and renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es: Santos Antonio tiene 36 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. hace mas 12 años que tiene esta actividad, inicio desde muy joven con  esfuerzo propio ya que lo aprendio por sus padres. tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, el siempre esta buscando la manera de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. el financiamiento es para la compra de toros, vacas, chivos entre otros. el desea ampliar cada dia su negocio.
texts.en: Santos Antonio is 36 years old and has been buying and selling livestock for a living for more than 12 years.   He started this business on his own when he was very young since he learned it from his parents.  He has a dependent child.  He is always looking for ways to provide for his family financially.  He will use the loan to buy livestock such as bulls, cows, and goats.  He wants to expand his business everyday.

loans.use: buy bulls, cows, and goats.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling at wholesale and retail to her neighbors and passersby. Pili dreams of expanding her wholesaling in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 20 years.  He is 54 years old, married to Ruth, and has three school-going children.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the money to buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production.  In the future, Gideon hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
El socio Sergio es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 22, 11 años de edad, el socio se dedica a la construcción en el poblado y fuera del pueblo también, el socio desea el crédito en esta ocasión para poder comprar herramientas ya que le han robado, el socio desea invertir el crédito en la compra de sus nuevas herramientas para laborar, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas como martillo, cincel, badilejos, serruchos, cierras  entre otros.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA” bank.  This friendly bank is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco in the village called Yuncaypata.  This is a typical small village, in that it conserves its pure Andean heritage and they live together as a community, helping each other at sowing and harvest times, and looking after each other's children and animals.   It is a very pretty village, and they speak the Quechua language.  It is in the Department of Cusco.

The member, Sergio, is married and has three children aged 24, 22 and 11.  The member works in construction in the village and also outside it.  On this occasion, he wants the loan to be able to buy tools, as his were stolen.  The member wants to invest the loan in purchasing new tools for his work.  He wants the loan to buy tools such as a hammer, chisel, trowels, and different types of saws, among other things.

The member is grateful and appreciates being able to get a loan through these means.  He agrees to comply with the terms in a disciplined manner, just as he has done with his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy tools such as hammer, chisel, trowels, and different types of saws, among other things.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 55 años, desde hace 7 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de salón de belleza, inició su negocio ofreciendo sus servicios fue comprando ciertos productos poco a poco y así obtener lo que tiene hoy en día. Lo que más le gusta es brindar un buen servicio así sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con este medio de vida. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pintura de labios, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, shampoo, peines, cepillos, entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa Argentina, 55, has had this means of support for the last 7 years.  Her business is providing beauty salon services.  She started the business offering her services buying just a few items gradually until she acquired everything she has to date.  What she likes best is providing good customer service so that her customers will feel satisfied with this way of life.  She will use this loan to buy lipsticks, creams, treatments, nail polish, shampoo, combs and brushes, among others.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams, treatments, nail polish, shampoo, combs and brushes, among others.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a married woman with two grown children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanamwinyi has operated a business selling lesos (kangas - an African garment) for the past ten years; in addition she also sells piped water. Her potential clients are the local community members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of lesos and new pipes for her piped-water selling business. She decided to join Yehu because she wanted access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of lesos and new pipes for her piped-water selling business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 25 years old and married to Orlando. She has a retail shop where she sells products such as canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy other products that she can offer like noodles, canned goods, snack foods and candies.

Jocelyn hopes that someday she can expand her business to achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, snack foods and candies for her store.

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Dolgormaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and a son in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works in the countryside and her son studies at a local elementary school. She started her grocery retail business in 2003 and, as a result, her shop is very well known around the neighborhood. Her daily income is 500,000-600,000 MNT and she bought an apartment with the profit. Now that many new buildings have been built in the neighborhood, she needs to broaden her product range in order to keep up with the new demand. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who said, "There are many new buildings around here and it is my chance to expand my business." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more products.

loans.use: to buy more products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María es una madre soltera de un pequeña de 2 años, de la cual quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Maria trabaja para una maquiladora como operadora desde hace 11 años y medio, pero no le es suficiente lo que ella gana ya que el salario es muy mínimo y le rebajan su casa; por lo que ella opto fue en vender ropa nueva a sus compañera en pagos accesibles que trae de diferentes partes del país. En este momento requiere de un préstamo para comprar pantalones, chamarras, blusas, camisas vaqueras para la temporada decembrina  que es cuando le solicitan más, para estrenar o regalar en Navidad. Es el tiempo que aprovecha María por es cuando recibe más ganancias y de esta manera podrá subir la economía de su hogar.
texts.en: Mrs. María is the single mother of a two-year-old daughter to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Maria has worked in a maquiladora as a machine operator for eleven and a half years. However, her salary is not enough; it is very minimal, and deductions are taken for the housing program. For this reason, she decided to sell new clothing to her friends. She brings in clothing from all around the country and sells it for easy payments. She now needs a loan to purchase pants, jackets, blouses, and denim shirts for the December season; this is when she has the most orders, as customers are getting ready for parties or wanting to give Christmas gifts. Maria takes advantage of this season; it is the time in which she makes the most money and is able to increase her household's income.

loans.use: to buy clothing, such as pants, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu 48, is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces competition from other fish sellers in the area. 

In addition, she also operates a mahamri (dumplings) selling business, which contributes another source of income. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sand and cement to construct her house and purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement to construct her house and purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre, the married father of a six-year-old, has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He will use this Kiva loan to pay labor costs during rice production and to purchase fertilizer and seeds to increase production. With profits from his enterprise, Sylvestre wishes to eventually acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor support.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал занимается купле- продажей скота более 10 лет. Он имеет богатый опыт и с легкостью справляется своими делами. Он трудолюбивый и добрый семьянин. На воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена помогает по бизнесу. Кроме того занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Отходы культур идут на корм скота и поэтому ему выгодно содержать их и продать. Акмал хотел бы получить займ для покупки 2 голов мелкого рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса и улучшения жилищных условий семьи.
texts.en: Akmal has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over ten years.  He has a rich experience and runs his business with ease.  He is a hardworking and kind family man.  Akmal is raising three children.  His wife helps him with the business.  Besides this business, he is involved in growing agricultural crops.  The leftovers from the crops go toward feeding livestock, and this is why it is profitable for Akmal to keep and sell livestock.  Akmal wants to obtain this loan to purchase two heads of small livestock in order to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children. 

Elena has a food shop or "sari-sari store" where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
La estudiante Maria Alejandra acabo el bachillerato en el año 2011 en el colegio Carlos Pizarro León Gómez y  desde ese momento empezó a mirar que podía hacer para cumplir las metas que era estudiar algo relacionado con salud, ella tenía muchas carreras pensadas  y se decidió en estudiar administración en salud porque le gustaba mucho y además que esta carrera tiene buen campo laboral, entonces se solucionaron  algunos inconvenientes  y  ahora es  aprendiz  del curso de Aux administrativo en salud,  siempre quiere ayudarle a la comunidad  en lo que esté en  disposición. 
Ya que siempre ha sido una persona muy atenta y amable con toda la  ciudadanía, sea  quien sea la persona  y mucho mas si la ayuda la necesita algún miembro de la familia, la familia es quien mas a querido sacarla adelante, se han presentado impedimentos como en cualquier familia, pero ella quisiera colaborar  con lo que más este  en la disposición, pero ella siempre piensa  en algo y a podido ayudar así sea  en lo mas  mínimo, la familia  la a apoyado siempre en lo que ellos mas han podido, pero ella quiere retribuirles la ayuda, sustento y protección que le han dado incondicionalmente. 
para que pueda realizar el sueño le ha tocado esperar un tiempo por algunos  momentos difíciles que por una u otra cosa  han pasado, pero no ha desfallecido nunca ante el sueño, que es  ser una profesional, pero en lo más posible ella quiere poder darse todo y ayudarle mucho a la familia a sí hayan dificultades, pero ella sabe  que poco a poco, con  el empeño y pasión  por lo que hace  puede  lograr ser todo lo que se proponga  hasta llegar al objetivo e ilusión,  por que ella es una joven  muy soñadora que  siempre lucha y no se deja  rendir por lo que quiere.
La situación económica no es muy estable en este momento, por eso ella quiere tener el convenio de kiva para que el valor que ella paga mensual le quede un poco mas barato y pueda terminar de estudiar la carrera que a ella tanto le gusta.
texts.en:
Maria Alejandra graduated from the Carlos Pizarro Leon Gomez High School in 2011 and since then, she has been deciding what she can do to achieve her goal of studying something related to health care.  She had plenty of ideas, but finally decided to study health administration because she liked it a lot and it offers lots of job opportunities.  She overcame a few difficulties and she is now studying on a course to be a health care assistant.  She always wants to be able to help her community.

She has always been a nice person who is friendly and attentive to all people, no matter who they are.  She is especially fond of her family, who have worked hard to raise her; even when it has been hard they have always tried to do their best for her.  She would like to repay them for all they have done.
She has had her dream on hold for a while, due to some difficulties which have arisen, but in all this time, she has never stopped believing in her desire to be a health professional.  This will allow her to help her family through hard times, too.  She knows that the passion she has for what she does will allow to achieve her goals little by little.  She is very ambitious and will not give in.  She is not in a very good financial situation at the moment, so she is asking for a loan from Kiva to help with her monthly payments.  This will help her to finish studying what she loves the most.

loans.use: to pay for a semester on her course.

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani lives in the Kigogo area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She runs a food vending business near her residence. She wants to improve her business by adding some hygienic food supply materials, cleaning materials and food packaging materials (for take-away).

The demand for food has risen, especially during evening where Moslems get ifter. Shani is in need of USD 400 to facilitate her plans.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy varieties of green vegetables for her green grocer

loans.name: Aziz Gul

texts.en: Aziz Gul Is 47 years old and  lives with 6 members of her family in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and is a good business dealer. She took a loan from AFSG and does good business with it and now wants to take a loan to buy more machines and new kits. Aziz Gulhe has good talent in her job and can do lots of work with a new loan to support her family and help her husband.

loans.use: To buy extra machines and expand her tailor shop

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en: Sefer B. is 37 and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has one child. He has raised cattle for eight years, and now he would like to buy two more cows to increase his income, to meet all the needs of his family. To do this, he needs a loan of $825.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Nazkhanim

texts.en: Nazkhanim Mammadov is 55-year-old trader who owns her store where she sells toiletry and makeup products. Nazkhanim is married and has three children. She lives in Imishli region which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. She opened her store in 1996 when she borrowed $800 USD from Aqroinvest CU. She started to sell different sorts of shampoos and soaps. This brought her good income and she returned the money during her paying back period. Nazkhanim retired and her pension is approximately $27-30 USD. Her store is the first income in her family and she is working very hard.  She expanded the products in her store and now she is going to open a food section; for the first time she is going to sell beverages and preserved food. She applied for a loan of $1200 USD.

loans.use: To broaden her store by opening a food section

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 36 year-old mother of three and resides in the Vituka area. She has been in the food production and sales business for the past four years.

She runs a shop selling clothes and household utensils in Vituka market. She also sells fruits and vegetables, but this business is seasonal. She is in need of USD 400 to help her expand the business.

loans.use: To expand food business

loans.name: Itoh

texts.en: Itoh is 28 years old and a mother of a 9-year-old son. She has a small shop that sells snacks and household goods. She could earn $8.50 per day. Her husband is a laborer who earns $2 income per day, so she has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. She requests a $125 loan to expand her business, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill the shop

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Five years ago, in the city of Chinandega, Juan Bermudez began a business in order to help take care of his three children and his aging father. He transports materials from one location to another, utilizing a three wheel bicyle which he purchased with his own savings. This kind of work is really difficult, so Juan starts at sunrise, riding in the streets and finding work, often transporting very heavy loads that he must load and unload himself.

For the last year and a half, Ceprodel has helped Juan with 10 microloans, which he has used to do maintenance on his three wheel bike. Through his business he has gained an honorable life, taking care of his three young children and his father. His great desire is to see his children get a good education, as so far he has not been able to afford that privilege.

Hace cinco años, en la ciudad de Chinandega, para poder mantener a sus 3 hijos y a su anciano padre, el señor Juan B. inicia un negocio de transporte o comúnmente llamado acarreo el cual consiste en el traslado de artículos o materiales de diferentes naturalezas de una lugar a otro. El negocio del señor B. comienza con una inversión de capital propio para comprar su triciclo con el que realizará el traslado.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy fuerte por el hecho de que el señor Bermudez esta expuesto primeramente al sol por andar en las calles y de igual manera realiza trabajos de gran pesos ya que en ocasiones debe de llevar pesos grandes y por ser parte de su trabajo solamente el es el encargado de montar y desmontar los artículos.

Desde hace un año y medio, Ceprodel ha apoyado al señor B. con la realización de 10 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para darle mantenimiento a su triciclo como la reparación de llantas, daños leves, pintura, etc. De esta forma es como el señor B. se gana la vida muy honradamente para mantener a sus tres pequeños y a su padre. Su mayor deseo es que por medio de los postreros créditos que realice sus tres hijos entren a estudiar ya que no ha tenido la oportunidad de brindarles este privilegio porque no ha contado con los recursos económicos para hacerlo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS ON HIS THREE WHEEL BIKE WHICH HE USES IN HIS TRANSPORTATION BUSINESS.  THE BUSINESS ALLOWS HIM TO SUPPORT HIS THREE YOUNG CHILDREN AND ELDERLY FATHER.

loans.name: Abejitas Group

texts.es:
The name of this association comes from the characteristics of the bee. The bee is extremely beneficial to the environment, but its best quality is it that it works without rest. This is why, the members tell us, they identify with the bee for its hard work and perseverence.

This association is made up of 19 hardworking members who work preparing and selling food, some from their own restaurants, some from a small stand, and some from the roadside. The loan will be used to boost their businesses, primarily the food stands, where they make the traditional dishes during carnaval.

El nombre de la Asociación Comunal Las Abejitas tiene su origen en las características de este insecto. La Abeja es un insecto sumamente beneficioso para la naturaleza, pero su mayor cualidad es el trabajo sin descanso. Tal como nos cuentan las socias, ellas se ven muy identificadas con este insecto por esa cualidad, el trabajo y la perseverancia. Esta Asociación esta conformada por 19 socias muy trabajadoras que se dedican principalmente al comercio y en algunos casos la preparación de comida, algunas cuentan con su propio restaurante, y en ocasiones al carecer de un puesto de venta de comida, se dedican a la venta en plena vía pública. Ellas precisan de capital para poder reactivar sus negocios, principalmente aquellos puestos de comida, que se alistan para aquellas entradas folklóricas que se llevan a cabo en la época de carnaval.

loans.use: THE MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION WILL USE THE MONEY TO BOOST THEIR BUSINESSES OF PREPARING AND SELLING FOOD

loans.name: Bweyogerere A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Racheal M.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more beers to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Racheal hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

Racheal is joined in her small group by Getrude N., Madina N., Jennifer K., and Scovia A.. Getrude N. has a beauty salon business and wants to by more hair oils and chemicals. Madina N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. Jennifer K. operates a retail shop business and wants to add to the business. Scovia A. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To boost bar business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is a baker--baking and selling bread. She is married and has five dependents. Demand for her bread has increased but she lacks enough funds to expand.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more raw materials for bread production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for bread production

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru:
Djumagul T. is 34 years old, married and has five children. She has been raising and selling cattle since childhood and currently she also sells kurut (salty yogurt cheese balls), which is very profitable. All Djumagul's children attend the school in her kishlak (mountain village). Since their kishlak is close to the mountains they have problems with potable water. Djumagul's family saves water in large cisterns, but it has to stand for a while before it can be consumed. They also have problems with electricity, and can only have two hours of electricity per day. There is no natural gas in kishlak. But the residents of the kishlak have gotten used to these living conditions a long time ago and do not protest, since everyone is hoping that things will fix themselves soon enough. Djumagul currently has 3 cows and 4 rams and to increase the number of animals in her heard she has turned to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Джумагул Туранова женщина в возросте 34 года замужем имеет 5 детей, она с детства занимается откормом и продажей скота, а также она продает национальный курут , с чего имеет хороший доход.Все ее дети учатся в средней школе кишлака. Их кишлак находится вблизи гор,у них проблемы с питьевой водой.Они воду запасая в бочках сначала перед употреблением ее отстаивают.Также у них проблемы сосветом , в день элэнергия подается 2часа в день.Газ вообще еще не проведен. Но население этого кишлака уже привыкли к таким условиям и не выражают надовольства,т.к. надеются что скоро все пойдет к улучшению. Сейчас она имеет 3 коровы и 4 барана,чтоб увеличить численность скота Джумагул обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Fattening and sale of cattle

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Two months ago, Miriam started a bookstore in her house. It was her son who gave her the idea to start the store, because he saw that in the neighborhood they needed this type of business. However, for two years Miriam has also been selling shoes by the order.

The loans that she has received have been used to travel to Trujillo, eight hours from Lima to buy wholesale shoes. She travels in selling seasons, like school season, July 28th or Christmas. She brings back between three and four dozens of shoes. Her clients are her neighbors or people her sister knows, Miriam's sister helps in the sales. Miriam wants to buy more merchandise to supply her store and expand it as a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 2 meses, Miriam tiene una librería ubicada en su casa. Fue su hijo quien le dio la idea de poner esta tienda, pues vió que en su barrio hacía falta un negocio de este tipo. Sin embargo, Miriam también se dedica a la venta de zapatos por pedido desde hace 2 años.

Los préstamos que ella ha recibido han sido para viajar a Trujillo, a 8 horas de Lima, y comprar zapatos por mayor. Ella viaja en campañas de ventas, como en época escolar, 28 de julio o Navidad. Trae entre 3 y 4 docenas de zapatos. Sus clientes son sus vecinos o los conocidos de su hermana, quien es intermediaria en la venta. Miriam quiere comprar más mercadería para surtir su tienda y ampliarla como un bazar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for store.

loans.name: Aniba

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1983 in the village of Kassou in Bassar Prefecture in the northwest of Togo, Mr. Aniba T. is married and is a water well driller. His business consists of drilling wells and installing water pumps. Usually he works together with other professional teams of engineers to complete projects.

Presently, he has a project that he has to complete with his own money and be repaid only upon completion. With this end in mind, he is requesting this loan to buy 30 bags of cement, rebar, and pipe for water conduit. All the income from this project will come back to him alone, since he is not doing the project with a team.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 31 décembre 1983 dans le village de KASSOU dans la préfecture de Bassar au Nord ouest du Togo, Monsieur T. Aniba est marié et est un foreur. Son activité consiste à faire le forage et à construire des châteaux d’eau. Habituellement, il se joint à d’autres équipes professionnelles de génie civil pour exécuter les chantiers.

Actuellement, il a reçu un chantier qu’il doit exécuter avec son argent et récupérer après la finalisation. A cet effet, il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 30 paquets de ciments, de fer à béton et des tuyaux de canalisation. Le revenu de cette activité lui reviendra seul car il n’exécutera pas ce chantier en équipe.

loans.use:
Purchase of 30 bags of cement, rebar, and pipe for water conduit

Achat de 30 paquets de ciment, de fer à béton et des tuyaux de canalisation

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana B. was born in 1955. She is married and a mother of seven children all of whom are above the age of 15. Due to poverty she was unable to further her education after primary school and was sent to learn to a trade. She never had enough capital to make her business succeed. She and her husband were unable to send their children to school and it was very difficult even to provide food for them.

Susana became a member of GHAPE in 2005. So far, she has borrowed and repaid loans totaling $130. The profit from these loans was used to educate her children, pay for medication, and provide the family with three square meals a day.

Susana is requesting a loan to add buy more materials for her hair business. Her business is going to succeed because she has good business sense, enough capital, enough customers and enough apprentices to keep the business going.

She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy, sell, and plait hair

loans.name: Juan Ranulfo

texts.es:
Juan is married and has 3 children. He started the business in order to pay for family expenses. He started to work in the fields when he was very young since his father, grandfather and his family in general have worked in agriculture. He learned from the family business, and once he married, found it was necessary to start his own business due to the financial commitments that go along with having a family. He has been growing his business since.

He needs a loan of US $500 to invest in his business which he'll pay in 6 months. He will buy grain, fertilizers and such in order to boost his sales. He hopes that with these loans, his business will prosper day to day.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan es casado y tiene 3 hijos. El inició el negocio para poder solventar los gastos familiares. Comenzó a trabajar en el campo desde pequeño puesto que se padre, abuelo y la familia en general se han dedicado a la agricultura y es el negocio familiar que aprendió, y al casarse tuvo la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio derivado de los compromisos económicos que con lleva tener una familia, mismo que ha ido creciendo.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en su negocio comprando granos, fertilizantes y demas e impulsar sus ventas ya que el esperando que con los micro créditos, su negocio siga prosperando día a día.

loans.use: Purchase grains, fertilizers and equipment

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru:
Молодой предприниматель с высшим образованием 5 лет занимается торговлей. Чориев Асрор родился 1980 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Он в оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе торгует женскими платками. В его ассортименте разнообразные  короткие и длинные платки для разного мероприятия из натурального шелка и шифона. Платки с вышивкой, со стразами, камнями, тюлями и платки с необыкновенными узорами.  Закупает он товар у оптовых поставщиков из Турции.  
Асрор хочет получить займ 4000 сомони для увеличения ассортимента и тем самым увеличить свой товарооборот.
texts.en:
Asror C. is a young entrepreneur with university education and has been in the retail business for five years. He was born in 1980, is married and has two children. He sells women's scarves on the wholesale market Korvon in the city of Dushanbe. His stock includes different kinds of short and long scarves for various occasions made from natural silk and chiffon. There are scarves with embroidery, gemstones, rhinestones, tulles and scarves with extraordinary design patterns. He buys the stock from wholesale suppliers from Turkey.

Asror wants to get a loan for 4,000 somoni ($1,175USD) to increase assortment and by that increase the circulation of his inventory stock.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of scarves

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 35 años de edad, estudió superior completo, es casada y madre de un hijo varón de 1 año con 09 meses de edad. Vive en la comunidad de Batalla sector Koñani, Distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chuchito, Puno.

Vilma integra el Banco Comunal “Buenavista” en Chacachaca desde hace 1 año. Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró una vaquilla. Desde los 15 años de edad vendía comida en la ciudad de Lima. A los 20 años vino desde la ciudad de Lima y a los  30 años formó su hogar y comenzó con el engorde de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino, los cuales compran en las ferias de Zepita y Chacachaca y venden en las ferias de Ilave.

Con este crédito de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 1 vaca de S/.1,500 y 02 vaquillas de S/.700 cada uno.

Tiene como meta comprar una casa en la ciudad de Puno para que su hijo estudie en esa ciudad y también para seguir con la crianza de ganado vacuno (vacas).
texts.en:
Vilma is 35 years old, a high school graduate, married, and a mother of a son that is 1 year 9 months old. She lives in the community Batalla, Sector Koñani, District Pomata, Province Chuchito, Puno. Vilma has been a customer at the community bank “Buenavista” en Chacachaca for the past year. With an initial loan of S/.300, she bought a calf. Since she was 15 years old, she has sold food in the city of Lima. At 20 years old, she came from Lima. At 30 years old, she began her home and started raising cattle, sheep, and pigs. She buys them in the Zepita and Chacachaca markets, and then sells them at the town’s Sunday market. With this loan of S/.3,000, to be paid in 3 payments, she will buy 1 cow for S/.1,500 and 2 calves for S/.700 each. Vilma’s goal is to buy a house in Puno so that her children can go to school there and to continue raising livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. is 36 years old and married with a child.  She sells provisions and drinks.  She also sells pepper soup (a soup made of pepper, seasonings, meat or fresh fish and other local spices).  

She is requesting the loan amount of $425 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe U., 70, is married with eight children. She is starting her own business selling chickens to the people in the village three days a week. Pepe is a new member of SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala (~ $15USD). SPBD loans are Pepe’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan of $275 to establish her business.

loans.use: To start her business selling chickens

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty O. is a hard-working woman. She is forty years of age and resides at Bawalashie with her husband and four children, who are all currently in school. She is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, Milo, sugar, soap, toffees, soft drinks, slippers, plates, and drinking glasses. She operates in a store right in front of her house.

Gifty believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter. With a loan, she believes that she can purchase more goods in cartons and in bags and meet her customers’ demands. She hopes to help her children continue their education.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her store.

loans.name: Jessica's Group

texts.en: Jessica M. is the chairperson of the Waina Group in Jinja. She is married with eight children, three of whom are still in school. Jessica has a tailoring business where she makes and mends clothes especially for women and children, not men. The reason for this is that men never believe that a woman can ever make their clothes right. She has been in the business for over ten years and had never received a loan elsewhere until two years ago when she joined Pearl Microfinance. Jessica is grateful that in such a short time, she has been able to buy another sewing machine, making it three, with one used for training young girls how to sew, one for her business, and another which she uses at home. Jessica needs a loan to buy clothing materials and other accessories like threads and needles for her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials and other accessories for her business

loans.name: Kossi Kwami

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier d’adidogomé,il est un entrepeneur dans son quartier, il fait cette activité depuis 2002, il a reçu de ses clients des chantiers de construction de bâtiments qu’il doit executer, n’ayant pas suffisament de moyens, il demande à wages un prêt pour acheter des planches et des tecks. Il est père de trois enfants et sa femme est une revendeuse.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in the Adidogomé district, where he is an entrepreneur. He has been an entrepreneur since 2002. He has received from his customers some building construction sites that he must work on. Lacking sufficient means, he’s asking WAGES for a loan to buy planks and teak wood. He is the father of three children, and his wife is a retailer.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some planks and teak

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es socio del Banco Comunal La Paz, Felix vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Felix es casado, tiene 43 años y 7 hijos, Felix viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra ganado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, los animales los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Felix necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Felix sueña con educar a sus hijos, mejorar su negocio y ahorrar.
texts.en:
Felix is a member of the "La Paz" community bank. Felix lives in the community of Yanama which is 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Felix is married; he is 43 years old and has seven children. Felix travels to the various markets in the area to buy livestock with his children's help. He then sells the animals in the city of Ayacucho. Felix needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy cattle. Felix dreams of educating his children, improving his business and of having savings.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra J. is 43 years old and married with one child. She sells provisions like toothpaste, body cream, sugar, etc. She also sells juice and drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions and juice to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and juice to sell

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
LLERME R. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. LIBERTAD Nº 820, CALLERIA, tiene 40 años de edad.  Se dedica a la estética (salón de belleza).
La señora Llerme tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos son menores de edad.  Ella y su pareja están casados desde hace 19 años.

Ella tiene 8 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar productos de belleza y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, ya generó el primer puesto de trabajo directo, debido a que tiene una joven ayudante laborando en su pequeño negocio, ubicado en su domicilio.

Ese préstamo de S/ 1.200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo de su local y comprará una docena de tintes para cabello, un juego de tijeras, un paquete de Sampoo, etc.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Llerme R. R. belongs to the Damas del Oriente (Ladies of the East) Communal Bank. Her home is located on Libertad Avenue, Callería (Pucallpa). She is 40 years of age and has three children, two of whom are minors. She and her partner have been married for 19 years. She works as a hairdresser in her own beauty salon. She has been working with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for eight years. She used her first loan of 300 New Sols to buy beauty products and so that she could continue developing her small business which is located in her home. At present, her business has generated additional employment since she now has a young assistant working in her little business. With this loan of 1,200 New Sols she will fix up her shop and buy a dozen hair dyes, a set of scissors, a case of shampoo, etc. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because no other bank would give her a loan while Manuela Ramos, without a lot of paperwork, trusted in her and motivated her to be responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, scissors, shampoo.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Sra. Gabriela  tiene 50 años.  Ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas mayores que ya estan casadas y con familia.

La Sra. Gabriela se dedica a la confeccion de almoadones, cortinas, manteles, colchas, toallas, etc., desde hace 18 años en su domicilio particular en la ciudad de Capiata.  Anteriormente, Gabriela tenia una pequeña despensa que tuvo que cerrar por que no podia atender los dos negocios a la ves ya que su mayor pedido era siempre la de confeccion.

El credito será  destinado a la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de los productos citado mas arriba y de esta forma cumplir con la demanda actual.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 50, is a single mother. She has two grown daughters who are married and have their own families. For eighteen years Gabriela has been making pillows, curtains, tablecloths, bedspreads, towels, etc. in her home in the city of Capiata. Previously, Gabriela had a small grocery store. She had to close it because she could not take care of two businesses at once. Her largest orders were always for handicrafts. The loan is to buy raw materials to make the products mentioned above. This way she can keep up with the current demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Germelyn

texts.en:
Germelyn B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 39 years old. Germelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Germelyn owns & operates a food stall. She sells snacks & other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Germelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Germelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Germelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Doña Sandra Maria es soltera, tiene 1 hija cursando el 5to grado de primaria, habita de  la zona Urbana de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 6to crédito a AFODENIC para invertirlo en construccion de los servicios higienicos de su casa y de esta forma tener mejores condiciones de vida de ella y de su hija, esta clienta labora como docente de educacion secundaria en el Instituto Ruben Dario, a pesar que ella no tiene la ayuda de del padre de su hija ha podido darle lo necesario, por que ella ha luchado para que no le falte lo basico en el hogar,  Sandra es una mujer  trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superacion personal y profesional, ademas  a demostrado buena conducta y moral en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is single and has one daughter in 5th grade in elementary school. She lives in the Urbana zone of Nueva Guinea. She is seeking her 6th loan from Afodenic to invest in building a bathroom in her home and in this way have better living conditions for herself and her daughter. She works as a teacher at Instituto Ruben Dario, a secondary school. In spite of not having her daughter’s father’s help, she has been able to give her daughter what she needs, for which she has fought hard so they have their basic needs at home met. Sandra is a hard-working, responsible, woman with great desire to succeed personally and professionally, in addition to demonstrating good and moral conduct in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène G. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est revendeuse de produits génériques à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant de nouveaux produits. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et par gagner plus d’argent pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène G., 52, is married and the mother of 5 children. She sells generic products in Assahoun, a village situated about 50 km from Lomé. She has been in this business for 5 years and is hoping with this loan to expand her little business by buying new products. She is counting on this opportunity to satisfy the demand of her clientele and earn more money to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying generic pharmaceutical products for resale

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo y su esposa son propietarios de siete vacas lecheras, son productores de leche, la cual venden a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos. Vive en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudara para mayor producción de leche.
 
Es tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado por Mateo.
texts.en:
Mateo and his wife own seven dairy cows. They are producers of milk, which they sell to PIL (Industrial Milk Plant). This is their main source of income, with which they cover the maintenance of their four children. They live in the Tipampa Achacachi community, Omasuyos Provience, of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow of medium quality, the same kind that provides for the greater part of their milk production. This is their third loan with Impro. Their good payment history allows Impro to approve another loan requested by Mateo.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase their milk production.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Нишонова Махбуба проживает в районе Регара. Возраст 32 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Махбуба более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Она скупает у народа простые стеклянные банки, а потом продает их заводам и предприятиям подороже. Кредит просит для закупа банок.
texts.en:
Mahbuba N., 32, lives in Regar district. She is married with two children. Her husband is currently working in Russia. Mahbuba has been in business for over three years. She buys glass jars from people in the community and then re-sells them to factories and businesses for a profit. Mahbuba is requesting a loan to purchase more jars.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan C. is 29 years old and lives in Phnom Penh City where he earns a living selling used goods locally. He owns his bicycle which he uses to buy used goods around his community.
