His wife is a local farmer. She also stays at home to look after the housework. This couple was married years ago but have no children. Khan C. will be using his loan to purchase a motorbike which he will use to support his business transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to support his business transportation.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R., 34 years old is a rice gropwer from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She has four children, 14 years old the eldest who are all studying. She started having a farm since 1990. Now, she is managing nearly 1-hectare farm that she hopes could provide her family enough income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay for the rice seeds and laborer who helped prepare the soil. In that way, she expects that she will be able to have more harvest to support her family well.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Armando Q. nasceu em Zavala, Distrito de Inhambane, província de mesmo nome e tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 27, 25, 12 e 10 anos de idade. Fés 8ª classe e não foi possível continuar com os estudos porque foi solicitado a cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório.
Vive na casa de aluguer com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe em Zavala, enviando dinheiro e produtos alimentares.

Saiu de Zavala ainda criança com seus pais para o distrito de Boane, a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Actualmente é dono de seu negócio a mais de 18 anos e conta com 3 trabalhadores. O produto que mais vende é a Cerveja, refrescos e vinhos. Aprendeu esta actividade através de seu falecido pai desde 1981.

Nesta actividade consegue render aproximadamente a 7.000.00mt e sempre poupa algum no Banco Comercial BIM. A esposa também é comerciante, vende roupa usada.

Teve alguns empréstimos com uma sociedade de crédito (SOCREMO), parou de levantar o crédito devido a várias razoes. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição e este é seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mais cervejas, refrescos, vinho e outros. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 8.500.00mt e 13.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o intuito de montar um negócio de avicultura.
texts.en:
Born in Zavala, district of Inhambane in the province of the same name, 46 year-old Armando Q. is married and the father of four children ages 27, 25, 12 and 10. His studies were interrupted in 8th Grade, when he had to fulfill his military service duties. He lives with his family at a rental house in Boane, and also supports his mother, who lives in Zavala, by regularly sending her money and groceries. He moved from Zavala to Boane with his family as a child, when his parents were looking for work and a better life. He has owned a grocery store for 18 years, and currently has three people working for him. His bestselling items are beer, wine and soda. He's learned about the business with his late father. He currently makes 7.000.00 mt per month, and always manages to put some money into a savings account at BIM (Commercial Bank of Mozambique). His wife has her own business of selling used clothes. He has had loans with SOCREMO in the past but stopped being a client a while back, for personal reasons. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend and this is the third time he's applying for a loan. He will use the 20.000.00mt to buy more beverages to sell. His previous loans were in the amount of 8.500.00mt and 13.000.00mt and also used to increase his stock. He expects to pay off his loan without a problem and plans to apply for more credit in the future, to start a poultry business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beer, wine and soda to sell at his store

loans.name: John Macharia

texts.en:
John is a 25-year-old single man who sells women's clothing in the Kangemi market. He has been in the business for four years with a profit of approximately 25,000 Kenyan shillings a month. He wants to use the loan to buy more stock of clothes.

John has never borrowed a loan from any financial institution before. He was introduced to KADET by one of the borrower group members. John hopes to expand his business by adding more stock and also venturing into selling new clothes (instead of second-hand clothing).


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more stock of used-clothing to his business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia A. is from the village of Bolinsong Bonifacio. She is 42 years old. Florencia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Florencia owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, sugar, candies, salt, eggs, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Florencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Florencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Toma Yvonne

texts.fr: G. Toma Yvonne est née le 16 Octobre 1975 à Aguégué dans le département de l’Ouémé au Bénin. C’est à Sagbokossou à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, que Toma Yvonne vit. Toma Yvonne vit dans ce quartier depuis une vingtaine d’année. Toma Yvonne est une veuve qui est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Toma Yvonne vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Toma Yvonne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs 15 ans que Toma Yvonne  vend des poissons frits accompagnés de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) de façon ambulante et à l’école Sagbokossou. Toma Yvonne s’approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Toma Yvonne  a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans l’optique d’étendre son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Toma Yvonne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Toma Yvonne G. was born on October 16, 1975 in Aguégué in Benin's Ouémé department. For the last twenty years she has lived in the Sagbokossou neighborhood in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Toma Yvonne is a widow and mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives on her own, with her children, and she manages all the family expenses alone. Toma Yvonne did not attend school herself. For about the last 15 years she has sold fried fish and "akassa" (a local food made from corn starch) both door-to-door and at Sagbokossou school. She stocks up at Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Toma Yvonne has already had two loans from Kiva Field Partner, ALIDé, and she repaid them without difficulty. With a view to extending her business and better satisfying her clientele, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale fish

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia, 27, is married and mother three children who are in school. She works hard to take care of her household.  Patricia enjoys selling goods like cosmetics.  It has been her major source of livelihood for the past seven years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. Patricia does not have a shop at the moment so she sells on top of a table and by hawking. She sells hair and body products like perfume, hair cream, pomade etc., as well.  Patricia wants to use the Christmas opportunity to make business progress. She will purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory and income, with a loan.

loans.use: Buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny de 28 años es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 4 hijos Carol de 12, Yenifer de 8, Jefer de 4 y Yoselin de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. De esta manera se dedica con cariño y dedicación a la crianza de ganado vacuno, en donde empieza su día a partir de las 5 de la mañana sacando a pastear sus reses por los campos, para así mantenerlos bien alimentados y vigorosos, ya que ello depende para su comercialización.  Es así que Marleny llevó a sus reses a la feria dominical de su ciudad, logrando venderlos rápidamente y a un buen precio. Para Marleny lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es caminar por lo extensos campos, lugar que diariamente pastea a su ganado, por lo que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad, siendo lo más dificultoso, llevar sus reses a la feria para venderlos. Con el tiempo espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y promete pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, siendo Marleny una persona muy responsable y ordenada, no desea perjudicar a nadie de sus compañeras con quienes forman su grupo comunal. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más forraje para sus animales y asegurar así su buena crianza.
texts.en:
Marleny, age 28, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her 4 children: Carol, 12, Yenifer, 8, Jefer, 4, and Yoselin, 3. They are the motivation behind all of her efforts. With this in mind, she raises cattle with care and dedication. Her day begins at 5 in the morning when she takes her cows out to pasture in the fields in order to keep them well-fed and strong, which is what her business depends on. Marleny takes her cattle to her city's Sunday market, where she is able to sell them quickly and at a good price. What Marleny likes the best about her job is walking among the vast fields, where she takes her cows to graze daily. She has been doing this work for 5 years. The most difficult part is getting the cows to the market to sell. She hopes that in time she will be able to increase the number of cows she has and thereby increase her income. This is her second loan through MFP, and she pledges to make her repayments on time. As Marleny is a very responsible and orderly person, she does not want anyone who is a part of her community bank to be penalized. With the 1,200 nuevos soles she is requesting, she plans to buy more fodder for her animals to ensure their good upbringing.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Mame Ware

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Ware D. est une parente bénéficiaire membre de l’U-Imcec dans la  localité de  Camberene. Elle est âgée de 29ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est coiffeuse mais elle pratique aussi la vente de petit déjeuner depuis plusieurs années. Pour elle c’est  la rentabilité qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité. Les moments  de décompte de ses recettes lui procurent  un très grand plaisir. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son commerce de petit déjeuner en achetant les produits de base à des prix plus compétitifs et  qui pourront être stockes. En même temps madame D. désire diversifier ses produits vendus en y impliquant les mèches et les produits pour cheveux. Les revenus générés par son activité lui permettent de supporter certains de ses besoins personnels.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Mame Ware D. is a member and a beneficiary of U-IMCEC (Union des Institutions Mutualistes Communautaires d'Epargne et de Crédit - a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) in the Camberene neighborhood. She is 29 years old, married and has one child. She is a hairdresser but she has also been selling breakfasts for several years. Profitability is what interests her most in her business. The moments when she is counting her income give her great pleasure. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs in order to strengthen her breakfast business by buying the basic products at more competitive prices and stockpiling them. At the same time Mrs D. would like to diversify the products she sells to include hairpieces and hair products. The income she generates from her business will allow her to cover certain of her personal needs. In its ongoing vision to participate actively to the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully helping people to carry out lucrative revenue generating activities, which in turn is contributing to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn S. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married. To make a living, Roselyn owns and operates a specialized retail business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling \ products such as shampoo, toothpaste, juice packs, candy and milk in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Roselyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Roselyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio T. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. He is 44 years old. Gregorio is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gregorio owns & operates a business harvesting and selling raw rubber and making and selling native food known as "calamay" (made from coco milk, sugar and ground sticky rice). Sometimes he makes native vinegar from the coco sap and sells it in the local community. Gregorio has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Gregorio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gregorio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gregorio is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Gregorio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Agakhalil

texts.en:
Agakhalil S. is 36 years old and is married with three children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of seasonal fruit and vegetables in the main street of the village in which he lives. He is not alone in this business - his whole family actively helps him with sales.

Agakhalil is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Currently he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to increase his stock. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lidia Azucena

texts.es: Lidia Azucena tiene 34 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues es el único medio de ingreso que tiene. Lidia tiene 4 hijos y todos dependen de ella, por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora todos los días ella va comprar sus productos en el puerto donde los compra mucho más favorable, para ella ofrecerlos mucho más accesibles. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de camarones, pescado y punches que es lo que más demandan sus clientes. Su deseo es seguir trabajando y seguir proporcionando a sus hijos los estudios necesarios.
texts.en:
Lidia Azucena, 34, operates a seafood sales business. She has operated the business for more than 10 years and it is her only source of income. Lidia has 4 children who also depend on her income. It's for them that she works hard, going every day to the port where she can buy supplies of seafood for relatively little so that she, in turn, can offer the best prices to her customers. The loan that she is applying for will be used to buy shrimp, fish and other products that her customers want. Lidia's greatest hope is that she can keep on working and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Cette dame est très dynamique, en 2004 elle a commencé le commerce en détail des ignames, l’igname est une tubercule qui est très consommée dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer une nourriture très appréciée par les togolais appelée « FUFU ». Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Bassar. Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit afin d’acheter une dizaine de tas d’ignames et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
Elle est veuve et a à sa charge ses 2 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses charges et à celles de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is very dynamic; in 2004 she started a retail business selling yams. The yam is a root vegetable that is used extensively in Togo's cuisine in order to prepare a dish much love by the Togolese called "fufu". She supplies herself from the interior of the country, in the city of Bassar. As she would like to re-stock, she is requesting a loan from the organization WAGES, which she will use to purchase about ten piles of yams and in order to transport the merchandise. She is widowed and has 2 children in her care. With the revenue from her from her business she takes care of her needs and those of her children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yams

loans.name: Moinposho

texts.en:
G. Moinposho is 41 years old and has three children. She is an experienced businesswoman and a well-known seamstress in her community, where she has provided tailoring services for more than 15 years. She is pleased to have a well-established clientele, which consists mostly of parents of school-age children, but also adds new clients regularly. Moinposho has been an active and strongly-motivated client of IMON since 2006, and her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. With his in mind, she has applied for a loan of 6,500 Somoni to buy new fabric with which she will sew dresses. Moinposho and her family wish to express their gratitude for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabric with which to make dresses

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 26 years old and has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last 4 years.  He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to hire a tractor which he will use to cultivate his land for planting.

Benson hopes to one day buy his own tractor which will save him money and also generate income as he will be able to hire it out to other farmers in the area.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to help him cultivate his farm

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
María de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín( llamado así por sus montañas y caminos de tierra) de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 18 años, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, vende platos típicos del Ecuador, empezó con el negocio cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y no tenían dinero para mantener su hogar. Ellos gastaron sus ahorros en sillas y mesas para el pequeño restaurante, e invitaron a sus amigos para que prueben la comida en su casa porque no tenian loca.  

Poco a poco fue incrementando las personas y debido a la gran demanda de la comida continuaron con el negocio, ahora trabajan todos los días desde las 07h00am hasta las 00h00pm, su esposo y sus hijos le ayudan a servir mientras que ella hace la comida, con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas y construir mejor su casa para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para el restaurante.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, and lives in El Fortín (‘the Fort’, which is named after its mountains and dirt roads) on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has two children, ages 20 and 18. María has a small restaurant in her home, where she sells typical Ecuadoran dishes. She started her business when her husband lost his job and they did not have money to support the household. They used their savings to purchase tables and chairs for the small restaurant, and invited their friends to try the food at their home, since they did not have a separate location. Little by little they have increased their number of customers, and they have stayed in business because of the great demand for their food. They now work every day from 7:00 AM until midnight. María’s husband and children help serve while she prepares the food. She wants to use this loan to purchase tables and to improve the construction of their home in order to provide better service for their customers. In the future María wants to have her own premises for the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing tables and making improvements to the premises

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Нормаматов Мирзоали проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Мирзоали подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где сажает овощи для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Mirzoali N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Mirzoali does construction work for hire. Besides this, he is also involved in agriculture. He has a small plot of land by his house, where he plants vegetables for subsequent resale. Mirzoali has been involved in this business for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma L. is from the village of Sapang Dalaga. She is 52 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income comes from the use of the motorcycle. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay tuition fees. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For tuition fees

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe N. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Fe is married and has two school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as eggs, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 4,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Fe is now requesting her third loan from GDMPC, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four members who all live in Kok Til village in Kandal province. Mr. Lay S., aged 43, is the leader of this group having been selected by the members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different businesses. 
Mr. Lay S. and his wife, Mrs. Savart Yoeun, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice and sweet potato. In order to support this farm, Mr. Lay S. will use his loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice and sweet potato. In addition to farming, Mr. Lay S. is also a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. The couple has three children, two of whom are students and also traditional musicians, and the other of whom is aged five and not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborers

loans.name: Edilmira

texts.es: Edilmira tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años trabaja en los campos agrícolas, que junto con su esposo cultivan papa y maíz sobre extensiones de terrenos que poseen. Su trabajo es arduo y todos los días se dedica a cuidar sus tierras, y cuando es época de cosecha es donde necesita de manos para realizar  este trabajo, pero sabe además que gracias a ello, puede percibir ganancias regulares. Afirma que le gusta su trabajo porque le permite tener disponible los alimentos necesario para su familia y disfrutar de la vida de campo. Ante esto, desea ampliar su siembra para la próxima temporada. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas de papa de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Edilmira, 30, lives with her husband and three children in her own house. She has been a farmer for the last 11 years. Together with her husband she farms potato and corn on fields they own. Her work is arduous and every day she cares for her crops. During harvest time she needs to hire laborers to help with the work but she knows that it’s thanks to this that she can earn regular profits. She states that she enjoys her work because it provides her family with needed food and she can enjoy life in the countryside. Because of this she’d like to expand her plantings next season. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial help. Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal group because all of its members are responsible and mutually supportive people. She is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the funds to buy sacks of manure and better quality potato seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es: Johana es una mujer muy popular, por lo que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante. Ella es una clientes que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación. Por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos necesarios de su familia, pues ella es una mujer luchadora. Este financiamiento que está solicitando es para comprar ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de laborar con este negocio, pues todo el tiempo se ha sacrificado por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Johana is a very popular woman, and she is always looking for ways to get ahead. She has been a long-time customer of Fundación. She has always concerned herself with improving her family's income because she is a determined woman. This loan she is requesting is for buying new clothing like pants, shirts, skirts and suits. She has been working in this business for a long time, and always she has made sacrifices in order to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yong-Ok

texts.en:
Yong-ok D. is from the village of Mulugan, El Salvador City. She is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells specialty food products like homemade sausage and roasted hot dogs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yong-ok joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Molugan, El Salvador City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann O. is from the town of Sta. Josafe, Agusan Del Sur. She is a farmer. She has entirely spent her life growing vegetables and rice to earn an income for her family. She is married and has one daughter; she hopes that someday she will be able to send her to school.

She would like to apply for a loan of PhP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy seeds and farm materials. She hopes this loan will be able to sustain her business and family.

loans.use: buying seeds and farm materials

loans.name: Augusto

texts.en:
Augusto is 32 years old. He lives in his own home in Diaz Orroego in the region of Oyotun with his wife and children. Oyotun is a rural area in the northern part of Peru, approximately one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. It is located in a fertile valley that is fed by water coming down from the mountains.
For the last ten years, Augusto and his family have run a small general store from their home. They sell basic household items such as soap, brushes, rice, and beverages as well as candy and sweets for the children. In addition to the store, Augusto has a plot of land, which he runs as a farm.
Augusto has taken out loans with our institution in the past. He appreciates having access to credit when the opportunity strikes. He plans to use his current loan to expand his offerings by purchasing additional merchandise at bulk prices. He is thankful for the opportunity to make use of a low cost product offered in partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., 36, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells groceries, earning an income of 14 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 4 USD per day. S. spends 80 USD on food and 50 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 41 años, es una madre de familia muy organizada y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Durante el día Juana, se dedica a la costura y a la atención de su nuevo negocio que es una librería, instalado en el primer ambiente de su casa. Pero el trabajo por el cual sus clientes la conocen es como costurera, ya que ésta labor, es la más antigua que ha ejercido. Por otro lado lo considera como un trabajo muy rentable, sobre todo cuando se trata de elaborar prendas femeninas,  donde acumula buenas utilidades sin el mayor esfuerzo ni la mayor inversión. Es por ello que le gusta coser y brindar un buen servicio, de acuerdo a la solicitud de sus clientes, es así que ya lleva 13 años en esta labor que tanto le apasiona y espera ampliar su librería y diversificar con prendas de vestir, debido a la solicitud de sus clientes. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que anhela contar con posteriores ayudas para el desarrollo de su  negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar hilos, cierres, para el trabajo de costura, asimismo desea comprar cuadernos, láminas, escarchas y otros accesorios  para  librerías, e incluso prendas de vestir, para diversificar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana, age 41, is an organized and hardworking mother who lives in her own home with her husband and two children. During the day, she works as a seamstress and also manages a new business – a bookstore that she set up in the main room of her house. Her customers know her mainly for her sewing since she has done that work the longest. Juana considers this work to be very profitable, especially when it comes to making women’s clothing. She has generated good earnings without having to make any great efforts or large investments. It is for this reason she enjoys sewing and providing good service according to what her customers order. Juana has been in business for 13 years and is passionate about her work. She hopes to expand her bookstore and diversify the clothing she offers based on her customers’ requests.

This is her second loan with MFP. Juana promises to be prompt with her payments so that she can receive further support in developing her business. The loan she requested will be used to buy thread and zippers for sewing. She will also buy notebooks, laminate sheets, glitter, and other bookstore accessories in addition to clothing to diversity her business.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies & merchandise to stock her bookstore

loans.name: Berta Marina

texts.es:
La señora Berta Marina V. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Oscar Armando Guandique quien se dedica al trabajo de construccion, tienen tres hijos.

Berta y su familia vive en la colonia Morazan de la cuidad de San Lorenzo desde hace 25 años, en donde tiene su propia casa. doña Berta quien se a dedicado durante 20 años a la elaboracion de vestidos, blusas, pantalones de vestir para mujer, trajes para quinceañera, trajes de boda ademas los fines de semana hace sopas de mondongo y tamales para vender tratando de esta manera obtener mas ganancias en su negocio.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de telas y accesorios que se necesitan para la elaboracion de las
prendas de vestir, ademas necesita comprar unos repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su maquina de costurar.

unos de sus sueños es que su familia este bien siempre, Berta es una mujer muy catolica.
texts.en:
Berta Marina V. is 52 years old.  She is married to Oscar Armando Guandique who is a construction worker.  They have three children.

Berta and her family have lived in the Morazan district of the city of San Lorenzo for 25 years.  They live in their own home.  For 20 years, Berta has been making dresses, blouses, women's dress pants, outfits for 15th birthday celebrations and wedding outfits.  On weekends she also makes tripe soup and tamales to sell in order to make additional income.

Berta will use her loan to buy fabric and accessories which she needs to make her garments.  She also needs to buy some spare parts for her sewing machine.

One of Bertha's dreams is for her family to always be well.  Bertha is a very Catholic woman.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads, lace and spare parts for her sewing machine

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a thirty year-old married female with four children and owns a house in Kasese. She has been selling clothes and shoes for the last five years. She started the business with five hundred shillings of capital and has expanded to capital of three million shillings. However, she still does not have enough capital to meet customer demands. Her vision is to open up another shop. Margret needs the loan to buy additional clothes for sale.

loans.use: Buy new clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio P. is from the village of San Andres. He is 50 years old. Anastacio is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Anastacio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anastacio has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anastacio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Anastacio is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Anastacio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosebilita

texts.en:
Rosebilita E. is from the city of Kinuman Norte Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Rosebilita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosebilita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Rosebilita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosebilita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosebilita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Rosebilita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosebilita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Imee Love

texts.en:
21-year-old Imee Love is from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. At a young age, Imee Love is already married and has a one-year-old child. Imee is engaged in farming. She and her husband till their land together to plant and harvest rice crops. They also have some vegetables planted in their backyard. Imee works hard for her child's future.

Imee is in need of additional capital for the farm. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help her maintain their rice farm.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nolkisaruni Enole

texts.en:
Nolkisaruni Enole T., a 40-year-old married mother of 10 children, has been farming on her own piece of land for the last four years. She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan with which she is planning to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house.

Nolkisaruni, a conscientious lady determined to achieve her objectives, dreams of being a prominent wheat farmer and ensuring a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A. is a 41 year old man from the town of Surallah.  He is married and has five children between the ages of 18 and 3.  Joel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of his income comes from planting and harvesting rice, fruit, and vegetables for sale.  Joel works hard to sustain his children's education because he wants all of them to finish college.

Joel joined Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), to access financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  He is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP that will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Rosalia; la socia tiene 57 años de edad, viuda y tiene 6 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de pesacado, machas, camarones entre otros, la socia viaja hasta el distrito de Mollendo provincia de Arequipa para comprar mercadería y venderlo a los mercados donde se encuentran sus clientes, la socia viaja hasta allá no solo por comprar su mercadería sino también porque sus hijos están viviendo en Mollendo y de esta manera ella puede visitarlos tambien,la socia se queda como 15 días en Mollendo y luego retorna a Cusco para vender su mercaderia, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Rosalía, 57, is a widow; she has six children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling fish, clams and shrimp, among others.  

She travels all the way to Mollendo district in Arequipa province to buy her merchandise to then sell it in the markets where her customers are found.  She travels all that way not just to buy her merchandise but also because her children live in Mollendo and this way she can visit them also.  She stays in Mollendo about two weeks and then returns to Cusco to sell her merchandise.  

She is quite a cheerful person with a strong drive to get ahead.  She is asking for the loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She is happy with the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: To buy more seafood.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Mariama.  She is married, and has 4 children. In 2005, Mariama established her food business. She began her business because she wanted to join hands with her husband in providing livelihood for their family. She opens her business 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mariama requires a loan in order to buy more food.. In the future, Mariama plans to go to the province to purchase large qualities of palm oil.   She also hopes to see her children get their education.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Señor De La Caña - Chupuro Group

texts.es:
Raymunda participa como socia de la alcancia comunal: Señor de la Caña - Chupuro.
Raymunda vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica desde hace 13 años al bordado manual de trajes tìpicos de la zona.
En el futuro Raymunda desea tener un taller de costura.
El prèstamo requerido lo invertirà en la compra de una màquina de coser para poder ayudarse con los bordados.
(En la fotografìa Raymunda esta vestida con chompa color verde y un manto color marròn; es la tercera de la derecha y esta acompañada de uno de sus menores hijos)
(*) Hayde Conde socia retirada, participò en la fotografìa y en la reuniòn de desembolso para la juramentaciòn de cargo; ya que fue presidenta en el ciclo anterior.(Hayde esta vestida de color color verde claro y lleva puesto un sombrero negro, es la cuarta de la derecha)
texts.en:
Raymunda participates as a member in the community bank called Señor de la Caña [Lord of the Reeds] - Chupuro. Raymunda lives with her husband and 2 minor children. She has done hand embroidery of traditional dress in the area for 13 years.  

In the future, Raymunda wants to have a sewing workshop. The loan she needs will be invested in a sewing machine to help her with the embroidery.  (In the photograph Raymunda is wearing a green sweater and a purple shawl. She is the third from the right and is accompanied by one of her young children). 

(*) Hayde Conde, a retired member, participated in the photograph and in the disbursement meeting for the oath of office, since she was the president in the previous cycle (Hayde is dressed in green and has on a black hat. She is the fourth from the right).

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 38 years old and married with three children. He sells second-hand clothes to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 11 years.  He runs the business with one employee.  

Besides this business, he does farming for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and hence, his living standards. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale one in the future.  

He has requested 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Bazirengedde Development Group

texts.en: 39-year-old Teddy K.'s philosophy is that hard work pays. Her relentless diligence has indeed played very much in her favour as she goes about her 8-year-old business, which is charcoal  sales. She operates her business from Kigombya-Mukono. This happily married mother of 4 says she was influenced by her husband to have a hand in this business. Prior to that, Teddy says she was selling mostly tomatoes. Weekly, she says her profits are 90,000 Ugandan shillings.  She says with this loan she is going to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Maritchu

texts.en: Maritchu is from the village of Tongan-Tongan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maritchu owns and operates a business buying and selling ukay-ukay or used clothing, comforters and bedsheets in the local community. Maritchu has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Maritchu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maritchu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Maritchu is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of used clothing like t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Maritchu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of used clothing like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Rice planting is the most popular business for people who live in the countryside. Mrs. Hoa is among those who earn an income from farming. She always uses her own fertile farm to grow many kinds of crops, according to the season. Her husband works alongside her in the field. They also depend on their two children; one is a businesswoman and one is employed as a factory worker in Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Hoa would like to ask for a loan of $800 to buy some bean oil to stock for future sale.

loans.use: to buy some bean oil to stock for future sale.

loans.name: Glenda Maria

texts.es:
Glenda, vive con su madre y dos hijos, es comerciante D. especias, platos, velas, carteras y golosinas, este negocio tiene más D. 20 años D. existir, ya que sus padres dieron inicio hace mucho tiempo, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal donD. ofrece esta mercadería.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra más especias, platos y boquitas, variando así el negocio y ofreciendo mayor cantidad a los clientes, para generar más ventas.
El objetivo D. ella es tener surtido el negocio, realizar buenas inversiones que le ayuden a crecer más competente, y proveer para sus hijos todo lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Glenda lives with her mother and two children. She sells spices, plates, candles, wallets and snacks. This business has been around for more than 20 years; her parents started it many years ago. She has a stall in the municipal market where she offers this merchandise.

Currently she asks for a loan to buy more spices, plates and snacks, to add variety to her business and offer greater quantity to her clients so generate more sales.

Her goal is to stock her business, make good investments that help her to become more competent and to give her kids everything they need for development.

loans.use: to buy more spices, plates and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds (beans, sorghum, peanuts) for reselling

loans.name: Hafcatou

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Hafcatou est revendeuse de tissus depuis 2003. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et vend à toutes personnes. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra  d’acheter 02 rouleaux de tissus chemise et 01 bal de tissu pantalon. Son conjoint est commerçant.
texts.en:
Hafcatou is a mother to one child, and her spouse is a merchant. She has been selling fabrics since 2003. She buys her merchandise at the Grand Market of Lomé and sells to all types of customers. 

The loan she is seeking will help her to buy two bolts of shirt fabric and one bale of pant fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for shirts and pants

loans.name: Emelide Maria

texts.es: Emelide  vende almuerzos especialmente sopas y comidas corrientes básicas  muy bien preparadas, a sus principales clientes que son los vecinos y peatones que diariamente circulan por su negocio ubicado en su propia casa. Las costumbres han cambiado y muchas personas no cocinan en su hogar,  sino que compran los deliciosos sancochos que prepara Emelide, los cuales  en pequeñas porciones,  pasan a ser los almuerzos de muchas familias, por lo económicos que son  y esto es un buen negocio de “yo gano tus ganas” para Emelide y su clientela. Emelide vende de contado diariamente y compra también diariamente para la venta del día a día. Con su negocio ha logrado ingresos importantes para apoyar la gestión de su hogar conformado con su cónyuge y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 30 y 37 años. Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará insumos al por mayor, para la preparación de sus alimentos y utensilios de cocina, con los cuales ofrecerá un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorará el sistema de compras, accediendo a mejores precios por volúmenes; con sus créditos anteriores, se incrementó  ligeramente su capital de trabajo y aumentaron sus ingresos. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda en condiciones favorables para vivir más cómodamente. Mientras Emelide trabaja para conseguir su sueño  genera en su negocio una utilidad no menor del 20% que planea aumentar, en la medida en que su clientela continúe creciendo.
texts.en: Emelide sells lunches, specifically soups and basic fast food that is very well prepared.  Her main customers are her neighbors and the workers who daily go by her business, which is located in her own house.  Customs have changed and many people no longer cook in their home, but rather they buy small portions of the delicious stews that Emelide prepares.  This is the source of lunch for many families because it is economical, and so this business is a "win-win" situation for Emelide and her customers.  Emelide sells daily on a cash basis, and she also buys her ingredients each day for her daily sales.  With her business she has managed to generate an important income to help support her household, which is comprised of her husband and their two children aged 30 and 37.  Her Kiva loan is the 3rd loan that she has taken from the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use the loan to buy supplies at wholesale to make her food, and to buy cooking utensils.  This way she will offer better service to her customers and will improve her system of purchasing, as she will get better prices by buying in bulk.  With her previous loans, she increased her working capital a bit and increased her income.  Her goal for the future is to fix up her home to provide more comfortable living conditions.  While Emelide works to achieve her dream, her business generates profit no less than 20%, which she plans to increase as her customer base continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale to make her meals, and to buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Damaris Carolina

texts.es: Damaris Carolina tiene 28 años, su actividad es una miscelánea. En donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar lo que ofrece. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, Damaris tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo ella tiene la responsabilidad de proporcionarle alimentos, vestimenta y estudios. Ella se levanta temprano para empezar su labor todos los días. El crédito es para la compra de sandalias, zapatos deportivos,  zapatillas entre otros.
texts.en:
Damaris Carolina is 28 years old.  She has a miscellany shop where she stocks a wide variety of products.  Most of her customers come by to buy what she has in stock.  She’s had this way of earning a livelihood for the last 12 years.

Damaris has two minor children in her care; it’s her responsibility to provide them with food, clothing and schooling.  She rises early to start working every day.  The loan is to buy sandals, sports shoes and slippers, among others.

loans.use: to buy sandals, sports shoes and slippers, among others.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 28-year-old mother of three children who lives in al Salt where she has a big space of land around her house. A year ago, Elham bought a few goats to raise and started making cheese and yogurt from the goats’ milk. Because she is careful of the hygiene and the expiration date, people trusted her product.

Now Elham wants to improve and increase her productivity by buying more goats and more equipment for making cheese and yogurt. In the future, Elham would love to have a few horses on her farm.

loans.use: to buy more goats and more equipment for making cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Abduahad

texts.ru:
С ранних лет Абдуахад интересовался  выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и скотоводством. Он всегда мечтал иметь свою собственную землю и много скотов, чтобы создать свою ферму. Он выращивает картошку, пшеницу и ячмень для корма своих скотов. Более 7 лет он занимается этим и старается расширить его. Он женат и любящий отец 5 детей.  Прибыль, который он получает от данного бизнеса, он тратят для нужды своей семьи и расширения бизнеса. Абдуахад хотел бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота, минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы. Он заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и милосердие. Спасибо вам!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Since very early years Abduahad was interested in growing agriculture produce and animal husbandry. He always dreamed to have his own land and a lot of cattle to create his own farm. For more than seven years he has been in this business and tries to expand it. He is married and is a loving father of five children. The income which he receives from the business is spent on the needs of his family and expansion of the business. Abduahad wants to receive a loan in the amount of $3000USD to buy cattle, mineral fertilizer and fuel and lubricants. He thanks all of you in advance for your help and charity.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La Señora Rafaela tiene 63 años, ella tiene un comedor donD. venD. todo tipo D. comidas, hechas a base D. pescado.
El trabajo que realiza es muy sacrificado ya que desD. muy tempranas horas del día ella inicia su jornada laboral para poder preparar sus pescado al costado del rió. Comenta que su local tiene mucha clientela ya que ella se destaca por la amabilidad con que atienD. a sus clientes. Uno D. sus sueños es que sus hijos sigan una carrera universitaria para poder ser profesionales y para que no pasen  por las mismas necesidades por las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita el credito para la compra D. pescado y agradece a la Fundación por darle la oportunidad D. acceder a un crédito.
texts.en: Rafaela is 63 years old. She owns a diner specializing in dishes prepared using local fish. Her work is difficult since it requires her to begin preparing her dishes very early. Rafaela has a good customer base thanks to her good customer service. One of her dreams is for her children to attend college and pursue a professional career instead of having to struggle to make a living. She is requesting a loan to buy fish for her business. Rafaela is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for providing her with the opportunity to access business loans.

loans.use: comprar pescado para la posterior venta.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La Señora María es madre soltera ,tiene 1 hija de 11 años y esta en la escuela, la Señora María ha demostrado a lo largo de los años que ha podido salir adelante pese a los desafíos de no tener a un esposo y padre de su hija, tiene el negocio de la venta de pollos, ella comenzó vendiendo a tres amigas, después con un poco de esfuerzo empezó a vender más y hasta el día de hoy cuenta con más de 30 clientes a quienes deja los pollos frescos listos para ser cocinados y vendidos, La señora María desea el préstamo kiva para invertirlos para su negocio , para hacerlo crecer más; comprando más pollos y tener más clientes. La Señora María tiene el sueño familiar de darle a su hija una educación de calidad para que en el futuro su hija sea una excelente profesional, también desea para su negocio en un futuro tener un puesto propio en el mercado de mayor concurrencia de personas en donde venda más y hacer crecer sus ventas par que su calidad de vida sea mucho mejor. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother who has one daughter.  Her daughter is 11 years old and goes to school.  Maria has shown over the years that she has been able to get ahead in spite of the challenges of not having a husband or father for her daughter.  She has a business selling chickens.  She started selling to 3 friends, and later, with a bit of effort, started to sell more.  Currently she has more than 30 customers, to whom she delivers fresh chickens that are ready to be cooked and sold.  Maria wants to invest this Kiva loan in her business to make it grow by purchasing more chickens and having more customers.  Maria dreams of providing her daughter with a quality education so that in the future she can become an accomplished professional.  She also wants in the future for her business to have its own stall in the busiest market where she could sell more.  This way she could increase her sales so that her quality of life would be much better.  She is very grateful for the loan that is being granted.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of chickens to sell

loans.name: Baluki Plus Group

texts.en:
Didier, aged 40, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Baluki Plus”. It is composed of 12 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Didier has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2006. He runs a restaurant and a telephone booth. His businesses are located in the eastern part of Kinshasa. Didier is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having obtained and correctly repaid four previous loans. With this loan, he is planning to increase the inventory of his business by buying some phones and reselling them with the aim of generating additional profits. His businesses generate a profit of $15 per day. Didier’s ambition is to diversify his bisinesses by opening a cement facility to keep sacks of cement for reselling. He is married and the father of twins who are 4 years old.

loans.use: to reinforce the inventory of his business by buying phones and reselling them with the aim of generating additional profits.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 52 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She has a billiards business in Loon, Bohol. Lucia also sells coffee to the people in her community. She requested this loan to buy billiards materials and more coffee to sell. Lucia dreams for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy billiards supplies and coffee

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a hardworking businesswoman aged 53. She is single and blessed with two children. She has been running a cafeteria business to support her family. She has employed three people to help her to manage the business. Her potential customers are passersby and the local residents. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more chairs and sodas for her business. In the next 5 years, she wants to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy chairs and sodas.

loans.name: Noelia Rosario

texts.es: La solicitante tiene 20 años de edad por referencias es una persona muy sacrificada por sus padres ya que su madre tiene una enfermedad que le perjudica tener un trabajo y poder ayudar con los gastos familiares; ella  está cursando la universidad y trabaja como operadora de taxis, además de tener una fotocopiadora que se encuentra en des-uso por falta de capital para que pueda viabilizar el servicio de fotocopiado, razón por la cual asistió  para poder solicitar  un crédito que le pueda ayudar y asi pueda generar mayors ingresos.
texts.en:
This applicant is 20 years old. Her references indicate that she is a person who has made many sacrifices for her parents. Her mother has an illness that prevents her from working, so she must help with the family expenses.

The applicant is attending the university and also works as a taxi driver. In addition, she has a photocopier that is in disrepair because she lacks the capital to make it viable for providing copying services. For this reason, she seeks assistance by requesting a loan that will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to pay for photocopier repairs.

loans.name: Savem

texts.en:
Savem, 36, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Savem is a farmer and her husband is a construction worker.

Savem is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a rice threshing machine to improve her family's farming. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a rice threshing machine to improve her family's farming

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba, 55, is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past ten years she has operated a mango-selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”LOS ANGELES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia es cosmetóloga de profesión y ella trabaja en un centro muy conocido y a unas cuadras del centro de la ciudad de Cusco; La socia desea en esta ocasión invertir su crédito en la compra de peines, secadora de cabello y otros pequeños accesorios para uso en el salón de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una secadora, peines, y otros pequeños accesorios para el salón de belleza.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the LOS ANGELES communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, Cusco Province, department of Cusco.

The member is 37 years old and has a common law husband. She has 2 children. The member is a beautician by profession, and she works in a very well known shopping center a few blocks from the center of the city of Cusco. On this occasion, she wants to invest her loan in the purchase of combs, a hair dryer, and other small accessories for her beauty salon. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer, combs, and other small accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lorilyn

texts.en:
Lorilyn is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Lorilyn has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lorilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sonazeguekpon Group

texts.fr: SONAZEGUEKPON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 44 ans. Julienne est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Cyriaque. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Julienne  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Julienne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Julienne vend du maïs et de l'igname de façon ambulante depuis treize ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Julienne s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Julienne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SONAZEGUEKPON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et de l'igname.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is 26 years old and lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region. She is single.
She needs a loan of $1000 to buy a 0,3 hectare clover plot of land.Bahar has 8 years of experience in this business. 
This business has enabled her to cover most of her household expences.

loans.use: To buy 0,3 hectare clover plot of land

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is the single mother of a two-year old who lives in Tacagua, on the west side of La Paz. She works at a copy shop downtown. Her home has no wall around it and is left exposed to thieves while she is away. This loan is to pay for building a wall. This is the second time Emma has turned to IMPRO for credit and she has been a good client.
