Her employment and credit history with us show that she can improve her income and repay this loan, and they allow her to apply for this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Alexis Hult

Emma C. vive sola, con su hijo de dos años en una vivienda ubicada en la zona de Tacagua, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada en una oficina de fotocopias en el centro de la ciudad. La vivienda que ocupa, no tiene amurallado, por lo que se expone a que puedan robar sus pertenencias en su ausencia, el crédito solicitado es para la construcción de muro perimetral. Esta es la segunda vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución los clasifica como buen cliente. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios en nuestra institución le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a small food stand where she sells all types of typical Ecuadorian dishes. Her daughter helped her start this business 2 years ago by buying Maria the small barbecue in the picture. Maria started off by selling just empanadas and shish kabobs, two of Ecuador’s more popular foods. She now has a large of variety of foods and dishes that she makes. She used her last loan to invest in the ingredients she needed to make her dishes.

With the profits from her loan she was able to expand her business. She wants to make reparations to her home in order to be able to offer seating for her clients. The first step is to add pavement to her home and make a section for her customers. She continues to save towards this goal. She has started selling various items for the home as a side business while her restaurant continues to grow. She hopes to invest in this business with a portion of her new loan, but will primarily focus on buying more ingredients.

Maria is 40 years old and has 4 children who are already grown up. One of her daughters still lives with her and helps her in the business. Her husband also contributes to the business when he is not working.

loans.use: Buy food for her stand

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi is one of the young ladies that join SPBD last year. Her business is making handicrafts such as earrings for the ladies, bracelets, hair accessories and picture frames already designed with different styles. Foketi sells her products at the flea market at Fugalei, which is preferable because more income can be earned here than anywhere else. She started last year with a loan of $750 and now she is on her second loan of $1250. She sells her products throughout the week opening seven days from six o’clock in the morning to five o’clock in the evening earning $800 a day. After deducting all her expenses, she earns about four hundred to five hundred profit a day and about two thousand to two thousand and eighty tala a week. She is looking forward to supply more in the following week of the South Pacific Games.

loans.use: “Buy frames, paints, materials, x-saw and kofi for the carving”

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O. is 37 years old, married with 3 children. She sells engine oil and kerosene. This business is a source of income for her family. Bose lives in Benin City. She is a LAPO member. She has been in this business since 2001. Bose hopes to receive a loan in the amount of US$ 475 so that she can buy more engine oil and kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more oil and kerosene for re-sale

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Señora Charito from the Banco Comunual Shatojinas Laboriosas owns her own home-based business, located on the highway toward San Martín de Alao in the Shatoja district of El Dorado, San Martín. She sells groceries and clothing for men, women and children, and has been doing so for 12 years. With the loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 2,500.00 ($ 838.00), which will be paid off with six payments, she will buy different kinds and brands of noodles (08 packages), canned fish (04 boxes), bagged rice and sugar (02 bags of each product), liters of oil, eggs in crates, bread for daily sale and clothes for men, women and children. She is 38 years old, a mother of 2, and she hopes to continue expanding her business so that she can become more independent and thus provide jobs for other women. She is very pleased with what she has achieved since she is no longer financially dependent on her husband and can now make decisions.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Charito del Banco Comunal Shatojinas Laboriosas, tiene ubicado su negocio en un local propio en su misma casa, por la carretera a San Martín de Alao, distrito de Shatoja, provincia El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, viene desarrollando la actividad hace 12 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 838.00), el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos de distintas variedades y marcas (08 paquetes), conservas de pescado (04 cajas), arroz y azúcar en sacos (02 sacos de cada producto), aceite en litro, huevos en jabas, pan para venta diaria y ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella tiene 38 años de edad, 02 hijos y espera seguir creciendo en su negocio para así seguir siendo más independiente y de esta manera poder dar trabajo a otras mujeres. Se siente muy contenta de lo que ha logrado ya que hoy no depende económicamente de su esposo y puede tomar decisiones.

loans.use:
Purchase of various products (groceries).

Compra de productos variados (abarrotes).

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.en:
Mrs Mirtha R., 41 years old, lives with her partner and has a 20 year old son, who also lives in her house. Her partner works in Posadas, a city in Argentina located on the border with Paraguay and a few minutes away from Encarnación.

Mirtha owns a salon and a bookstore. Her son is mainly in charge of the bookstore and Mirtha manages the salon. They are a very united family; they all support each other in order to pay the household bills and the child’s college tuition.

The loan this customer is requesting will be used in order to buy products for her salon, such as nail polishing, hair color, shampoo, lotion, hair conditioner and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirtha R. de 41 años vive en pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 20 años de edad quien vive con ella en una casa de su propiedad. Su pareja trabaja en Posadas una ciudad de Argentina que limita con Paraguay y que queda a minutos de Encarnación.

Mirtha posee una peluquería y una librería. La librería es atendida principalmente por su hijo, y Mirtha se encarga de la peluquería. Es una familia muy unidad, donde todos se ayudan para así poder salir adelante, pagar los gastos de la casa y los estudios universitarios del joven.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mercaderías en insumos de su peluquería como ser: esmaltes para uñas, tinturas para cabellos, shampoo, cremas, acondicionadores de pelo, y accesorios varios.

loans.use: Purchase of salon supplies such as nail polish, hair color, shampoo, lotions, conditioners and other items.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
"I´ve been selling tacos from this stand next to my house for a year and a half now. Sales are good, but I think that if I invest a bit more in my business I will sell more tacos and make more money. My husband has a small mechanics´ workshop and thanks to both our businesses we are able to provide for our family.

I am requesting $300 US to invest in my taco stand.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase food to sell

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna V.,28, lives in Teok Nem village in Kandal province. She is a farmer and grows crops to support her family. She is a widow with three children who have yet to attend school. She is asking for a loan which will allow her to buy fertilizer, plow her rice field and dig a well to support her rice field.

loans.use: To dig a well, buy fertilizer, and plow her rice field.

loans.name: Elyambiz

texts.en:
Elyambiz is 38 years old, married and has two children aged 11 and 6. He owns a cosmetics shop, which he opened in 1997. He works at this shop from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily and makes about $155 a month in profit from his sales.

Elyambiz has applied for a loan to buy more cosmetics for his business. He is a member of the loan group Upendo (Swahili for "love"), which is made up of 47 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell in a small shop.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama N. is 59 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the village bank Alwar CMT in Ziguinchor for 6 years. Her commercial activity consists of buying and selling palm oil, honey, brushes, lemons and dried fish. With the profits she will make, she will help with household finances. Mama would like to bolster her economic activity with this loan which will be repaid at the end of a period of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mama N., 59 ans, mariée, mère de 06 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Alwar CMT à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans. Elle mène une activité de commerce qui consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme, du miel, des balaies, du citron et des poissons secs . Avec ses revenus elle contribue à l’entretien de la famille. Mama veut renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase honey, lemons, brushes and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora has dedicated herself to agricultural work for a long time, and with her continued work, she has been able to contribute to her home and to the fulfillment of each one of her beloved son's dreams. She has in mind to improve the quality and quantity of her production, and this is the reason she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Flora, se dedica desde hace mucho a la labor agrícola y con su continuo desempeño ha podido contribuir con su hogar y con el cumplimiento de cada uno de los sueños de su amado hijo. Tiene en mente mejorar la calidad y cantidad de su producción y a esa razón atiende la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kayi A. was born on June 6, 1962 in Tsévié. She is married to Mr. Maye Dara and she has 6 children. Her business since 2006 is selling various foodstuffs and cosmetics. To satisfy an ever-growing clientele, she is presently requesting her first loan to purchase 20 sacks of rice, 30 bottles of wine, and 46 bottles of liqueurs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Kayi est née le 06 juin 1962 à Tsévié. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur DARA Maye et elle a 06 enfants. Comme activité elle vend de divers produits d’alimentation et de produits cosmétiques depuis 2006. Pour satisfaire une clientèle grandissante, elle sollicite aujourd’hui son premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de riz, 30 bouteilles de vin et 46 bouteilles de liqueur.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 sacks of rice and 30 bottles of drinks

Achat de 20 sacs de riz et de 30 bouteilles de boissons

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Señora Yanet is 30 years of age, succeeded in finishing high school, speaks the Aymará (langauge spoken by the Aymará people of the Andes) and Castillian (Spanish) languages, and lives with her two sons who are studying in the school in Puno.

She is from the Sector of Marquiri, but it is for her children that she lives in Puno.

She makes puppets, Peruvian-style wool hats, scarves, gloves on request. She has been doing this for four years, selling products to third-party sellers in Puno.

She belongs to the "Nuevo Horizonte" community bank where she received an initial loan of 300 new soles with which she was able to buy seven kilos of multi-color synthetic wool.

With this loan of 200 new soles ($75) which she will repay in four months, she will buy 5 kilos of multi-color synthetic wool and two kilos of filling to stuff the puppets.

She shows that she has learned to be responsible and on-time with her payments. She is very grateful for the loan that helped her easily buy the materials for her products.

Her big dream is to buy her own home in Puno, open a grocery shop, and for her children to study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yanet tiene 30 años de edad, logro estudiar secundaria completa, habla el idioma Aymará y Castellano, convive y tiene dos hijos varones que están estudiando en la escuela de Puno.

Ella es del Sector de Marquiri, por sus hijos, es que vive en Puno.

Se dedica a la producción de Títeres, chullos, chalinas, guantes, de acuerdo al pedido que se le hace, a esta actividad se dedica desde hace cuatro años, producto que vende a personas intermediarias en Puno.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Horizonte” donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar siete kilos de lana sintética multicolor.

Con este crédito de S/.200.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en cuatro meses, comprarà 5 kilos de lana sintética multicolor y 2 kilos de napa para relleno de los títeres.

Ella manifiesta que aprendió a ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Esta muy agradecida con el crédito por que le ayudo a comprar con facilidad sus materiales de producción.

El gran sueño que tiene es comprar una casa propia en Puno, abrir una tienda de abarrotes, y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: The Bulk Purchase of Wool and Filling for Dolls

loans.name: Nesi

texts.es:
La señora Nesi,  pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en Av. 3 de abril # 668, del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años es madre de 2 hijos y su esposo es motokarrista,  Nesi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la  venta de cebiche.

Nesi, en la actualidad continúa con su cebicheria, ella cuenta con   el  apoyo incondicional  de su esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará utensilios de cocina, pescado u otros  ingredientes para la preparación de su cebiche.  También comprará bebidas.

Nesi, es una mujer muy carismática es por ello que  sus clientes se sienten  muy a gusto por la atención  brindada, y es por ello que su clientela cada vez más se  va incrementando. Nesi agradece  al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle préstamo y que gracias a ello puede hacer seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Nesi is a member of the Comunal Bank “La Familia” on #688 April 3rd Avenue, in the district of Calleria, in the province of Ucayali. She’s a 36-yeard-old mother of 2 and her husband drives a motorcar. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, S/300, she decided to invest in the sale of ceviche (a popular Peruvian dish of marinated seafood). Currently, Nesi is continuing to sell ceviche and can count on the unconditional support of her spouse. With this loan of S/1,300, which will be fully paid in 4 months, she’ll buy kitchen utensils, fish or other ingredients needed to prepare ceviche. She’ll also buy drinks. Nesi’s charisma and exceptional customer service make her clients feel very comfortable and that’s the reason why her clientele is growing so quickly. Nesi is thankful to the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for giving her a loan and is grateful that she can continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils. To buy ingredients and drinks.

loans.name: Mbogga Fapp Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Mbogga Fapp de l'écovillage de Mbam (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) désirerait disposer d'un prêt de kiva pour renforcer la demande en produits halieutiques transformés (huitres, crevettes, langoustes, crabes, poissons séchés) des groupements existant sur le marché pour lutter contre le problème d'écoulement de fournisseurs de la zone. Ceci pour lutter contre l'oisiveté et permettre de créer des emplois aux femmes et contribuer à la lutte contre la pauvreté.
texts.en:
The Mbogga Fapp group of the eco-village of Mbam (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) would like to receive a Kiva loan to bolster the demand for processed seafood (oysters, shrimp, lobsters, crabs, dried fish) of existing groups in the marketplace to combat the problem of outflow of suppliers from this economic zone. The goal is to combat joblessness and create jobs for women and thus contribute to the struggle against poverty.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of seafood

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La señora Aydee Pérez V. tiene 22 años,  pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis, al Comedor Popular de su zona y es coordinadora del Vaso de Leche, vive en el barrio las Flores 155 del caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Curso educación primaria completa y ya no continua estudiando porque no hay secundaria en su zona.
Se casó de 20 años  y tiene una hija de dos años y diez meses, como mujer emprendedora que es cuida a su niña ayuda a su esposo en la carpintería y atiende su negocio. Aydee no descansa un instante porque es líder en su comunidad, coordina el reparto del vaso de leche y colabora en la elaboración de alimentos en el comedor popular.
Aydee, sintió la necesidad de colaborar en la economía de su hogar entonces como lo único que sabia hacer era tejer se propuso en tejer chompas, ponchos y ropita de bebé que vendía en los alrededores o los cambiaba con alimentos como trigo, cebada etc. Ahora vende ropa tejida en su casa y el negocio mejora cada vez más.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas empezó a comprar material para la elaboración de la ropa. 
Con este crédito de 200 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas piensa comprar lana para sus tejidos.
Aydee sueña con construir una bonita casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aydee Pérez V. is 22 years old. She is a member of both the San Luis Microfinance Institute, and her local community kitchen. She is also a coordinator for Vaso de Leche (Glass of Milk)—a welfare organization established to ensure that Peru’s underprivileged children have at least one glass of milk a day. She lives in the Las Flores neighborhood, 155 village of Motil, Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, in the department of La Libertad Perú. She completed elementary school but did not continue with her studies due to the lack of a high school in her area. She got married at 20 years of age and has a daughter, who is two years and three months old. As a hard-working woman, she takes care of her daughter, helps her husband in carpentry, and runs her own business. Aydee does not rest even for a second because she is a community leader. She manages the distribution of glasses of milk, and collaborates in making meals for the community kitchen. Aydee felt the need to contribute to the household finances, and since the only thing she knew how to do was crochet, she started making sweaters, ponchos and baby clothing that she would then sell in the surrounding areas, or she would trade them for food such as wheat, barley, etc. She now sells knitwear from home, and her business is getting better all the time. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, she started to buy the materials needed to make the clothing. With this loan of 200.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she plans on buying wool for her knitwork. Aydee dreams of building a beautiful house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale wool

loans.name: Anamelba

texts.es:
La señora Anamelba pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas ubicado en el Jr. Oscar Benavides Nº. 470, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza (UNIQUE). Tiene 9 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y también tiene como negocio la venta de ropa. En las mañanas se dedica a su bodega y por las tardes reparte su mercadería a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de fideos, golosinas, 2 docenas de blusas, faldas, etc.

Anamelba manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que saben trabajar y tiene el deseo de seguir surgiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Anamelba M. is a member of the Las Águilas (The Eagles) microfinance institute, located on Nº. 470 Oscar Benavides Street, in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and single. She decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in selling UNIQUE beauty products. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 9 years. She currently runs a general store from home. She also has a clothing business. In the morning, she minds the store and in the evening, she distributes merchandise to her customers. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of noodles, candy, 2 dozen blouses, skirts, etc. Anamelba states that Manuela Ramos is a big help for all women who know how to work. She wants her business to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods and clothing

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma lives in Brgy, Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela, a place near the long Cagayan River in the Philippines. The town is driven by agricultural. The people mainly farm rice and corn.

Gemma is married to Benjie, who drives a passenger tricycle. Together they had three children, Jaymark, Rea Angeline, and Johnny. Jaymark is 8 years old and in grade three, Rea Angeline is 7 years old and in grade two, and Johnny is 5 years old.

Gemma raises pigs in her backyard piggery. Her business helps her husband earn the daily living for their family.

Daily, Gemma keeps their house clean, washes their clothes and prepares her children for their schooling. She does all of this even as she also manages the piggery business, which is next to their house. Gemma is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve her business. She wants to buy an additional two heads of pig. With the remaining amount of her loan she will purchase feed for the pigs. She believes that her business will help her husband raise more income to sustain their family needs.

Even with the hardships she has encountered in her life, Gemma dreams is of sending all her children to school. She hopes they will be able to finish their courses in college someday. Only then, she believes, can she say that she has became a successful mother to her children.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Farani

texts.en: Farani S., 34, is single with 0 children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the taro, taamu, yam (platation) business. She sells her products to the people in her village as well as to the general public 1 day per week.. She is a new SPBD member with this being her first loan.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 60 Tala (~ 20 USD).  SPBD loans are Farani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase farming equipments to expand the plantation

loans.name: Yadiza Yelka

texts.es:
Yadiza es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Yadiza es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hijo, Yadiza vende cosméticos por catálogos de diferentes líneas como ebel, avon, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Yadiza vende ropa que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. También Yadiza trabaja por las mañanas como secretaria en una institución.
Yadiza necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, casacas.
Los sueños de Yadiza son comprar carros para alquilar, abrir una tienda de ropa o abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yadiza is a member of Tulipanes Community Bank.

Yadiza is common law married, she is 20 years old and has a son. Yadiza sells cosmetics by different catalogues such as Ebel and Avon, completing her sales through a credit system. Yadiza sells clothing that she acquires in the city of Lima. Yadiza also works in the mornings as a secretary for a company.

Yadiza require a loan of 1500 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of pants, polo shirts, and jackets.

Yadiza's dreams are to purchase a fleet of rental cars, and to open a store to sell clothing or groceries.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, polo shirts, and jackets.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi E. sells underwear and clothing at Akotobinsin near Elmina. Naomi has received a commercial education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is an auto electrician. Naomi has been selling underwear and clothing for a short time. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of underwear and clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

In the basket beside her are some fabric samples of what she sells.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
"Success requires a lot of courage, hard work, patience and responsibility” says Corazon S., a 55-year-old rice seller from Barangay Sta. Lucia Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She lives with her husband, Benjamin S., and their three children. The first two children have graduated from college and are presently working abroad. The youngest is still studying in secondary school. Corazon hopes that her youngest will also finish college.

The only source of income for the family is farming. At times, they have experienced financial difficulty, especially when their production is very low. This is the reason why Corazon is selling rice in her village to earn an income for her family. She chose this business because she knows that rice is a common commodity required by every family. Moreover, immediate sales are projected; therefore, there is less concern about having to stock the rice. 

Corazon is requesting a loan of PHP5, 000 to maintain her small business. She believes she can become successful with proper maintenance and hard work.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono nord de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’une boutique d’articles divers,  apprise auprès de son oncle maternel.
Avec une expérience de 4 ans, Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé maîtrise son activité.
Pour agrandir sa boutique, Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé décida de solliciter le concours de Soro Yiriwaso, pour acheter divers articles (thé, biscuit, insecticides, anti moustique en spirale, lames rasoir, cigarettes etc.)  
Il est à son premier prêt individuel  avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et a une  clientèle  constituée de toute les catégories sociales.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Zoumana Dembélé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage de construire sa maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Zoumana Dembélé, age 32, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and his children in the Hérémakono neighborhood, in the north of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having never attended school, he started working early on, and got introduced to selling various items by his mother's brother. Having now four years of experience, Mr. Zoumana Dembélé masters his business. To expand his shop, Mr. Zoumana Dembélé decided to seek help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to buy various items (tea, biscuits, insecticides, spiral mosquito repellents, razor blades, cigarettes, etc). He's seeking his first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali, and has a clientele comprising all social categories. With this loan, Mr. Zoumana Dembélé foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to build his own home.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for his retail store

loans.name: Saydi-Vakkoskhon

texts.ru: Саъди-ваккосхон и его жена занимаются торговлей занавесочными тканями. Опыт работы несколько лет. Раньше они только продавали ткани, а сейчас в связи с жесткой конкуренцией на рынке теперь они предлагают услуги замера, пошива и далее развешивания занавесок у клиента. Этим они привлекают все больше клиентов. Саъди-ваккосхону 38 лет, имеет 3 детей. Он подал заявку на займ и собирается выехать на оптовый рынок.
texts.en:
Saydi-vakkoskhon and his wife are involved in curtain fabrics sales. They have several years of experience in this business. In the past, they only sold fabrics, and now, due to tight market competition, they also offer services of measuring, making and placing curtains at clients’ locations. These additional services attract more and more clients. Saydu-vakkoskhon is 38 years old and has 3 children. He requested this loan and plans to use the funds at a wholesale market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of new assortment of goods

loans.name: Victor Bacilio

texts.es: El señor Víctor es casado con la señora Diana Vásquez, el trabaja en una fabrica desde hace 2 años en el área de  producción, pero su lucha para salir adelante al igual que su esposa no para ahí; ellos perciben un ingreso extra ya que se dedican a la elaboración y venta de menudo casero desde hace tres años, y ya que cuenta con clientela también desean iniciar su negocio propio de tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Victor is married to Diana Vásquez. He has worked in production in a factory for two years. In their fight to get ahead, he and his wife do not stop there. For three years they have been getting extra income from making and selling menudo, a traditional soup made from tripe. They have a client base. They hope to start their own business of having a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a grocery business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora cumple actualmente su 2do ciclo del program de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacion Paraguaya.  Sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa, reciben un crédito promedio de 500.000 y lo utilizan para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya estan realizando como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche, azucar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, y compra y venta de bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas, cervezas, vinos etc. 

Las otras integrantes son: 

Myrian R..	Vta de mercría.
Maria del Carmen G.. 	Vta de cosméticos.
Sabina L..	Vta de carbón.
Carolina I..	Vta de verduras y frutas.
Lidia I.. 	Vta de manualidades.
Sinthia F.. 	Vta de cosmeticos.
Maria Balbina R..	Vta de comestibles.
Claudia G..	Vta de mercería.
Noelia S.. 	Vta de ropas.
Marta S..	 Vta de articulos varios.
Nilda D..	 kiosko.
Myrian A..	 Vta de merceria.
Maura A.. 	 Vta de mercaderias varias.
Angelica B.. 	Vta de mercaderias varias.
Maria V..	Vta de cosméticos.
Justina M.	Vta de ropas
Hilda B.	Vta de cosmeticos
Myrian T.	Vta de comestibles
Karen M.	Vta de comestibles
Amelia G.	Vta de comestibles
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora committee just completed its second cycle in the Women Entrepreneurs program of the Fundacion Paraguaya. They already have productive activities, that they each develop on their own, and receive an average loan of 500,000 to enhance and vary their current activities such as: the purchase of supplies for producing foodstuffs, buying milk, sugar, tea, flour, salt, vegetables and baked goods for subsequent sale and the purchase and sale of beverages such as soft drinks, soda, beer, wine etc. The other members are: Myrian R.. Haberdashery sales. Maria del Carmen G.. Sale of cosmetics. Sabina L.. Sale of coal. I. Carolina. Sale of vegetables and fruits. Lidia I.. Handicraft sales Sinthia F.. Sale of cosmetics. Balbina Maria R.. Sale of foodstuffs. Claudia G.. Haberdashery sales. Noelia S.. Clothing sales. Marta S.. General merchandise sales. Nilda D.. Kiosk. Myrian A.. Haberdashery sales. Maura A.. General merchandise sales. Angelica B.. General merchandise sales. Maria V.. Sale of cosmetics. Justina M. Clothing sales Hilda B. Sale of cosmetics Myrian T. Grocery sales Karen M. Grocery sales Amelia G. Grocery sales

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell second hand clothes, buy and sell handmade jewelry, buy and sell vegetables and fruit, buy and sell wine, oil, rice production and sale of groceries, buy and sell items such as: sausage, sausage tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 21 years old and married. To make a living, Maricel runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Maricel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Lira

texts.en:
Lira V. C. has a small stand in front of her home where she sells candy, snacks and cigarettes. She also has a business with her sister-in-law selling clothing in rural areas outside the city. With this loan of 1800 nuevos soles, Lira plans to invest in more items for her stand as well as clothing for her shared venture with her sister-in-law.

Lira lives with her partner and their five children, ranging in age from 3 to 21. She is a member of the communal bank Manos Maravillosas (Marvellous Hands) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Lira has been working with Manuela Ramos for five years and invested her very first loan in candies for her business. According to Lira, Manuela Ramos has been a great help. She has had a good experience working with this organization and appreciates the fact that the interest rates are not too high. Lira eventually hopes to sell more and expand her business by putting up a kiosk in front of her home.

loans.use: To buy clothing and also candies and snacks to sell

loans.name: Haleema Muhammad Yousaf Group

texts.en:
Haleema Baji is the wife of M. Y.. They have lived in the mid-size city of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. She is a very supportive lady and always ready to help others. Her husband runs a scrap business in the community and has four years experience.  Haleema Baji is applying for a loan to buy scrap in order to increase the profits of her husband’s business.

This loan is a group loan with four other people:

Rani Baji wants to buy materials (rice, cooking oil and spices) for her business of making Punjabi food (Biryani). 
Razia Baji wants to buy timbers to sell. 
Waziran Baji wants to buy plastic beans for making plastic bottles. 
Nazia Baji wants to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Haleema Baji is seated in the center of the group.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Good Days Group

texts.en: Siah has never been to school. She’s married and the mother of five children with an additional three children of extended family members. She’s been engaged in selling dry goods (rice, oil, table salt, peas, etc.) for almost 10 years now. She dreams of getting additional goods for the business and generating more funds to sustain her children and herself. Her greatest challenge has been “finance.”

loans.use: Oil, rice, table salt, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 29 year-old carpenter who runs his business in Nairobi. The carpentry business is doing well, and David has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber, nails and glue (raw materials). He would like to grow his business and improve his living standards. David dreams of making enough money to educate his two children and build a home for his family. He describes himself as warm and friendly. 



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of raw materials

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Safiatou D. a  48 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six  enfants (1 garçon et 5 filles) à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou D., après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente de pâtes et légumes de manioc afin de  fabriquer de l’Attièkè,  qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine venue de la république de Côte d’Ivoire; depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ cinq ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel  tous correctement remboursés.
 Vue son expérience, Madame Safiatou D. vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit et très souvent en gros à une clientèle composée très généralement des femmes qui vont aller revendre en détail. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt,  30 sacs de racines de manioc à Sikasso et environnants  et  50 sacs de pâtes de manioc (Tièkèdoro) à Bouaké (République de la Côte d Ivoire) afin de  fabriquer de l’Attièkè de bonne qualité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de pâte de racines  de manioc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B., 44 years old is a rice farmer. Everyday she tills her small hectare of rice field which she hopes could provide her family their needs like food, clothes, medicines and income to pay the school.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy the farming needs. receiving this loan is worthwhile because she doesn't have ready cash to support her business now. With her loan, she hopes that she will be able to double her harvest to support her family more.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 46 years old and the mother of five children. She is the leader of her group in Mukono and owns a farm where she grows a wide variety of produce including but not limited to, bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.

Sarah has been running her farm for 10 years and currently generates on average 80,000 USH per month in profits. She would like to use this loan to purchase more seed and fertilizer in order to increase crop yields. With persistence and continued hard work, she hopes to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Shuname

texts.en: Shuname is the 27-year-old mother of one nine-year-old boy. She sells secondhand clothes in Nairobi. She has been running this business for five years and hopes to diversify into other lines of business. Shuname is requesting a fourth loan of Kes 80,000 to add stock of secondhand clothes to her business. She describes herself as successful and says that her business has grown since joining Faulu Kenya. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of used clothes

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita V. is from the village of D'BAN, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Avelita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Avelita owns & operates a business manufacturing flower pots and native baskets. Avelita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Avelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Avelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC.This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the business. Avelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials needed for her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Avelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials

loans.name: Hidayatou Akankê

texts.fr: A. Hidayatou Akankê est née le 23 Juin 1978 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Hidayatou Akankê vit depuis près de 20 ans au quartier Tokpota à Porto-Novo. C’est une célibataire avec trois enfants à charge. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Hidayatou Akankê vit seule avec ses enfants, et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Hidayatou Akankê n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Hidayatou Akankê vend depuis près de cinq ans, des fournitures d’électricité à Tokpota à Porto-Novo. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Hidayatou Akankê fait ses approvisionnements. Hidayatou Akankê a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. C’est dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir son activité, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Hidayatou Akankê sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Hidayatou Akankê was born on June 23, 1978 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  For nearly 20 years, she has been living in the Tokpota district in Porto-Novo.  She is unmarried and has three children to support.  All of the children are in school.  She lives alone with her children and is the only one supporting the family.  Hidayatou Akankê did not go to school.  To provide for herself and her children, she has been selling electrical supplies for five years in Tokpota in Porto-Novo.  She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She once obtained an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid.  With regard to augmenting her working capital and expanding her business, in order to make her customers happier, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electrical supplies and equipment

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a tailor, sewing clothes for both men and women, and she also sells sarongs of various colors. Her primary customers are residents, neighbors and friends. She is very creative and hardworking. She has been in this sewing business for five years and hopes for a bigger stall in the future.

Doris is 28 years old and is married with a child. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.

Doris hopes to employ more hands to enable her to reach a larger number of customers in this festive season. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase a sewing machine and more sarongs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Doris is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio Cesar, de 42 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, el mayor de 20 años estudia 4to año de derecho, la niña de 17 años va a 1er año de la universidad, la de 15 esta en 3er año de bachillerato y el menor de 14 años en primaria, pero tiene problemas de la vision. trabaja en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como ayudante de maquinaria pesada desde hace 5 años, con horario de 7am. a 5 pm. de lunes a viernes, el fin de semana lo tiene libre, ademas del salario de la Alcaldia, cuenta con una pension del INSS, su compañera de vida Miriam trabaja vendiendo productos de AVON obtenieno un ingreso mensual con el que aporta a los gastos del hogar, ademas esta estudiando la carrera de derecho. Don Julio esta solicitando su 2do credito para continuar mejorando su vivienda, pues gracias a kiva con el credito anterior logro comprar algunos materiales para mejorar la casa, aunque no logro hacer lo que tenia planificado pues los materiales estaban demasiado caros, por lo que esta solicitando este credito para cambier el techo de su casa ,y embaldosarla. El mayor sueño de Julio Cesar es poder tener una vivienda bonita y con las condiciones basicas para su familia, pues es el patrimonio que puede darles.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 42, and he has four children. The oldest is 20, and is studying his fourth year of law. His 17 year old daughter is in her first year at the university. His 15 year old daughter is in her third year of high school. The 14 year old is in elementary school, but he has vision problems. He has worked as a heavy machinery assistant in the city of Juigalpa for five years. His schedule is from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. from Monday to Friday. He is off on the week ends. In addition to his salary from the city, he has a pension from INSS (Nicaragua Social Security Institute). His life partner, Miriam, works selling Avon products. She gets a monthly income, which contributes to the household expenses. Also, she is studying for a career in law. Julio is asking for his second loan to continue improving his house. Thanks to Kiva, he used his previous loan to buy some materials to improve his house. However, he was not able to do all that he had planned because the materials were too expensive. That is why he is asking for this loan to change the roof on his house and tile it. Julio Cesar’s greatest dream is to have a nice house with the basic conditions for his family. It is the asset that he can give them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change and tile the roof of his house

loans.name: Honesty Group

texts.en:
These are member of the 'Honesty' group from Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to improve their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, these entrepreneurs will be able to attract many more customers, make more sales, and earn more profit. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Bai K. who is second from left. The 27-year-old is single with one primary-school-going child. Bai has been running a Tele-Center for 3 years now. In his Tele-Center, he sells top-up cards for all 5 mobile phone companies–Africell, Commiun, Sierratel, Tigo, and Zain. He also recharges mobile phone batteries for a fee of SLL 1,000 and sells mobile phone accessories like chargers, spare mobile phone batteries, etc. Bai has applied for this loan in order to buy top-up cards and chargers to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy top-up cards and mobile phone chargers

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en:
Marichelle Y. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Marichelle is single and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Marichelle owns & operates a tricycle transport service. Marichelle has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marichelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marichelle is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marichelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia is married with two children. Her children are in secondary school.  Her husband also works to support the home. She has a computer center alongside her husband. She renders computer services to her customers and she sells computer accessories. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more computer accessories. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Intiqam

texts.en:
Intiqam M. is a 43-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his three children. 

Intiqam has been running a business raising and selling cattle. He has 25 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Intiqam has become a very successful businessman in a short period. He works hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing them. 

Now Intiqam wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So he applied for a loan of1600 AZN. Intiqam thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Georgina Guadalupe

texts.es: Georgina tiene 51 años, ella se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de tricitaxi, por lo que tiene más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que junto a su esposo han pasado circunstancias muy difíciles, además de este negocio tiene su pequeña pulpería, los triciclos son su mayor fuente de ingresos, pues la mayoría de sus ingresos provienen de este medio de vida, por lo que junto a su esposo luchan cada día para obtener más ganancias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y comprar  ciertos repuestos para sus triciclos y un termo para las gaseosas y el hielo. Ella sueña seguir adelante con su negocio pues mantenerlo activo ha sido un gran reto.
texts.en:
Georgina is 51 years old. She has had a tricitaxi (a pedal powered three-wheeled taxi) for more than 9 years and along with her husband they have gone through some very difficult circumstances. Besides having the tricitaxi, she has her own convenience store. The tricycles are her biggest source of income and with her husband they struggle each day have more earnings. The loan is for work capital and to buy some spare parts for the tricycles and a thermos for the soft drinks and ice. Georgina dreams of continuing with her business since keeping it open has been a great challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Ytalo

texts.es:
Ytalo tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive en casa familiar que comparte con sus hermanos 
mayores; se dedica a la comercialización de pollo para las bodegas y puestos de venta 
de pollo ya sea en los mercados u otros establecimientos. Requiere el crédito para 
incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que desea empezar a trabajar con pollerias, 
quienes requieren de una fuerte cantidad de pollos diarios. Es una persona amable y 
cordial que cuenta con experiencia en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ytalo is 26 years old. He is single and lives in his family's home that he shares with his older siblings. He sells chicken to stores and points of sale for chicken whether it be in the market or in other establishments. He needs the loan to increase his working capital since he wants to start to work with poultry stores, which require a high quantity of chicken every day. He is a kind and cordial person who has experience in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mr. H., age 23, works as one of the mosquito protection staff in an organization, earning a suitable salary. He has a life partner in his wife who is a department manager in a hotel in Siem Reap province. The couple is newly married and they don’t have any children yet. 

H. faces an obstacle; he finds it hard traveling to work or anywhere else because he has no vehicle for riding. He has tried to save up his personal money but he is still not able to buy one. Therefore, H. decided to seek a loan from Kiva in the amount of US$ 1200 to be used to purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Joseph Kimani

texts.en:
Joseph is a 58-year-old farmer. He is married to Ann, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two adult sons and three adult daughters, all of whom are working. 

Joseph has been farming for the past 30 years. He was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. He plans to buy a better dairy cow and dairy feed with the loan he has applied for.  

Joseph intends to buy more dairy cows in the future with his expected profits. His hopes and dreams are to get more money and improve the living standards of his family. He describes himself as a middle-class, mixed agricultural farmer who is hardworking and loves his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and dairy feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To equip his workshop and buy spare parts

loans.name: Nye Nyame Den Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Agnes describes herself as a very focused woman. She is 40 years old and she is the leader of the “Nye Nyame Den” (translated as 'It is possible with God') borrower group. Agnes lives in Dormaa and sells maize in the community market. She has been selling maize for 4 years and also does part time work with the water company in her community. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase maize in bulk to serve her customers. 

Agnes is a widow and the mother of four children. She hopes to be financially able to support her family and also provide tertiary education to all her children. As the leader of the group, Agnes ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Salamat C. is the leader of the group. She is 59 and married. She and her husband are retired. In order to make some money, Salamat works in a sewing workshop and her husband provides welder services, and they also breed cattle. They have a son; he is 27 and works as a horse-breeder. When he is free, he helps his parents with cattle breeding. Salamat started to breed cattle eleven years ago; she got some cattle as an inheritance from her parents. Now she wants to get a loan to purchase two farm animals in order to sell them after fattening and make some money.

Iygilik Z., 31, is married. He works as a programmer and his wife studies at university. He applied for the loan, because he needs money to pay for his wife’s education. In the future he wants to open a kiosk and sell convenience goods.

Tolokan M., 44, is married. She works as a teacher in kindergarten and her husband works as a driver and receives 3500 soms per month. Tolokan and her husband also breed cattle; they have been doing it for fourteen years. They have a son and a daughter; the daughter studies at school and the son went to work in construction to earn some money. Tolokan wants get a loan because she needs money to pay for her daughter’s studies. In the future she wants to build a house in Bishkek.

Sveta U. is 37 and married. She works as a teacher at a school. She also breeds cattle, like most families in their village. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase hay for the animals. In the future Sveta wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: to purchase two farm animals

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach O. (in the photo) is a widow with seven children: three sons and four daughters. Four of them are married; two live in separate homes. One is a tailor and the other two stay at home. They are living on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Thach has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market or other places. Thach does not have capital to purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business and that’s why she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000. She also will use a part of her loan to build a tailoring shop for her daughter, who is a tailor.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and build a tailoring shop for her daughter

loans.name: Koem Ly's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem Ly C., age 68, is the leader of this group loan. She was selected by the four members, who all live in Ou Romchek village in the Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Koem Ly C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land in which to cultivate vegetables for a living. She works very hard to support a child. She will use the loan that she sought from AMK to buy fertilizers and pesticide to cultivate vegetables. 

Mrs. Koem Ly C. is widow with a child, who is also a farmer and supports her mother on the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate vegetables

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana nació en la ciudad de Chinchero que está ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Roxana vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y su hijo (Mario Cesar de un año). Roxana tiene  23 años y hace 15 años atrás se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas a los turistas extranjeros y nacionales que vienen a visitar la zona arqueológica de Chinchero.  Actualmente, Roxana pertenece  a la  Asociación Natividad de Chinchero (Es un grupo de vendedoras que se asociaron para tener beneficios sociales). A Roxana la pueden  encontrar en su puesto de venta, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde o hasta que los turistas se vayan del lugar.    

Con su próximo préstamo, Roxana que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Una parte del dinero del préstamo le gustaría comprar mercadería y la otra parte utilizara para el bautizo de su hijo.     

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, pero Roxana recién está participando  en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Roxana, 23, was born in the city of Chinchero located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. She currently lives in Cusco with her husband and son, Mario Cesar, 1. Roxana has sold sweets and soft drinks for the last 15 years to foreign and national tourists that come to visit the Chinchero archaeological sites. Roxana is a member of the Natividad de Chinchero Association (a group of vendors that united to get social benefits). One can find Roxana at her sales stand seven days a week from 7am until 6pm or until the tourists leave the site. Roxana expects to get 1000 new soles in her next loan. Part of the funds will be used to buy merchandise and the other will be used for her son’s Baptism. The “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” communal bank has been in operation for two and a half years but Roxana is a recent collaborator in the bank and does well. The name of the communal bank is a Quechua (the local native language) term that means “Beautiful Chinchero Princess.”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and for her son's Baptism.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding her fields and buying manure

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita B. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old, married and has 2 infant and  1 school aged  children. To make a living, Enecita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Enecita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Enecita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nasuuru

texts.en: Nasuuru is a 25-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house in the village although he is renting in town and his family dream is to have his home and family in town to access better services. Nasuuru has a butcher shop and has been in the business for 10 years. When his business started, he sold only goat meat but now he can afford beef although the rainy season is still a hindrance to the business as customers hardly buy beef in that period. His business dream is to have a number of butcher shops in different areas. Nasuuru needs this loan to buy more cattle to sell as beef at his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell as beef at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos menores de edad en el sector Carlos Stein, una zona urbano marginal del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y a la vez uno de los que tienen mayores indices de pobreza.

Se dedida desde hace cinco años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que está conformado por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina), el brinda su servicio en la zona y gracias a el se encarga de sustentar los gastos de su familia. Paralelamente trabaja también como maestro albañil.

José Carlos ha venido ahorrando dinero para adquirir una mototaxi más, la cual piensa alquilar para agenciarse de ingresos adicionales. Para completar la cantidad de dinero que necesita ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José Carlos ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir una casa para vivir junto a su esposa e hijo ya que actualmente vive en la casa de su suegra.
texts.en:
Jose Carlos is a family man. He is 32 years old and he lives together with his wife and their two young children in the Carlos Stein sector. It is a suburban region in of the Jose Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the most populous districts in the region and it is also one of the poorest regions. 

For the past five years he has been providing transportation services to both passengers and cargo using a motorcycle rickshaw (it is a motorized vehicle that is made of a transformed motorcycle with an attached cabin). He provides service in the region and thanks to this business he is able to cover his family's expenses. Additionally he also works as a construction worker. 

Jose Carlos has been saving money to purchase another motorcycle taxi. He's thinking of renting out this second unit to have an additional source of income. In order to complete the funds he needs he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. 

Jose Carlos has been involved with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and he has been a good and responsible client. His greatest dream is to have a home of his own where he could live together with his wife and their son. Currently they live with his mother-in-law.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle rickshaw.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K., 68, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of 1 USD each per day. Keo spends 40 USD on food and 10 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase raw silk to produce silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

K.'s daughter appears in the photograph because K. is not available.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products for resale

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Patricia del Carmen H. de 26 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután en donde vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 4 años de edad. Patricia posee un pequeño negocio en el cual comercializa diferentes tipos de golosinas como: dulces, chicles, galletas, jugos, así mismo comercializa café en polvo, granos básicos entre otros productos de primera necedidad. Estos los comercializa por mayor, y su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el  mercado llamado “mercado de Pelotas”, uno de los mercados más grandes de Usulután. Patricia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de golosinas, granos básicos, jugos y otros más, y de esta forma aumentar las ventas, las cuales sean de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia.
texts.en: Patricia del Carmen H. is 26 years old.  She lives in Usulután Department with her husband and their 4-year old son.  Patricia owns a small business in which she sells different types of sweets, like candies, gum, cookies and juice. She also sells instant coffee and basic grains, along with other basic needs products.  She sells these item in bulk.  Her business is located in the “Mercado de Pelotas” market, which is one of the largest markets in Usulután. Patricia is requesting the loan to be able to invest in her business.  She plans to buy a greater quantity of sweets, basic grains, juices and other items, and in this way to increase her sales, which are a great financial help to her family.

loans.use: To purchase basic needs products, which will be invested in her business.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista 1”  ubicado en la provincia D. Puno, tiene 75 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijos, la señora estudió educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desD. hace 05 años, su   primer préstamo  fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital D.  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero utilizará para comprar ropa al por mayor, para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y hacerlo crecer.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal  son las ganancias que generan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of the "Bellavista 1" commercial bank located in Puno province.  She is 75 years old, in a common law marriage and has 5 children.  She has a primary education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, money she used to increase the capital of her business.  She works selling clothing.

She is asking for a new loan of 300 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy clothing wholesale for men, women, and children.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and make it grow.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the earnings her savings generate.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius P. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 24 years old. Julius is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Julius raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Julius has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) when he sells one of his raised animals. In 2009, Julius joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julius has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Julius is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Julius from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Chhou

texts.en: Chhou S. is a widow woman who lives in the province of Banteay Meanchey. Chhou S. sells fish-paste which she buys from the wholesalers and she takes to resell in the local market, and she could earn a profit in average $4 a day for supporting in the family expense. Her husband died of senility for many years ago. She currently lives with five children, three are single and the remaining two are married. She has a son who works as a building worker in Poiy Pet City. Presently, Chhou S.’s business is running well, and it is a good time for making more profit, So that Chhou S. has decided to ask for fund from Kiva to purchase more fish-paste in the big amount than present time for sales.

loans.use: To purchase more fish-paste in the big amount than present time for sales.

loans.name: Peter Sankale

texts.en:
Peter Ngasahr is 23 years old.  He is married to Cynthia. They have one baby, who is three months old.  He lives with his family in the Ololchani area in Kilgoris.

Peter is a farmer and has been in this business for the past three years. He has seen his business grow after he took out the first loan.  He is now applying for the second one to enable him buy bean seeds and fertilizer to use on his farm. 

Peter has a good credit history with us and earns a monthly income of Kes 40,000. The profits made from the harvest will be used to expand the business by investing back into it.

His dream is to be able to buy a Nissan bus that can be used for a transport business.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah K. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has eight children, two of whom are in school, six of whom are grown. She also takes care of several grandchildren.    

Hadjah is in the business of selling a locally-brewed alcohol called waragi (bar business). She has been in this business for more than ten years and she works six days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products wholesale. Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bulk quantities of the locally-produced beverage from the villages. She also generates additional income through selling car tires at her husband’s shop.

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to make enough money to pay for school fees for her children and grandchildren and buy a bigger plot of land. Hadjah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of waragi (a locally-brewed alcohol similar to gin) to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Namnama

texts.en:
Namnama G. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Namnama owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Namnama joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Namnama’s 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kamla

texts.en:
Kamla is a 43-year-old mother of seven with an elementary school education. She dreamed of opening a business and being able to earn a living.
