Kamla always had strong skills in sewing and alterations. She loved to design dresses and children's clothes. Three years ago, Kamla gained business training and opened her business.

She needs this loan to purchase an additional sewing machine that allows specialty sewing for button holes, zippers and other designs. Kamla also purchased additional cloth and fabric.

Kamla wants to expand her business first in a larger room she has set aside at home but in the future she wants to open a shop and sell near the market in her city.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: Janette is a 30 year-old single woman.  Janette owns a shop in which she sells rice, beans, sugar, Irish potatoes, and green bananas. Janette started this business when she was 23 years old, and it has helped her to develop herself. Janette is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas,potatoes etc for her business to expand, and with the profits she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes, green bananas and other food stuffs .

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Dieupeul 4 Groupe 5

texts.fr:
Le groupe 5 est un autre démembrement de la cellule Apec Al Ouma Dieupeul 4. C’est un groupe mixte de 06 personnes qui constituent une même Famille. Ils habitent ensemble aussi. Ils sont représentés par monsieur Mamadou D. B.  qui capitalise une expérience de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce d’arachide, de poissons secs et d’huile de palme. Le groupe est sociétaire du guichet de Liberté 6 depuis février 2011. Ils sollicitent un crédit de 1 000 000 frs dans le but de s’approvisionner à Vélingara en poissons secs, arachide et huile de palme. Leur intention est de pouvoir mieux diversifier les produits qu’ils souhaitent vendre. Avec l’augmentation de leur capital de commerce ils ont pour objectif de renforcer leur activité et satisfaire leurs clients.
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients
texts.en:
Group 5 is another division of the Apec Al Ouma Dieupeul 4 unit. It's a mixed group of 6 persons from the same family. They also live together. They are represented by Mr. Mamadou  Djita B. who capitalizes on 10 years' experience in the sale of groundnuts, dried fish and palm oil. The group has been a member of the Liberté 6 branch since February, 2011. They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000  francs in order to stock up in Vélingara with dried fish, groundnuts and palm oil. Their intention is to able to better diversify the products they want to sell. Their goal is to expand their business and satisfy their customers with the increase in their business capital.

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients

loans.use: To buy dried fish, groundnuts and palm oil.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 33 years old, married and has two children: a 13-year-old boy and a 7-year-old girl. Both children go to school. Maya and her family live in the village of Nakhshirghele, Terjola District. The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They have four milk cows and produce traditional Georgian cheese. Tsinadzes always have cheese clients, because they produce quality cheese. Also, the family owns a 1 hectare plot of the land. Part of this land is used for a vineyard and the other part for strawberry and nut growing. The harvested fruits are sold locally. 

Kakhaber works in a local factory making construction materials. He also helps his wife with the farming activities. 

Maya requested a loan for the purchase of an additional milk cow. It will allow her to produce more cheese and increase the family income. Maya and Kakhaber plan to make some savings and invest in the further development of their farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Pelila Ole

texts.en:
Pelila Ole O. is 39 years old.  He is married and has three children. He has been in the animal trading business for the last four years.

Pelila Ole O. was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client in his area of residence. This is his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase some goats and sheep for fattening and sale for a profit. He intends to use the returns from this loan to expand his business as well as to repay the loan.  

His dream is to be the best and well known businessman in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: buy goats and sheep for raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, grains, drinks, toilet paper and detergent

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean is 33 years old and married, with four children between the ages of 3 and 11 years old and six dependent relatives. Jean has five years of experience selling Irish potatoes. His business is well organized and he employs one person.

Jean has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy large quantities of Irish potatoes. Jean will use the profits generated from this loan to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of Irish potatoes.

loans.name: And Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité And Bokk Jom est créé le 10 décembre 2010 . Il est au cycle 2 et est composé de quatorze femmes issues du même quartier.

Madame Nogaye est mariée sans enfant. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, elle est la responsable du groupe et s'active dans la transformation des fruits et légumes. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en rose blanche.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans le village; elle a une bonne expérience et a bénéficié d'une formation pour cette activité de transformation.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt agrandir son activité pour se faire beaucoup de clients et de revenus.

Elle contribue avec ses bénéfices à améliorer les conditions de vie par la nourriture,l'habillement et la santé; aussi elle compte augmenter son épargne pour prétendre à un autre prêt plus élevé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "And Bokk Jom" was created on September 10, 2010. It is on cycle 2, and it is composed of 14 women from the same district. 

Ms. Nogaye, aged 37, is married and without children. She is the group's official and is active in processing fruit and vegetables. In the photo, she is standing at the right and dressed in white and pink. She gets her supplies from the weekly markets and resells in the village; she has good experience and has benefited from training in this food processing activity. 

She would like to use her loan to expand her business, so as to have a lot of customers and profits.  With the profits, she is helping to improve living conditions, in terms of food, clothing, and health care; she also plans on increasing her savings to apply for another, larger loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to process into products to be sold

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene 28 años, es conviviente, y tiene dos hijos, tiene un puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de Santa Elena. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevos harina, aceite, etc.
Ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, con éste es el segundo ciclo que está le parece bonito, se aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que reciben. Está ahorrando para comprarse un terreno. Su sueño es tener su negocio en su casa propia.
texts.en: Julia is a member of the communal bank Despertar. She is 28 years old and lives with her partner. She has 2 children. She has a grocery stall in the Santa Elena market. She will invest the loan that she is applying for in the purchase of groceries in general, such as rice, sugar, pasta, eggs, flour, oil, etc. She joined FINCA Peru at the invitation of a member. This is her second loan cycle. She likes the communal bank. She learns a lot from the training that they receive. She is saving to buy a plot of land. Her dream is to have her business in her own house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pasta, eggs, flour, and oil.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, age 44, earns a living by rearing poultry. She has been in this business for seven years and has employed one person. She sells chickens to hotels for slaughter. She is married  and her three children are enrolled in school.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business through training in business management skills. She hopes to own a big poultry farm in the future.  

She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy broilers and chicken feed and to vaccinate her chickens.

loans.use: to buy broilers and chicken feed and to vaccinate her chickens

loans.name: Karla Geraldina

texts.es:
Karla vive acompañada con su pareja de vida que le ayuda económicamente, sus hijos los tiene estudiando para que tenga un mejor futuro. Mujer emprendedora, trabajadora tiene su propio negocio venta de repuestos y más. Se le presento una dificulta de un accidente de tránsito dejando perdidas en el negocio por descuido siendo superado y ahora con los planes de agrandar el negocio. Inicio con fondos de micro crédito, siendo de gran ayuda.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a desarrollo de su negocio. Con el préstamo comprar productos como: luces, retenedores, batería, bobina, cadena, sistema de arrastre, corona, bullís de tijeras, balinera de dirección, cuna, patada de arranque, entre otros productos. 
Generándole ganancia y mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Karla lives with her partner, whom she helps economically.  Her children are studying so they can have a better future.  An enterprising and hard-working woman, she has her own business selling spare parts and more.  She had a car accident, which caused her losses in her business, but she has overcome these problems and is now planning to expand her business.  She started with microcredit loans, which were of great help.  She thanks the loan company for helping her to develop her business.  

With this loan she will buy such products as: lights, retainers, batteries, coils, chains, belt systems, wheel crowns, shears, ball bearings, chocks, and kick starts. This will generate income and help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy spare parts.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maritza; La socia tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 2 hijos de 23, 21 años de edad; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia realiza carteras, ella tiene su stand en el centro comercial confraternidad; la socia trabaja también para lelamente a esto vendiendo productos de belleza de las marcas de esika, avon y materiales para realizar las carteras. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales, la socia comprara cueros de colores, hebillas, argollas, lazos, telas, gamuzas, cierres, botones y otros materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la realización de sus carteras.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastián Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Huanchac in the Province and Department of Cusco.

Maritza is 48 years old, married and has two children who are 23 and 21 years old. She works in retail selling purses and her stand is located in the Confraternidad shopping center. Maritza also works selling Esika and Avon beauty products, as well as materials for making purses. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of materials like colored leather, buckles, rings, bows, fabrics, suede, zippers, buttons and other items to make her purses.

Maritza is grateful for the support provided and promises to be disciplined in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials to make purses.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children, and all of them go to school. She has a retail shop. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar and flour. Her inspirational goal is to expand into a wholesale shop. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar and flour.

loans.name: Annah Mwasya

texts.en:
Annah is a 58-year-old married woman. She has six children ranging from 19 to 35 years old. For the past four years, Annah has operated a retail stall where she sells cups, soap bars, salt, bowls, plates, pens and exercise books. Her business is located in a market and her primary customers are students and other consumers. Annah describes herself as talkative and social. She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent interruptions by the town council. 

Annah is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to add stationary stock to her store, such as pens and exercise books. Her business goal is to own a shop in town within five years. Annah hopes that in the future she will see her children and grandsons graduate from school.

loans.use: to buy stationary supplies, such as pens and exercise books

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
El señor Celestino esta casado y vive en aldea Las Balitas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Celestino desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura y la cría de ganado, tiene terreno en donde cultiva, y se dedica a la venta de leña, la misma que la lleva a su casa para luego ser comercializada en la ciudad de Nacaome, todos los días sale con su carro cargado de leña seca para distribuirla a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, ya que en estas epocas de mucha lluvia este producto se escasea y se compra mucho mas caro.

Su sueño es tener una buena finca de ganado.
texts.en:
Celestino is married and lives in the village Las Balitas in the city of San Lorenzo. 

Since he was very young Celestino has worked in the agriculture and animal breeding. He has land where he farms, and he sells wood which he takes to his home before being sold in the city of Nacaome. Every day he leaves with his car full of wood to deliver to his clients. He will use the loan to buy wood because when it rains a lot this product is scarce and much more expensive. 

His dream is to have a good livestock farm.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra.  Eugenia esta casada con  el señor Jorge y viven la ciudad de La Paz tienen  dos hijos que están en la edad  escolar, la cliente vende comida  y su esposo trabaja  en la   en una empresa publica,  juntos trabajan sacrificadamente  para salir adelante   y de esta manera lograr sus objetivos que tienen en la familia el crédito  que solicito lo invertirá en la compra de material de construcción para la refacción de la casa donde viven , la Sra. Eugenia se siente feliz por ser beneficiado con el crédito, ya que con este crédito la  Sra. brindara mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is married and lives with her husband Jorge in the city of La Paz. They have two school-age children.

She sells food, and her husband works for a public agency.  Together they work hard and make sacrifices in order to make progress and achieve their goals for their family.

The loan she is seeking will be invested in construction materials to make repairs to their house.

Eugenia will be happy to receive this loan, since with these funds she will be able to provide more comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her home

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 40 years old enterprising business lady who is married to Thomas. They both distribute timber and this has been their business for the past two years. They earn a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her third loan term from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Monica will use the loan to buy a power saw for cutting down more timber. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will buy another power saw. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy a power saw for cutting timber

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 32 years old with two children, and she is living in Phu Man commune.  To earn a daily income, she opened a  shop that sells food for vegetarians in 1991. Her business is much developed since she has  had more capital that she received from SEDA's micro-credit program since 2007.  Now,  every day, she can make 200,000 VND in profit. With this income, she can manage her family's expenditures well.  Since she joined our program, she has always been in a good repayment situation. 

 For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 VND  to buy more kinds of food  to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of food for vegetarians.

loans.name: Jitegemee Shg Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Jitegemee SHG Group in Western Kenya! Ezekiel is the facilitator of the Jitegemee SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ezekiel is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds for quality harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Ezekiel had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ezekiel was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ezekiel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Ezekiel will save for future use and invest in livestock

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members. On the far left is their Field Officer.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mazatl Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Mazatl esta integrado por trece mujeres, ellos viven en una comunidad lejana en la sima de un cerro, sus principales actividades economicas son el cultivo de cafe, naranja y maiz, la mayoria de los habitantes de esta comunidad hablan el dialecto Nahuatl y le han puesto el nombre de Mazatl a su grupo que es una palabra en nahuatl que significa Venado.

La señora Heriberta es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 45 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Victor que trabaja en el campo, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados.

Doñña heriberta platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y hace un poco mas de 18 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de pollo para ganar un poco de dinero extra  y asi poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Ella realiza sus ventas todos los dias desde su hogar se levanta temprano para aliniar su pollo y saca una pequeña mesa la cual pone en la parte de enfrente de su casa y pone en una bandeja su pollo y conforme va pasando el dia sus clientes van a su negocio ha hacerle el gastos.

ella nececita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos para ppoder realizar sus ventas. 

ella dijo"Gracias a la fundacion Realidad por venir hasta nuestra localidad a brindarnos estos prestamos"

Tambien nos dijo que espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que le gustaria a que su negocio continue creciendo y iniciar a vender pan ya que deja buenas ganancias.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Lourdes venta de antojitos mexicanos
Imelda venta de abarrotes 
Elodia Venta de reposteria 
Emma venta de pan 
Beatriz venta de pollo 
Enriqueta venta de pan 
Matilde venta de pollo
Griselda venta de ropa 
Felicitas Venta de refresco 
Maria Geremias venta de pollo 
Susana Venta de refresco 
Nicacia Venta de pan
texts.en:
The “Mazatl” group has 13 women members living in a distant community on a hilltop.  Its main economic activities are growing coffee, oranges and corn.  Most of the residents of this community speak Nahuatl and have called their group Mazatl because in Nahuatl that means “Deer.”

Heriberta is one of the group members.  She’s 45 years old and only completed elementary school.  She’s married to Víctor who works in the fields.  She has four children who are all married already.

Heriberta relates that she’s always enjoyed working and a little over 18 years ago decided to start her own business selling chicken to earn a little extra money to help her husband with the household expenses.

She sells every day at home.  She rises early every day to butcher the chicken and set up a small table in front of her house where she places her tray of chicken.  As the day progresses her customers come by to make their purchases.  She needs the loan to buy chickens so that she can make her sales.

She said:  “Thank you to Fundación Realidad for coming all the way to our location to offer us these loans.”  She also told us that she hopes that her business will prosper with this loan because she’d like her business to continue and to start selling bread because that’s quite profitable.

The other group members are:

Lourdes – Mexican fast food snack sales
Imelda – grocery sales 
Elodia – pastry sales 
Emma – bread sales
Beatriz – chicken sales
Enriqueta - bread sales 
Matilde – chicken sales
Griselda – clothing sales 
Felicitas – soft-drink sales 
María Geremías – chichen sales 
Susana – soft-drink sales 
Nicacia – bread sales

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is 34-years-old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her son is staying at home due to the college fee. 

She started her cafeteria business in 2008 by renting it. Now she has a contract with many companies serving lunch. Her foods are tasty, largely portioned and cheap. However, she can't handle all the customers due to the space of the cafe. She has a half built extension of a cafe and she wants to finish it. 

She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to finish her cafe's extension. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says,"My business is going great however I couldn't pay my son's college fee. If I build this extension, my son would be able to go to the college."

loans.use: to finish her cafe's extension.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
Ziporah is a very hardworking woman who has been practicing mixed farming for over 5 years. She is 36 years old, married and a mother to three children. 

She is applying for her first loan where she plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs such as maize seeds and fertilizers and use the remainder to add more stock in her grocery business. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and as well as to add stock in her grocery business

loans.name: Leakna

texts.en:
Leakna (pictured above), age 23, is single. She lives with her mother and sister in the suburbs of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers away. Her mother is a rice farmer. 

Leakna is a garment worker. The kitchen where she cooks broke in some parts so she needs to repair it, but she does not have any money. 

Hence she has decided to ask for her first loan in the amount of $800 in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Mary Vamscy

texts.en:
Mary Vamscy is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Mary Vamscy has a pigpen from which she sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Mary Vamscy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Vamscy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 52 year old man from Migori and is married to Achieng and they have seven children, who are in school.

Fredrick operates a cereal selling business, a business he has been doing for the last six years making monthly profits of KES.17,000. He is taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stock of maize and beans cereal. 

He will his profits to repay the loan. His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To add stocks of maize and beans cereals.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells clothes in her boutique in Naivasha town. 

After paying a previous loan on time, she has applied for her third loan from the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business and pay school fees with her anticipated profits.

In the near future, Rose hopes to be among the famous boutique owners in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sale.
